Similar to Balderdash, players have to create captions for photographs which one player then reads out. Scores are awarded for each guess of your false answer, for guessing the correct answer etc.

name: Wok & Roll
description:
Contents: 1 Wok, 4 Chopsticks, 4 Bowls, Play Food
Object of the game: When the wok is empty, the player with the most food is the winner.

Requires 2 AA batteries. Turn switch on and the wok will start spinning. Use your chopsticks to pick up food from the wok and place into your bowl.
publishers: Chad Valley Co Ltd., International Playthings, Inc., Talentoy

name: Monte Carlo
description: Thirty-six tiles numbered one through nine of four colors are dealt to the players. Each player has twelve chips to use to make bids based on which the players will play combination of tiles. As combinations are made, the players receive their rewards. The first player to score a predetermined number of chips is the winner.
publishers: ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Grow Jogos e Brinquedos

name: Scrabble: The Beatles Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Beatles Edition of Scrabble allows players to enjoy traditional Scrabble game play or rock the house with a customized Beatles theme. All you need are custom HELP! cards and words related to the Fab Four to earn bonus points. Draw black wooden letter tiles from a custom Beatles tile bag and place them onto customized tile racks. It's Scrabble with a twist that's sure to be a number one hit.

name: Boss Fight
description:
Boss Fight is a hybrid of slower-paced collectible card games and quick, highly accessible social card games. Magic and Uno had a baby.

In Boss Fight, players take on the role of bosses in a fantasy RPG dungeon competing to land the killing blow on an adventuring Hero. Doing the most damage has no bearing on the victor -- whoever ends the Hero's life wins. It will require careful use of devious Traps, disruptive Spells, and convenient Loot drops to ensure you will become the Final Boss!

Boss Fight is NOT a collectible card game. Every pack contains the same cards in the same quantities. No need to break the bank hoping to find the one card that will make your game "work."

The game is designed for two to five players. Most games take 10 to 20 minutes to complete, making it the perfect game for those looking for a quick game that doesn't sacrifice strategic challenge.

Accessible and friendly play are central concepts of Boss Fight's design. Simple core rules combine with descriptive cards to create a smooth and short learning experience, while careful design limits the tense, confrontational feeling that can emerge in many strategic card games.

In short, it's fun, fast!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Flowering Snail
description:
Flowering Snail is a refreshing abstract game that challenges players to plan ahead over the two stages of the game! Players compete against each other by increasing their snail population. You need to place your snail cards and flower cards wisely to claim the delicious flowers (for the snails, of course), and maintain your snail population to score the most points!

The game is played in two phases: Multiplication and Die Out phases. In the Multiplication phase, players alternates to place their Snail cards (with values 1 to 3) onto the game board adjacent to other snails already there. As an additional action, they may also place one Flower card onto the game board. After all Snail and Flower cards are placed, players check who controls each Flower cards by adding the values on their Snail cards. The higher sum may take the adjacent Flower card as scores.

In Die Out phase, players alternate to remove Snails cards from the game board if the chosen Snail card has a lower value than all the other adjacent Snail cards, until no more Snail cards can be removed. Each remaining Snail card scores the printed value for its owner, and each Flower cards worths 2 VP. The player with higher VP wins the games.

name: Trivia Crack
description:
A board game based off of the popular app of the same name.

Answer questions about US history, sports, science, geography, art, and entertainment. The first player to collect all 6 character tokens wins.

On a player's turn, they spin a spinner and answer a question from the category on which the spinner lands (ie: lands on Science, the player is asked a question from the top card of the Science deck).

If the player is correct, they move their game piece one space t the right and they spin again to attempt to answer another question. If their answer was incorrect, their turn is over.

When a player reaches a crown space on the game board or spins the Crown on the spinner, that player has a chance to earn a character token from a chosen category. If they are correct, they receive the token and return to the beginning space and make their way back to the crown, otherwise they simply return to the beginning space without the token.

name: Crabs Adjust Humidity: Volume Seven (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
From the publisher:

Volume Seven of the unofficial 3rd-party expansion to the hit party game Cards Against Humanity.

Here at VSC, we needed to take some time off to really figure some stuff out. It was like, one day we were working away at our desks and it just hit us all at once: what have we even been doing here, man? Like, does it really mean anything, you know?

Within days we were backpacking into the mountains of Costa Rica, where we met a man named Raúl. The weeks we spent with Raúl changed us in ways we can’t even begin to describe. When we emerged from the jungle, we brought with us two things: a newly reborn sexual identity and Crabs Adjust Humidity: Volume Seven.

Raúl spoke no English, but by the glow of firelight he taught us things that opened our chakras and brought forth another deck of 112 cards so ethically lacking, they’ve truly earned the name Crabs Adjust Humidity.
Includes: 80 white cards, 32 black cards
Part of a complete breakfast.
For recreational use only.
—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Marvel: Eye Found It!
description: Search for hundreds of hidden illustrations in the Marvel Universe in Marvel: Eye Found It! while visiting Wakanda, Asgard, and everywhere in between on a large game board with your favorite Marvel characters.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Party of 4: Fortunes Found in Dungeons Deep
description:
Party of 4: Fortunes Found in Dungeons Deep is a physical SOLO Hero-crafting, Dungeon-delving and Treasure-looting board game. Assemble a Party of wannabe Heroes, Train them to “not die too fast” and then Point them towards Fame and Fortune (or humiliating Defeat and Destitution)! Party of 4 is a physical game; not digital or Print-n-Play.

Heroes may be forged in battle or molded by the mysteries of the Arcane or toughened in shadowy urban alleyways, but first they must be (dice) rolled into existence.

Enroll your Adventurers in the best schools, academies and apprenticeships in the Realm (as long as they are super cheap and have crazy low admissions standards, anyway). Recruit graduates (or loser dropouts!) to form a Party of 4 heroically brave and / or extremely gullible Adventurers to Explore Forgotten Ruins, Battle Fearsome Monsters and Loot Unique Treasures (or everything that is not nailed down... and maybe even some things that ARE nailed down!).

Players create characters, train them and send them on dungeon crawling adventures to gather loot. The game ends when the characters return from dungeon (or die trying).

name: Pride & Preju-Dice
description:
Thematic roll and write set in Georgian England. You are a society matchmaker, using your dice rolls to build relationships between the 4 suitors. Each suitor has it's own mini-game to progress to build up romantic and/or financial connections between the suitors.

Play solo, or race against friends, to maximise your points. The game ends when a player either complete matches between all 4 suitors, or makes too many mistakes.

name: Letter Snake
description: Letter Snake is a roll-and-write word game. Roll the dice and slither around the grid by inking in words. Complete the objectives listed on the game sheet to win
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game, Spelling

name: Miniature Air Hockey
description:
A home version of the arcade game where you use flippers to send the puck to the opposite end of the rink. This is a reduced size so that it can easily be played on a table.

Both players stand at opposite ends of the rink. Put the puck in play and frantic flipping becomes the order of the day. Whoever scores the most goals, wins.

name: Duelo: Kung-fu
description:
The Kung Fu master of his temple is aging. His movements are not as fast as before and he's increasingly tired. He realizes that he will not be around much longer, and is in a hurry to choose his successor. You are one of the most prepared candidates to be the next master, but this task will not be easy because there can only be one master. There will be several duels ahead ...

In Duelo: Kung Fu, players are masters of various martial arts styles invited to the big tournament that will determine who will be the new Master of Kung-Fu. To win the tournament, you should eliminate your opponents by knockout competition or winning more duels than them when the time is up.

On your turn, you can choose to fight with one of your opponents or reflect to better prepare for a future duel.
If you opt for reflection, play the card face up and use the first effect. If you choose the combat, play a card face down and choose an opponent. That player must place a card from his hand face down and then both are revealed. Activate the second effect of the card. Who ever has the greater focus(the number on top left) wins the duel. The winner draws a card as a prize and puts the defeated card in his victory pile.

Each style has its strengths and weaknesses. Explore them to be the winner!

name: Viele Tiere
description:
Viele Tiere is a collection of three games of increasing complexity for small children. All games involve a set of 34 cards that depict animals. Large animals may require up to 4 cards (the pictures are too big to fit on a single card) and small animals take only 1. The cards start shuffled and face-down.

Game 1: Small and Big Animals

Each player in turn flips a card. If you notice a complete animal on your turn then you collect all of the cards that make up the animal. If someone doesn't notice an animal then you can pick it up on your turn in addition to flipping a card and possibly picking up another animal. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Game 2: Quick Zookeepers

Same as above but the animal goes to the first player to touch a zoo keeper card with the same background colour.

Game 3: Chaos in the Zoo

This is played like the card game Memory. Flip cards until you get a complete animal or mismatched parts. Take complete animals and turn mismatched ones face down for the next player.

name: Apokalypse
description:
In Apokalypse each player gets a hidden card that gives him his game goal. There are two different cards, good and evil. The Good players can win all together, but only one Evil player can win.

On your turn you can play a population card, if you put it on the Good side you must give one of the cards from your hand to another player. If you put it on the Evil side you can steal a card from another player. You can also play cards to protect your population from the Apokalypse riders.

The game ends after the 4th Apokalypse rider.

The Good players win when all player's populations are more Good than Evil, and the Good players have scored more points than the evil players. The Evil player wins when the populations are more Evil than Good, and the Evil players have more points than the Good players, but only the evil player with the most points win.

name: Wind Runner
description:
The skinniest and the weirdest race begins right now! You – yes, you – have received an invitation to participate in the "skinnies" race, a race in which only skinny people can compete. Problem is, the stadium that holds the race has incredibly strong winds that can blow skinny people like you in directions you don't want to go. Can you win this race against the competitors and the devil winds?

In Wind Runner, players have a runner and a hand of seven action cards. Each turn in a round, the first player rolls the wind direction and speed dice to determine whether the wind is blowing north or south and how quickly. Players then each secretly choose an action card in hand, then reveal them and resolve them, starting with the player farthest down the track. The cards let players move forward, move sideways, swap places with another runner, reverse the wind (!), ignore the wind, or move a barricade. Afterwards, players then move forward or backward according to the wind – but if a player or a barricade blocks the wind, then you receive no benefit (or penalty) from it.

After six turns, players pick up all their cards and start a new round. The game ends after 3-5 rounds (depending on the number of players) or as soon as a runner reaches the finish line.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid

name: Missing Match-Ups: Sesame Street
description: Missing Match-Ups is a memory game with a Sesame Street theme recommended for ages 3-8. Plastic playing pieces are set up in punched-out holes in the game board to conceal a sheet with pictures underneath. Each player on his or her turn chooses two pieces to lift up, and tries to match the pictures underneath. If the pictures match, the player keeps the pieces which covered them and picks up two more pieces If the pictures do not match, the pieces are replaced and play passes to the next player. The player with the most pieces at the end of the game wins.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle

name: Othello Mod
description:
Othello without a board. Players alternate placing cards with white or black circles. Like Othello, each new card must bracket cards of the opponent's color. Bracketed cards are flipped to the other side.

Each player has five "stop" disks that can be used prevent cards from being flipped. Much of the strategy of the game is in making good use of them. (User description.)

Contents:
50 Othello Mod Cards
10 "Stop" disks

name: Harry Potter Spellcasters
description: A charade game with a magical spin! There are Spell cards and Guessing cards that mirror each other. The Spellcaster draws a card, keeping it hidden from view. Using the wand, they follow the spell drawn out on the card. When a player guesses right, the Spellcaster keeps their Spell card! The first person who points at the correct Guessing card wins the card and becomes the next Spellcaster. Each spell has a special challenge on the back that the new Spellcaster will have to endure while they're practicing their magic! Whoever collects the most total cards (Spell and Guess cards combined) is the winner!

name: Avista Pro
description:
Avista Pro is a sister game to Avista. Players try to find out a word matching the conditions on cards. First card gives a subject and second card gives initial letter for the word.

Avista Pro uses more difficult subjects than Avista. They are further divided into three difficulty levels: easy, moderate, and difficult.

Avista Pro is really just the 2nd edition of Avista, rather than a self-standing game; the rules are exactly the same, the number of cards is exactly the same, and the first edition already had three difficulty levels; whether the subject matters are more difficult or not is arguable.

name: Trilogía del Destino: Faunos
description:
From the box:

We go hunting at the beginning of all eras. But it’s necessary to be very clever. To be able to hunt the greater amount and variety of animals is privilege of few. But take care! You have saboteurs around you. Be careful not to wake up envies it in the other hunters, because if they realize you have more animals than them, they will make them disappear.

Each turn, players must choose between a set of animals displayed in the table and put them in front of themselves. They must be very careful not to pick too many animals of the same kind, because the player that has the most animals of a kind loses all of them at the end of the game. Then players count their points. The game ends after several rounds when a player has reached 40 points.

name: Napoleon's Russian Campaign
description: A strategic game of the 1812-13 campaign. Game comes in a zip-lock bag with about 100 die cut counters. The map is a strategic view of Russia from St. Petersburg, the Polish border to Moscow. The French and their allies must choose Moscow, St. Petersburg or both as the Russians must try to prevent this or destroy Napoleon’s army without being destroyed themselves.

name: Sinbad
description:
Sinbad
A game of excitement and adventure from the Columbia Pictures "Sinbad" Movies

Players start at Bagdad and each select one of the four voyages: "Gulf of Fear", "Bay of Horrors", "Sea of Monsters", or "Impossible Ocean". Each sea has four islands guarded by monsters. Three treasures are placed on each island.

Players use a spinner to move around the four islands. When landing on the right spot, they may also spin to get treasure. Guess the spin means success. Some spots give the opportunity for treasure, but also mean a monster must be fought. Other spots move the player back a space.

When one player completes his journey, the round ends and whoever has the most treasure wins. Players then change voyages and continue until each player has made all four voyages. The player with the highest treasure score after all four voyages wins the game.
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: A to Z Electronic
description:
From a Major Fun review:

Electronic version of A to Z .

A to Z Electronic is attractive, engaging, and far more convenient than the old version. No chips to lose. No boards to keep track of. You don't even need to keep the box. The category cards fit nicely into a compartment on the back of the game. And everything else is integrated into the device.

It is a more compelling version, but expect to spend some time figuring out the buttons and lights.

But A to Z, in any form, is a wonderfully adaptable and fun game. Because there are so few components (the device and the cards) and so many lights, the electronic version most definitely adds to the attractiveness and the sheer delight of it all.
categories: Electronic, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Compass and Empire
description:
Compass and Empire is a Print and Play Game themed for the Aether Captains world

Played with 6 dice, five dice showing the Emperor, Lady and Compass faces, and one die known as the ‘Roundabout’, this game is for two to four players. You will also need the provided set of 12 tokens (or coins if the officers are elsewhere).

Play:
At the start of a game the following number of tokens are placed in the center of the playing area, depending on the number of players taking part:

4 players: 3 Emperor tokens, 6 Compass tokens, and 3 Lady tokens
3 players: 2 Emperor tokens, 4 Compass tokens, and 2 Lady tokens
2 players: 1 Emperor tokens, 2 Compass tokens, and 1 Lady token

Choose who goes first.

Players, clockwise in turn, roll the dice once and try to get five-of-a-kind. Players may keep as many of the previous player's dice and roll the remaining ones in their turn.

A player who rolls 5 Compass tokens (regardless if it is the Compass or the Marked Compass) claims one Compass token from the center. A player who rolls 5 Emperor tokens claims one Emperor token from the center. A player who rolls 5 Lady tokens claims one Lady token from the center.

Once a player has made five-of-a-kind and claimed their reward, the next player rolls all the dice to start the next round. If a player is unable to claim their reward from the center because there are none left, they may take one from another player.

If 3 Marked Compass die faces are rolled that player may take the ‘roundabout’ die to use during future turns; rolling it once when taking it to determine its use during the time the player has control of it. The player can only lose that die if another player rolls 3 Marked Compasses and takes it from them.

This die gives the player the following bonuses:

The Engineer - the player is allowed to take a token on a 4 of a kind
(a crafty engineer always makes the best of a situation)

The Mistress - the player allowed to take a 2nd roll of any dice they choose
(one girl here and one girl there)

The Cutpurse - the player can choose one die which will be locked and
cannot be re-rolled by an adjacent player to their left or right as indicated by the die
(the left hand never knows what the right is doing)

The Alchemist - the player may choose any token in center not yet taken
i.e. acts as a 5 wild
(lead turns to gold)

The Spy - The Roundabout die is lost by that player and placed back in the center
(your secrets will gain you nothing)

The first player to hold a Emperor, Lady and two Compass tokens wins the game.

this game is based on the ancient roman game Jactus
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Loco Lingo Fastgrasp
description:
From Publisher:

This is a game packed full with ideas and suggestions, stories, riddles, and poems all about the pieces included. It is a fun way to aid development of language skills, imagination, concentration, and reactions. For 1-6 players and a reader. Please note: This game can be played without the other games in the Ratz Fatz series. For ages 3-12.

As the poems and stories are read by the reader (and players are encouraged to make up their own) the players attempt to be the first to grasp the appropriate wooden object when it is referred to in the story. The game can also be played with one player. making the game more of an activity for the reader and player.

name: 8bit Trick
description:
8bit Trick is simple trick taking game themed after 8 bit video games.

Players play 3 rounds and aim to take just "8" tricks.
If you get less than 8, you drop out.
If you get more than 8, your score decreases.

There are 2 additional mechanics, "Flip Card" and "Black +3 Card".

name: Paper Soccer
description:
From wikipedia:

This paper and pencil game starts on an empty field of 8×10 boxes with goals of two boxes wide on the baselines. In the beginning, a virtual ball is placed in the center of the field, on the crossing of the paper lines. Players move the ball in turns and aim to place it in the opponents goal.

In one turn, the ball may be moved into one of the eight paper line crossings around it (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) and a segment from the original position to the new one is drawn to mark the move. The ball may move neither on the game field border nor on the segments marking the past moves but it bounces from them, i.e. a player who moves the ball into a position where there is already an end of a segment or a game field border gets another turn.

The first player to place the ball in the opponents goal wins the game. The game may also end when a player does not have a valid move (he or she loses automatically).

name: Worker Placement: Cash Is King
description: Big money jobs are up for grabs, and now with Worker Placement: Cash Is King up to eight players can battle for temp agency supremacy in The City! In addition to the extra player tokens and new rules included in this expansion, you'll also find over one hundred new game cards including three new card types: rental buildings, exclusive job contracts, and double skills.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Quiddler Mini Round
description: The challenge in Quiddler Mini Round, a smaller version of Quiddler, is to arrange your entire hand into words. Players draw and discard in turn, trying to use their high point letters and not get caught with them in hand. You can play using everyday words, and a bonus is given for the most words created in each round as well as for the longest word.

name: Aktienrausch
description: Players in Aktienrausch buy and sell shares in six different companies in order to make money. Cash is represented by cards which do double duty: in a dividend round, the money paid to the different companies for their stock is played out in an unusual way to determine the dividend payments. Another key aspect of the game is deciding when to take profits as cash and when to put it in one's Swiss bank account: cash is necessary to buy stock but the Swiss bank account balance is what wins the game.

name: Speedeebee!
description:
In Speedeebee!, players race to complete challenges presented to them while using – or not using! – the letters rolled on four dice.

Each round players are presented with a challenge on one of the fifty challenge cards; each card has three challenges, and the challenge to be used is determined by the color on the back of the challenge card previously won. Someone reads off the challenge – for example, name something taller than five feet starting with one of the rolled letters – then the player rolls the letter dice. Whoever calls dibs first and names something correctly wins the card; if a player makes a wrong guess, he's penalized one card that he claimed previously.

Whoever has the most cards after going through twenty challenge cards wins!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Real-time, Word Game

name: Slasher Flick
description:
From the publisher:

Slasher Flick: Revenge of the Bogeyman in Exciting 2-D
"This Butcher Does More Than Bring Home the Bacon!"

Simulates the action in body-count movies such as Halloween, Friday the 13th, Silent Scream and others. One player represents the Bogeyman, a superhuman maniacal mass murderer, and the other takes the part of the collection of victims he intends to murder. Movement of the 14 characters including a Bus Driver, Whiz Kid, Football Player, Surfer, BMOC, Biker, ROTC, Psych Major, Cheerleader, Jockette, Preppie, Valley Girl, Ingenue takes place on the map. The victims try to stay alive as long as possible. Each character has a unique set of attributes for movement, special abilities, disadvantages and damage.

Can be played as a board role-playing game (and thus expanded past just two players). One player takes the role of the Bogeyman; other players take the roles of only a few of the victims. This can lead to some animated conversation between the Victim players, sounding suspiciously like the real thing.

Developed by Aaron Allston. Art by Paul McCall. Map art by J. David George.

Published in Fantasy Gamer #1.
mechanics: Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Cohorts: Game of Roman Checkers
description: Cohorts is one of the oldest board games. Played on a larger board than Checkers, it allows more variations but simpler than Chess. This was TSR's 3rd in its "Famous Authors Series" with the rules prepared by L. Sprague de Camp. 2 players. Ages 10 & up.

name: Winter Pause
description:
This is a free "indoor soccer" board game for two players. The game may be downloaded from www.krimsu.de
The game components consist of a player board ( two identical jpeg files ) English rules ( or German )and a sheet of counters.
You play a coach in charge of directing five players and a keeper on a board consisting of 9x14 (126) squares. Each turn you roll three dice and may use them to dribble, pass, or run. Generally you may only use one die per soccer player and move in one direction as is the case in dribbling. If you are running a player without the ball, or if you are passing or shooting, you may use the pips on another die to change directions ( curve ) and move in that new direction. Movement points are flexible, in that you do not have to use the maximum amount shown on the die if you don't want to, but direction of travel is usually linear unless you use the second die as mentioned above. The components ( especially the field which you have to print twice ) are beautiful.

name: CoMotion: The Competitive Game of Communicative Gestures
description: Race against the clock and your opponents, in this fast and furious game of charades. Players throw the dice, pick a card and act out a word or phrase. Sound too simple? Here's the catch: you may be going head-to-head with all of your opposing teams, acting out different words all at the same time! The quicker your team guesses, the greater your chances to win. A fun, interactive game that's a great icebreaker for any gathering.

name: Timberrr!
description:
The box says: Timberrr! a suspense action balancing game. Fun for all ages. Don't topple the towering tree. Will you be the one to holler, "Timberrr?" Let the chips fall where they may.

The big box contains a 2 feet high plastic tree. The aim of the game is to remove and replace pieces at the bottom of the tree. Each player is dealt five saw and axe-cards. Two saw-cards or axe-cards remove a small or big chip, two broken saw-cards or broken-axes cards add a chip. The one who removes the chip that topples the tree loses the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Scrabble Got a Minute
description: Seven cubes with red letters (no point values) are encased in a clear 3x3x3 cube & with a minute sand timer. You have 1 minute to find as many words using the 7 letters.

name: Moscow Attacked
description:
Moscow Attacked is one of Lou Coatney's various FREE Games available on his site as per his guidelines, dealing with the German's attempts to wrest the Soviet Capital away, before the onset of Winter during 1941. It appears to be more detailed than the previously released FREE Game of "Battle for Moscow" by GDW and he urges folks to get them BOTH and compare the 'results'.

The game is available for FREE at http://LCoat.tripod.com/moscatt.htm
categories: Dice, Fighting, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Speechless
description:
In Speechless, players form teams and attempt to guess what word or phrase one of their team mates is drawing.

Players take turns to move around the board based on the results of a die roll. On landing on a space, the nominated artist draws one card and starts sketching the category of word or phrase that is coded to the color of the space landed on. The team has roughly one minute - the time it takes for a steel ball to run down the timer track - to guess the answer. If the team guesses incorrectly, they lose their turn. Certain spaces give an extra minute to guess or allows other teams to take part (and win the turn to move).

The first team to reach the ending spot wins the game.
publishers: Buffalo Games, BV Leisure Ltd, Don Scott Associates, Goliath Games

name: Display
description:
Magazine game in Jeux et Stratégie #5.

You play a group of "bits" (0/1) and must travel in an electronic circuit to reach the display first.
publishers: Jeux & Stratégie, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: Fauna
description:
"Fauna" was originally inspired by the traditional Chinese "Animal Game".
It is played on an 18 x 14 board. Both players have a set of 8 hierarchically ordered animal pieces (elephant, polar bear, tiger, lion, wolf, dog, cat, mouse) and 2 humans (woman and man).
Bigger animals win against smaller animals, with two exceptions: The mouse beats the elephant, and the dog beats the polar bear.
Humans are the weakest pieces; they lose against any animal.
To win, you have to either cross the board with one of your humans, or eliminate one of the opponent's humans.
Play is card-driven. For each piece (animal or human) there are 9 cards with values 1,2,2,3,3,3,4,4,5. There's also an identical set of joker cards, which can be used for any of the pieces.
Players choose their cards from a hand of 7, one per turn, to move the corresponding piece.

There's a page dedicated to "Fauna"

http://www.terra.es/personal2/u.roth/fa-00.htm

where, among other things, you can find the rules in English, German and Catalan, all graphics (board, pieces cards) for download and do-it-yourself instructions.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Print & Play

name: GROPOS Master Book
description:
From the publisher:

Because YOU demanded it - Ground Combat in the Babylon 5 Universe is here! GROPOS (Ground Pounders) stand ready to begin their assault on outposts, cities, and planetary surfaces near you! Command tanks such as the Earth Odin, Minbari Chrystalis, Narn D'Va'Tren, and Centauri Hexus in your bid to overwhelm the enemy with raw, nail-biting firepower! Do anything a futuristic ground combat unit can do - call in orbital strikes, zip low over the ground in VTOLs, hide in dense urban areas, customize units with optional equipment and officers - and much more! The GROPOS Core Rules also serve as the entry point to the new MAXIM rules system, which will allow you to play ground battles in nearly any setting throughout history and beyond!
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame

name: The Glass Bead Game
description:
The Glass Bead Game was created by the Dutch game inventor Christian Freeling in the late 1970s. It was named after the final novel of the German writer Hermann Hesse which was published in 1943 ("Das Glasperlenspiel"). Hesse was put on the Black List of the Nazis while living as a refugee in Switzerland. After continental Europe was liberated, Hesse was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1946. Freeling's game is one of many conceptualizations that were inspired by Hesse's novel.

The game differs from most traditional Mancala games in having counters with different values. Another unusual concept of the game is that there are two types of capturing (direct and indirect). The game can be played online at Freeling's homepage.

name: Wimmelwurm
description:
Blackbirds have dinner in the meadow after rain: worms are coming up. The blackbirds try to catch them, but the worms are to fast and they withdraw in the earth.
This game is played in the box. A board shows a beautiful meadow with many worms. They form pairs: if you drag the head of one worm, an other is torn in the earth.
Each player tries to pull the right worms, so that the blackbirds from the other players lose their worm. Each time you can do that, you win a worm card. Winner of the game is that player who has most worm cards.

name: Front Porch Classics Baseball
description:
From the publisher:

“Play ball!” Now your whole family can experience America's greatest pastime with Front Porch Classics Baseball . A tribute to the grand old ballparks of yesteryear, this exquisitely detailed pinball-style Rec Room game provides fun on a grand scale. Forget the batteries and gather round. Players young and old launch the pinball and swing the bat to hit singles, doubles, triples and homeruns. Record each batter's performance on actual scorecards, while keeping track of runs scored on the stadium scoreboard.

name: Gazootch
description:
From the Manufacturer:

The fast-paced, high-stakes dice game with a Vendetta! Unleash your inner risk-taker and earn huge rewards, or reversals. Play, prey, and maybe pray...but watch out for the Vendetta, the ultimate dirty trick that lets you make new enemies at twice your normal speed. We would tell you more, but then we'd have to.. well.. you know. Game comes with playing mat, dice, and cups. Ages 8 and up, for 2 or more players.

name: Muchachada Nui: el juego de mesa
description:
This is a card game based on a Spanish TV show of "strange" humor and parodies for 3-4 players. You'll find many characters from this program and have some laughs. In the game of Muchachada Nui the players, in the paper of surrealistic television producers, pay the cache of important Celebrities to gain hearing points. The first program that arrives to the maximum level of hearing will be proclaimed as the winner. Just play the cards to get points as you use your Celebrities and cards to stop other players in this TV race.

From the publisher:

There is a hollow in the grill of programming of Spanish television. The managers are very worried and hopelessly looking for a new program. As young producer you must prepare your best TV program of varieties and you have a great list of personalities for it. Contract the surrealistic Celebrities, discover to the public the most incredible histories and create a spectacular Plate to captivate the spectators. Only the program with more success will finish within the programming!

But care, the Celebrities that you can contract not only attracts the hearing. All has special qualities: Samantha Fox and Sabrina Salerno attract masculine Celebrities of the program of an opponent, Bud Spencer can leave them out of action with a hand strike and you do not want to know what happens when Chuck Norris appears in action. Freddy Krueger has nightmares with Chuck Norris!

Also it adds to your program special sections like the Tertulianos, the Tontiploster, the Klamstein or the Consultation of Junior Rappel to call even more the attention of the spectators and decorates your Plate with diverse styles, to everyone more baroque, to have the perfect aspect. It is not a shame if they say: You, Baroque!

Will you have suitable assistants? Marcial, El Bonico del to, Enjuto Mojamuto, Riken Sproken, the Tridente Catacroker. The tragedy is in the atmosphere! The VHS tape will gonna jump through the window!

Muchachada Nui is a card game for three or four players of thirteen years or more. You will be able to play a game of thirty to sixty minutes, but maybe you’ll get caught for some hours...


En español:

Hay un hueco en la parrilla de programación de televisión española. Los directivos están muy preocupados y buscan un nuevo programa desesperadamente. Como joven productor debes preparar tu mejor programa televisivo de variedades y para ello cuentas con un gran elenco de personalidades. Contrata a las más rutilantes Celebrities, descubre al público las historias más increíbles y crea un espectacular Plató para cautivar a la audiencia. ¡Sólo el programa con más éxito acabará dentro de la programación!

En el juego de Muchachada Nui los jugadores, en el papel de surrealistas productores de televisión, pagan el caché de importantes Celebrities para ganar puntos de audiencia. El primer programa que llegue al máximo nivel de audiencia será proclamado vencedor.

Pero cuidado, las Celebrities que puedes contratar no sólo atraen a la audiencia. Todas tienen cualidades especiales... Samantha Fox y Sabrina Salerno atraen a Celebrities masculinas del programa de un oponente, Bud Spencer puede dejarlas fuera de combate de una tollina y no quieras saber que ocurre cuando Chuck Norris aparece en acción. ¡Freddy Krueger tiene pesadillas con Chuck Norris!

Por si fuera poco, añade a tu programa secciones especiales como Los Tertulianos, Los Tontiploster, Los Klamstein o La Consulta del Joven Rappel para llamar más la atención de los espectadores y decora tu Plató con diversos estilos, a cada cual más barroco, para tener la envoltura perfecta. Que no te avergüence que te digan ¡Barroco tú!

¿Seguro que contarás con ayudantes adecuados? Marcial, El Bonico del to, Enjuto Mojamuto, Riken Sproken, El Tridente Catacroker... ¡La tragedia se masca en el ambiente! ¡La cinta VHS está a punto de saltar por la ventana!

Muchachada Nui: El juego de mesa es un juego que se juega con cartas para tres o cuatro jugadores de trece años o más. Podréis echar una partida de treinta a sesenta minutos, aunque luego os liáis y os pueden dar las tantas.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sanzaru
description:
Monkeys are naturally born pranksters. They are also creatures of very high morality standards... it’s only these standards keep changing. In this trick taking game, you’ll discover this.

The second edition of the game has received a major overhaul both in components and rules. I consider the game to be in a happy place and the development to be done. Enjoy!

name: Hot Wheels Speed Rallye
description:
Speed Rallye is a dice-driven racing game with a co-operative element. A player wins when his car reaches the finish line first, but all players lose if the neutral black car wins the race.

On his turn a player rolls the die and moves any car he wants and which hasn't been moved in this turn yet. After moving a car, the corresponding car chip is flipped upside down. The next player rolls the die, then chooses from the remaining available cars (face up chips). After all cars have been played, the car chips are flipped face up again and play continues.

The racing track comprises four, two-sided modular boards. Each board has various action fields on each side.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hamsterkauf
description:
A children's game about counting and additions.

Basic idea: The hamsters are on a frantic shopping spree - they'll buy whatever they find. The only thing that counts is that they can collect as many nuts as possible because they get a certain number of nuts per purchase. This isn't as easy as it sounds, though, as they have to calculate the exact total for their purchase, and if they make a mistake, another hamster will be happy.

Aim of the game and how it is played: The aim of the game is to collect item cards with as many nuts printed on them as possible. Each item card also has a price printed on it. There is always one item card fewer at the center of the table than there are players. The players have to use some of their bank notes to exactly reach the price of one of the items in the middle of the table (e.g. if there is an item that costs 837 and another that costs 1200, they can choose the 800 and the 37 banknote, or the 800 and 400). Some items are worth more nuts than others. All players do the calculating simultaneously. If a player thinks they have put together a correct set of banknotes, they put the banknotes face down in front of him/herself and puts his/her hamster on the item card to reserve it. Once all the items have been reserved, the hamsters proceed to the checkout: all players check if the cards are correct (i.e. make up the exact price of the item). If they are, the player earns that item. If they aren't, this hamster doesn't get any card this round. The player who hasn't managed to reserve an item (there is always one item fewer than there are players) gets lucky if another player has miscalculated: he/she gets the item that player has reserved.

The game ends when there are no item cards left. The player with the most nuts wins the game.

There is also an "expert" variant of the game, which includes a memory element.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Number

name: Once Upon a Time... Man
description: This is an educational game. You are rolling dices to move around the board - depending on the field you stay on - you earn some cards (you can use them against your oponent or to defense yourself) or get questions (correct answer give you positive points). The goal is to score as many points.

name: Alien Uprising: Rex Nova Expansion
description: Alien Uprising: Rex Nova Expansion adds a new crew member — a navigator — to Alien Uprising. This expansion contains an additional player miniature with a blue base, a Rex Nova player board, and his deck of crewman cards.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Octave Dugland
description:
Playful Squirrel Octave Dugland invites you to a game of bluff.

To start the game, each player takes a fixed set of 6 cards, composed of: 2x "1", 2x "4" and 1x 3, 5, 6 and -3.

The principle is quite simple: the active player challenges one of the other squirrels by placing one of his cards face down. The challenged one then responds in the same way of placing one of its card face down.

Then all the other players must bet on the outcome of the duel with one of their remaining cards.
Much is at stake because if you bet on the winner, you win his card. By cons, if you bet on the wrong squirrel he is one who wins the bet card. Additionally, the winner of the duel wins both cards that were used in the challenge.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Memory

name: Ganz Wien
description:
From the box:

"Welcome to Vienna!
This city is not only a world famous cultural hub, it is in fact the city with the highest quality of urban life on our planet. A huge amount of museums await the public with unique art and science exhibitions. From the world famous opera to clubs, from shopping to recreational areas - all are easily reached by public transport. There are many charming cafés which serve cake specialities or the viennese favourite, the "Melange" to strengthen tourists on their way. Vienna has something to offer any taste - day or night!"

This simple game is played on a city map of Vienna. The map features stations of public transport facilites: underground, bus and tramway. At the beginning of the game, a player's pawn is put on a random station. He then draws a number of destination cards showing the stations he must visit in order to win the game.

On his turn, a player rolls five special dice, showing the symbols "underground", "bus" and "tramway". He then moves his pawn from station to station, using only the transport facilities his dice offers him. If he reaches a station which corresponds with one of his destination cards, he may discard that destination card.
You win the game if you have visited all destinations on all your destination cards.

name: Chaos & Alchemy: Magnum Opus Kickstarter Promo Card
description:
A promo card for those who backed Chaos & Alchemy during the Kickstarter campaign.

It states:
When Magnum Opus comes into your laboratory, you must discard all card s in your hand and destroy one of your Innovations. If Magnum Opus is your only Innovation, you must destroy it.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Renaissance

name: The Foreign King: Railroad / Catholic Against Liberals
description:
A small package which contains 2 mini expansions:
- The Railroad Expansion
- the Catholic against liberals Expansion

The rulebook also contains rules for a 3th mini expansion: Riots, but since this was promised to be a Kickstarter Exclusive, the tokens are missing.

Railroad Expansion

Who will rule the Belgian Railroads?
Adds the opportunity to build railroads at a price. During the end game scoring, the longest railroad generates points.

Catholic Against Liberals Expansion

Which Faction will get the most Political influence?
During the game there are opportunities to convert Provinces to your faction (Catholic, Liberal, Neutral). During end game scoring, the faction which controls more Provinces gains Points. This adds an interesting twist to the 4 player game, where 2 players will be working together!

name: Richest Rascal
description:
Richest Rascal, first released as Strongest Bully, is a game about kid hierarchy! The players are all kids, wanting to be the boss kid in the neighborhood. They all bring their toys, and start bragging and stealing them from each other. You must share your stolen toys with your pals, but there's the rub: each toy is valued differently for all your pals. And if they're not content, they'll just say no!

How much can you handle this unfairness? How will you share your toys?

name: Multibloom
description: Playing this game, the children will find themselves very busy with all kinds of fun activities: planting flowers on flowerbeds, uprooting them if necessary, and also arranging surprises (both pleasant and not) for their opponents. But the players’ principal objective is to properly fulfil the orders by growing the exact number of flowers requested by their customers. In the course of the game, children learn in practice that to fulfil an order of 18 flowers, they should have grow 3 flowerbeds with 6 flowers each. Such visual examples will stick in their mind for a long time.

name: Inuit
description:
GREENLAND circa 1200 CE

The nomadic Inuit peoples of the Arctic were masters in using kayaks to catch fish. The frozen waters where icebergs drifted past rocky islands, were teeming with Greenland cod, halibut, haddock, and arctic char. They rowed out in search of their favorite fish and a balanced diet of all four sorts of fish.

Push a row of tiles on a 8 x 8 square board to stir the waters, ready to catch shoals of the same sort of fish. Catch the fish, by removing as many tiles in adjacent groups of the same color as you can.

Who do you dare to let know which is your family’s favorite fish? Could they help you?

—description from the designer

name: Friends of a Feather
description:
Four little birds are missing their tail feathers, and need your help to find them! Add feathers to your bird each turn by drawing from the deck, or trading away your unwanted feathers to the nest. Score points at the end of the game based on your colorful collection. The player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Dividend
description:
At first sight Dividend looks and plays like an ordinary four-player trick-taking game. The difference is that when you win a trick you don’t necessarily win all four of its constituent cards – you may, instead, win three, two or only one of them, depending on your position at the beginning of the trick. Thus at the end of a round of 13 tricks you score not for how many tricks but for how many cards you won, which could be anything from under 7 to over 20.
Four can play either solo or, if preferred, in two partnerships, with partners sitting opposite each other and playing alternately to each trick.

name: Das Geheimnis der Zauberer
description:
In a mysterious castle atop a lonely mountain, the world’s greatest magicians gather together to decide who is worthy enough to be accepted into their fraternal order. Acceptance into this powerful alliance is the dream of the entire magical world, but these conjurors do not open their doors easily. Any young apprentice who wishes to join must pass an arduous test.

One by one, the magicians appear in the great Hall of Mirrors. As they multiply, each candidate must look past all illusions to discover each sorcerer’s most precious secret: their magic words of power. Those who guess correctly earn rewards; those who fail slip further and further away. In the end, only the player who correctly identifies the most powers may join this mystical cabal.

name: Happy Fox
description:
Be as cunning as a fox!
Each player in turn places a card in front of them: face down if it is a Goose or a Dog, face up if it is a Fox. The player who lays down a Fox card goes on a goose hunt, turning over one of the cards of the player on his left. If it is a goose, he can capture it or continue his hunt by turning over a card of the next player.

But if it's a dog, he loses all the geese cards turned over as well as his fox...

In the end, which fox will be able to boast the biggest catch?

name: Tricolor
description:
Tricolor is a game of pure strategy. In the two person game each player has 18 stackable checkers in his color. If three people play, each one has 11 checkers. The counters are placed on the hexagonal board with fields in different colours. Different colours mean different "strength" for the checkers - the aim is to eliminate all opponents checkers from the board.

The game was invented by the famous Belgian mathematician Maurice Kraitchik who described it for the first time in his book La Mathématique des Jeux (Brussels 1930) on page VII-VIII (introduction) and 470-475 (rules, example games). It is one of the oldest stacking games (older are just Tower of Hanoi, Lasca and Bashni).

name: Flea Market
description:
There is a famous flea market in the Button Town. Merchants and customers all over the world come here to make big deals.

Flea Market is a card game for 2-10 players, which has 6 different sets of rules. Each has its own mechanics but shares the same cards.

Flea Market contains 3 sets of cards, and each set has 54 cards in 6 colors; for each color, there are 9 cards that bear numbers from 1 to 9. There are buttons and special price labels on these cards which have different meanings in each rule.

The 6 Rules:
1.Big Buyers is a card placement game for 2 players. One player is the owner of Red (Toy), Yellow (Porcelain) and Brown (Jewelry) business, the other is the owner of Blue (Clock), Green (Appliance) and Purple (Book) business. Players will first establish a market with 3X4 cards on the table together. Then they try to buy their own business cards to earn the score points, and they also try to avoid buying opponent’s cards which will decrease their score by one point.

2.Big Stalls is an area enclosure game for 2-4 players. Each card played by players stands for a booth. A booth bordered by four other booths will be shut down due to cut-throat competition. The player who accomplishes the surrounding will take profits from the center card. According to the way that he settles the center card, he will get some score or hand cards. He also chooses his main business in the game to gain more profit from this color of booth.

3.Big Investment is a hand management and trading game for 2-4 players. In the beginning of each week, players will create a weekly market forecast pile. The forecast cards will show a trend of valuable products. Each player can do one of five actions in a day to prepare his product storage. After a week, popular products with will have triple or double score. Worthless product will have on score. The game goes for 4 weeks. When the last week ends, the player with the highest total score wins the game.

4.Big Competition is a hand management game for 3-4 players. Players are shop owners in the game. They put their products onto their booths in turn. Cut-throat competition will devaluate products, while abundant supply of products will end the round. When each round ends, the player make the highest price will get money, and the player with the lowest price will have prestige. Players can use money to buy more goods or launch sales promotion. Anyone who has 15 points of prestige wins the game.

5.Big Order is a negotiation and bluffing game for 4-8 players. Players form bidding groups freely by negotiation to finish random orders. Bidding groups compete each other to win the order. Within the winning bidding group, the player who has the smallest investment will divide the order cards to one to several piles. The player who invests most will decide which pile goes to which player (even he is in an opponent group). Each order card will become score points to win the game or hand cards to finish more orders. Player never needs to keep their promise in the game, every one might be betrayed in anytime.

6.Big Rush is an action and memory game for 6-10 players. Players are retailers in the flea market. They want to make more business before Christmas. So they have to attract customers of other retailer with “special price.” They need good memory to remember which customer has big deals and quick action to seduce them from opponents. Therefore, in this game, score points can be earned by playing cards and grabbing for other players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Enclosure, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Me Booty!
description:
A ship full of scallywags and a hold full of loot... it’s time to divvy up the booty. Keep an eye on the crew though, because everyone knows pirates be cheaters! Try to keep the best loot for yourself while giving the worst to your mates! Once all pirates have five treasures, the pirate with the most valuable loot wins.

Me Booty! is a card game for 3 to 6 scallywags. On your turn you must decide to take treasure for yourself, give it to another pirate, or use some sneaky back-stabbing to sabotage your mates.

name: Nut & Nuttier
description:
Creatures from outer space have arrived on Earth and they want to communicate with us, but they need to learn our language.

With Sblap, you have to say words so that the aliens can learn to communicate. This game requires speed, a sharp eye, creativity and memory. Is so appropriate to train memory, attention and creativity capacities and also communication and social skills needed in any social context.

1. Deal all the cards among the players more or less evenly. It doesn't matter if a given player receives an extra card.

2. Each player will form a stack of cards in front of him/her. Cards must be placed face down so that no one can see them.

3. The player with the strangest face begins, by taking a card and placing it face up in the middle of the table, within reach of all the players. Clockwise, each player will take a card and place it in the central stack. The moment two cards showing the same alien or the same letter coincide, any player can cover the central stack with his/her hand and the fastest in doing so must shout out a word beginning with the letter on the covered card.

Then, he/she must take all the cards from the central stack and, mockingly, distribute them how he/she chooses among the remaining players. This player will place a new card in the central deck to continue the game. The cards that players receive are incorporated to their stack of cards at the bottom.

4. The game continues in the same way: the moment two aliens or letters coincide again, any player can cover the central stack with his/her hand and, at that moment, he/she must shout out the preceding word and add a new one beginning with the letter on the card that he/she has just been covered.

Progressively, a word sequence will be formed that must be memorized. If a mistake is made while shouting out the word sequence or if a word is invalid because of a spelling mistake or if he/she has covered the central deck when two cards do not match, the player receives the central stack of cards and places a new card in the central deck to continue the game. The existing word sequence is eliminated and begins to reform.

5. The first player to get rid of all of his/her cards wins the game.
Variations of the game: play using not just real words but also words in other languages, invented words or sounds.
publishers: Cayro, The Games, Edigráfica Games, SimplyFun

name: D6 Shooter: Poker Expansion
description:
The Poker Expansion adds another fun western themed element to the base game...gambling! The expansion includes a full 52 card poker deck & 6 "All In Poker" insert cards. Add the "All In Poker" cards to the base deck & when pulled, play a round of poker against other players to earn money to spend in the General Store!

Also included are 2 Joker Bandit cards with a whopping 3 "Rep" points. These are the only 3 "Rep" point bandits in the base game!

name: Pricetitution
description:
Pricetitution is a card game where you guess how much money it would take your friends to do absurd things. Then you can pointlessly argue and reexamine your friendships. Lovingly, of course.

Made from conversations you already have. Each round, guess how much money it would take one player, "The Pricetitute," to do what a card says. Closest guess wins. High fives and arguing follow.

—description from the designer

name: Mars Horizon: Blast Off!
description:
An authentic, tactical yet fun card game about leading a space agency from its first rocket launch through to the first mission to Mars.

In Mars Horizon: Blast Off! each player is aiming to complete the first crewed mission to Mars.

To achieve this galactic task you run your own space agency and must make all the key decisions of what rockets to build, what missions to run, where to spend resources and what risks to take to make space-history.

Will you be the first to successfully launch a satellite, to put the first person in space, to land on the moon or finally complete a crewed mission to Mars? Or will your family or friends get there first? The sky's the limit provided you’ve got the vision and the nerves that space exploration demands!

Mars Horizon: Blast Off! Is easy to learn yet full of strategic challenges with plenty of risks and rewards. There is a whole new red planet to play for! Based on our many months of intense research for both this and our digital sister project (called ‘Mars Horizon’ too) and drawing from the support we’ve had from both the UK Space Agency and other space organisations, the game is as authentic as it can be while ensuring all the players will be having fun.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Space Exploration
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Income, Open Drafting, Race, Simulation, Stat Check Resolution

name: Penny Hockey
description:
Classic tabletop dexterity game for two players that recreates the excitement of Ice Hockey (or football, if played as "Penny Football").

Players sit across a table from one and other as opposing teams. Each team takes turns using three pennies to work their way across the board to score in the opponents goal. The goal is created by the defending team placing two fingers (both index/ index pinky) against the side of the table creating a goal for the offense to score in. The offense moves across the table by setting the coins in a tight triangle position and flicks the rear most coin through the other two coins. The flicked coin must pass through the other two and play continues by flicking a coin in play between the other two continually without disturbing either one until a goal is scored (by getting a penny in the goal), a coin goes off the table, the coin fails to make it through the other two, or the coin contacts one of the other two. At this point roles are reversed. Play continues to a predetermined score (suggest 5 or 10).

name: Hollywood Domino
description:
Contents:
95 Hollywood Domino Tiles
Hollywood Star with Platform
Red Carpet
8 Movie Markers
Mr. Hollywood Domino Marker
Scorepad
Rules booklet

Object of the game: To be the first to "complete your movie" by playing all of your domino tiles. To win the game, have the lowest total points after 13 rounds of play.

The game is played in 13 rounds beginning in a round that starts with a double 12 and ending in a round that starts with a double 0. On each turn, players attempt to play one of their domino tiles to match the number of a tile in play either in their own lane (their movie), on the Red Carpet lane (a collaborative movie), or on any lane with an opponent's Movie Marker (to make a "cameo appearance" in that movie). Special tiles include The Blockbuster which allows a player to place as many tiles as they can in that lane in a single turn, The Stunt Double which allows a player to play any tile of their choosing, and The Comeback which allows the player in posession of this tile at the end of the round to reduce their score to that of the lowest-scoring player for that round. The player with the fewest points at the end of 13 rounds is the winner.

name: Wend-loop
description:
The meandering path game.

Wend-loop is a path building game for two or more players. Players place tiles to build paths, and move their pieces along paths, sometimes jumping onto another path. The object of the game is to score the most points by completing paths containing your piece.

Contents
4 Player pieces
A set of 35 Playing tiles

Wend tiles are square in shape, and have 2 path entry/exit points on each edge. They each have four path sections which go from one path entry/exit point to another. When placed side by side, the path sections from one tile join up with those on the adjacent tile, to create meandering paths. There are 35 Wend tiles in a set, which includes one copy of all possible different combinations of 4 path sections on a tile.

A single set of 35 Wend tiles is enough for a good game with 2-4 players. You can use extra sets of Wend tiles to accommodate more players or for a longer and more challenging game with a small number of players.
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Canada (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
The Canadian fan expansion to Ticket to Ride.


45 Trains to start
Locomotives are for tunnels and ferries only, but players can draw them as normal cards (à la Nordic Countries)
Parallel pairs of links are always both in play:


- for 4-5 player games, or
- for 2-5 player games, if one link is a ferry and one is rail

There is no single longest route award, but there are the:


- (7-point) Sir John A. Macdonald Award for longest rail line
- (7-point) Louis St. Laurent Award for longest ferry line.

Ticket to Ride is a registered trademark of Days of Wonder Inc. and used by permission for this non-commercial variant. It may not be re-produced for any commercial use.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Miau Miau Katzenklau
description: Miau Miau Katzenklau has both cats and witches in it in some combination.

name: Back to the Future: A Letter From the Past
description: A thrilling adventure back in time: Discovery this amazing adventure with a brand new story, full of exciting riddles and puzzles for you to solve with the aid of the time decoder and the sports almanac, in an attempt to save Doc through time!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Entre dos banderas: Guadalajara 1937
description:
Game with Alea Magazine issue 14.

The game is a simulation of the battle of Guadalajara during the Spanish Civil War.

name: Rocket Race
description: An innovative space game with a real flying rocket! The astronauts are trying to get home from the alien planet but the air from the ground keeps blowing them off the path – the players use the pump to control the air streams. The first one to reach the rocket safely gets to fly home in it!

name: Monopoly: DC Comics
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from DC Comics, a world of heroes and super villains.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Winning Moves France, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Disturbed Friends: Mini Game & Expansion
description:
Disturbed Friends: Mini Game / Expansion is both a small version of Disturbed friends for 4 players that can be played stand alone or mixed with the base game Disturbed Friends and/or previously released expansions such as the Suicide Deck or the Booster Pack.

It contains 90 cards: 4 sets of player cards, 20 #WINNING cards, and 56 Question cards.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Something Wild! Five Nights At Freddy's: Rockstar Freddy Game
description:
Something Wild! Five Nights At Freddy’s is a fast-paced, light card game for the whole family! Featuring an exclusive collectible Rockstar Freddy POP! figure, as well as your favorite characters from the Five Nights At Freddy’s video games.

Combine Character Cards in sets and runs to score points, just like in Rummy. Use Power Cards to add a fun twist to the classic card gameplay.

Combine multiple Something Wild games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to your game!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Video Game Theme

name: Clue: Secrets in Paris
description:
You're on a high school drama club tip to France and the sights are like, totally amazing until - OMG! On a dare, a student has stolen a priceless work of art!

Now it's up to you to solve the mystery... one of your classmates is hiding something! Was it White? Did she hide the work of art in the Orsay Museum, using the "rope"? This CLUE game has more secrets, more rumors, more drama than a high school hallway! It's packed with landmarks, scenery, and interesting personalities: including student "passport" profiles, illustrated gameboard, city map CLUE sheets, 9 miniature prop "weapons", Rumor and Intrigue card decks, and more!

Narrow down you suspects, then make your accusation - uncover the mystery that everyone is whispering about.

- From back of box.

This version incorporates the additions from Clue: Discover the Secrets:
Each person has been given a unique power which may be used only once per game. There is an Intrigue deck which may or may not grant a player an extra action. Those Intrigue cards which do not grant an extra action are called Clock Cards. The player who draws the eighth Clock card is eliminated from play. Any player who draws a Clock Card thereafter is also eliminated. The “one” on one of the dice has been replaced by “?”. Any player who rolls “?” must draw an Intrigue card.
mechanics: Hand Management, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tokyo Poo Divers
description:
Having to spend most of their time in the sewers, the lives of Tokyo's disreputable Poo Divers consistently suck. The lowest caste of all underdogs sits in the Shinjuku honky-tonk as they do every night after work, digesting their lost time. Delirious thoughts waft through cesspools, spilling into an endless nirvana of drunken stupor and hubris. The only fixed point of their blank stares is the smudged cup with the stomach ulcering mixed drinks of Don’t Ask and Definitely Don’t Ask. A hot, stuffy, yet wild vibe drools through the humid air. It drools saliva that the divers inhale and excrete again as armpit sweat.

The divers brag about their precious finds from Tokyo's sewers. In drunkenness, yellow slime hardens into gold ingots and rat poison mutates into cocaine. Or was there really a giant diamond that a courier frantically shat out shortly before the raid? What is the truth about the silver coins that Akito once claimed to have found? And did he really exist, that mummified politician Tanaka slurs about every night?

Two to four players get up close and personal with the secret society of Poo Divers. Take part in their stuffy discoveries and, like them, rejoice in every bit of dirt. In this world, all finds have equal value. But take the advice of a wise Poo Diver and keep your glued eyes open, lest some greedy asshole snatch the loot from under your nose.

name: Ultra Vilelence: Module 1
description:
A fast paced expandable, random tile, monster generating game with 'questionable' characters and 'vile' enemies. There are multiple ways to play - Deathmatch, Cooperative, Capture the Flag and Solo. Each expansion comes with two unique player characters, monsters and their generators, items, traps and encounters. All components include (8) 6.25" x 6.25" tiles laid out on a 1 inch to 5 foot scale and (150+) die cut pieces; all in full-color.

Sold in modules for two-player games, which can be combined for more players and bigger games. This game was re-packaged in the box set Monster Mash I.
categories: Fantasy, Horror, Mature / Adult, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Cinderella Royal Ball Game
description:
In Cinderella Royal Ball Game, the players are trying to collect as many figures from the dance floor as they can, but you never know where the music might take them...

To set up the game, place the character figures in their bases and the bases on the dance floor. Players then take turns drawing a card from the deck:


If you draw a character card, place it in front of you.
If you draw a pass card, pass one character card that doesn't have a figure on it to the player on your left.
If you draw a dance card, press the button on the dance floor and watch the figures waltz around. When the dancing stops, you claim any figures in your sector of the dance floor if you have a character card matching those figures.


When all the figures have been claimed or the deck runs out, the game ends. Players score the points listed on the character cards they hold – but only if they hold this figure! The player with the highest score wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hold Your Breath! 5-6 Player Expansion
description:
In Hold Your Breath!, the game is played in two rounds. In the first round each player may dive deeper, providing they have the "Swim" and "Air" cards to do so. Players press their luck each turn since it is the pirate who dives the deepest in round one AND resurfaces in round two who is the winner. Players can play "Panic", "Shark" and other nasty cards on the other players, slowing their progress. In the second round each player struggles to reach the surface before they run out of air and therefore decide to take a rest (aka LOSE). Most of the pirates may not make it back to the surface, but the one who makes it back alive AND dove the deepest is the winner.

This expansion allows for up to two additional players to take a dive and press their luck.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Nautical, Pirates

name: Bushi Tanto
description:
Formerly Bushido, the Card Game.

A Samurai push-your-luck, set collection game for 2-5 players. Take to the Dojo and Roll dice, allocating them to the available Virtues. Learn enough Virtues of the Bushido Code to impress one of the Daimyo in order to win!

For twelve years the Province of Tosa has been blessed with peace and prosperity. Peace and prosperity that has been won through valiant battle and sacrifice. That has left Tosa with little army, yet still what remains defends the earned prosperity. Until sea-faring invaders lay siege to Kochi, a capital port for Tosa, and threatens this lasting peace. With the invaders not willing to negotiate; the Shogun orders his many Daimyo to travel Tosa in search of recruits to train in order to bolster the dwindling ranks of Samurai for the inevitable military confrontation.

Bushi Tanto is an interesting blend of push-your-luck and strategy. Each roll of the die will leave you with a decision, collect virtues that are needed to win, or activate Daimyo abilities to alter the game to your advantage. Either decision, however small, will ultimately lead to your victory or failure.

Bushi Tanto doesn't lack interactive gameplay. Many of the Virtue cards dynamically alter the game when collected. Focus tokens can force a player to reroll any die result at any time - and each of the Daimyo has a special ability to help or hinder training!

Compete as samurai potentials to be the first player recruited!

name: Zombie Apocalypse: Rebuild Refuge
description:
Zombie Apocalypse: Rebuild Refuge is a semi co-op party game for 3-8 players. The game takes place in a world infected by the zombie virus. Most of the residents in your society were zombified. Luckily, or unluckily, you are immune to the virus and have survived in the apocalypse. It is yet the time to let your guard down. Your first goal is to survive and if there is still any luck, you may find rescue from the outside. Therefore, you must construct refuge units in haste to stay away from danger. Not long ago, you have met some other survivors who are in a similar condition to you. Be careful! In this difficult time, no one can be trusted. They may not be your alliance! Keep your fingers crossed and watch your back!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Spookre
description:
Description from the publisher:

As Ghost Hunting becomes a lucrative business, you'd love to get in on that money except all the hauntings at your old mansion are transitory. If only you had some REAL valuable resident Ghosts to drum up business...

Spookre is a trick-taking game about recruiting the most Ghosts from the Graveyard to your Mansion. Each Ghost (card) has a special ability, strength, and death. The lead chooses one of the Ghosts in the Graveyard as the Target Ghost and tries to play the strongest card under the Target Ghost's strength. If a player sends a Ghost that matches the Target Ghost's death, that card activates its ability.

The cards players sent is put into a discard while the Target Ghost is added to that players Mansion (Score Pile). After a number of Nights (hands) equal to number of players, the game ends.

name: Phineas And Ferb 104 Days Of Summer Board Game
description: With Phinneas & Ferb 104 Days of Summer Board Game every day is a different adventure! The Goal of the game is to have a great time with your friends and earn the most 'Summer Fun' points to 'Win'! There are Mini games that challenge players' dexterity and skill mixed in with plain old luck. Each day of the week features a different activity type from 'Mental Monday' to 'Speedy Saturday'. Themed, multi purpose props bring elements of the show to life and are used in different and surprising ways during the game.

name: Freight Cars
description:
Freight Cars is set in the not-so-distant future where corporations have superseded governments for global control. With the dawn of improved mag-lev technology, competition on the high speed railways of America is fierce.

Players take the helm of a grand shipping company delivering produce to the north, lumber to the south, and oil and coal coast to coast. Profit is the name of the game as players strive to earn the most credits.

Fill your cars with Tetris™-style freight pieces and make deliveries faster and more efficiently than your competition to win. 2-4 players can take part in this quick, simple, and fun puzzle game that takes about 30 minutes to play.
Do you have what it takes to seize the rails?

—description from the publisher

name: Hearts & Spades
description: Hearts & Spades consists of 164 cards in two suits: Hearts and Spades. Score the least points by being the first player or team to exhaust your stockpile by playing on community piles.

name: Chef Masters
description:
The ease of interaction and rich combination of strategies, coupled with the profound Chinese cuisine, this is the "Chef Masters" ! "Chef Masters" is the 2-6 player strategy game, with simple rules, accessories, that is rich, interesting, and playable. The various restaurants compete with street food in the capital. Players as restaurant owners use auctions to entice guests on the rivers and lakes. The players want to beat opponents in bringing unique national dishes to the market.
