By winning the praise of diners, the winner will be the unanimous choice to become this generation's Kitchen king.

The skills of the twenty people in the game is fun and interactive, has strategic part of auction and cash flow management. A variety of scoring mechanism, and allows players to develop according to their own situation unique win strategy. Both newcomers and old players of the board game can find their own fun.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Fighter Command Game
description:
From the box:

"Knock your enemy from the skies. A combat game for 2 to 6 players, Ages 8 and up

An action-packed game for all the family. All the thrills of aerial combat. RAF vs the Luftwaffe. Spitfire against Messerschmitt. Exciting dogfights, hiding, seeking, chasing, turning, diving, crashing. Clear the enemy from the skies and win the game.

Contains 'sky' playing board, aerodrome base, 6 Spitfires, 6 Messerschmitts, 2 anti-aircraft guns, self-adhesive labels & dice"
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Die Teppichhändler
description: The game theme is the auctioning of Arabian carpets.

name: The Name Game: The Celebrity Guessing Game
description: What's in a name? Each of the cards in this box bears a celebrity's name (from actors to authors, sports figures to politicians, musicians to TV personalities), and the object of the game is to get your teammates to guess as many names as they can in a series of 1-minute rounds. Give clues to describe the celebrity on the card, do it quickly, and don't say the celebrity's name! It's wildly addictive and suitable for teens on up.

name: Werwölfe Vollmondnacht: Der Prinz
description:
This is a promo item for Werwölfe Vollmondnacht (One Night Ultimate Werewolf) containing the Prince character given out for free in Essen 2015.

The Prince is a villager with the handy ability of not being able to be killed.

The Prince also is part of the promo pack 1 for One Night Ultimate Werewolf.

name: Peyshoom
description:
Peyshoom is a Persian implementation of Cards Against Humanity which has a completely new content based on Iranian pop culture.

The game is also the first Iranian game that raised its production costs through crowdfunding with nearly 12000 dollars campaign.

—description from the publisher

name: Der Kessel
description:
Included in Competitive Edge (Formerly 'Gamefix') Magazine #12

Solitaire game of the battle for Stalingrad, 1942/43. Innovative system plots the player as the surrounded Germans trying to break out from the Soviet encirclement.

Components:

(8) pages of rules, incl. (4) pages of scenario, charts & historical background.
(1) 11x17" Map
(1) sheet of counters & event chits (must be cut-out)
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Identity (Psychological Boardgame)
description:
This game has been primary developed for adults. It is unique on the Hungarian market, because in addition to deepening self-knowledge, it has an impact on self-development. The players can also expand the knowledge in psychology by getting background explanation. By applying the game’s rules of communication the players can develop their culture in interaction and emotional intelligence. This game is a mini self-knowledge and communication-developer training, in which the player are protected by the rules and the framework of the game in a playful way.

The game / training does not require a qualified trainer, only one volunteer game master, who oversees compliance with the rules.

Sophisticated design, practical "all-in-one" configuration.

It is very easy to play this game. It doesn't have any special theme.
The players are just throwing the dice and moving their pawns accordingly. After a player has moved his/her pawn, he/she has to answer a questions according to the field where his/her pawn is.
There is no target field on the board so it is recommended to determine the game-end in time. (Suggested playing time: 120-240 minutes.)
The goal of this game is that the player change for the better in his/her life.

290 task-cards
6 glass pawnes
1 dice

name: Was klotzt du?
description:
In Was klotzt du?, the players try to explain a concept using a set of wooden blocks.

The game is played in timed rounds. In each round, one player is the explainer, while the other players try to guess the concept. The explainer receives a set of 24 blocks (consisting of 11 brown blocks and 13 blocks of other colours). He is also given a card which tells him the concept that he has to explain using the blocks. He may not talk or make sounds, though he may move the blocks. He can also give a hint by placing one of his non-brown blocks in one of the circles on the board that show different categories.

If one of the other players successfully guesses the concept, he gets the card and the block used to give a hint (if any). Then, all non-brown blocks are placed aside, and the explainer receives a new card, and continues to explain the new concept with the remaining blocks. This continues until the time runs out, after which the results are scored. The explainer receives points for each concept he has explained, and each other player receives points for each concept he has guessed. Each concept is worth 1 to 4 points, depending on the amount of non-brown blocks that have been set aside. The more blocks that have been used during the round, the higher the value of the concepts.

Now, a new round begins, and the next player becomes the explainer. The game ends after each player has been the explainer thrice; the player who has gathered the most points wins.

name: Joe's Zoo
description: Kids love searching games: flamingo, zebra, crocodile, anteater and co. are been hiding in the wrong compounds. Players must work together with animal keeper Joe to restore order. As a reward, there are "treats". The special feature of this animal memory game: The game is played simultaneously. Concentration, motor skills, language development, and communication skills are trained while playing. The active player rolls the die and after he moves Joe clockwise, all palyers select the animal card that matches the one the back of the card where Joe is standing now,. Anyone who has guessed correctly will receive a feed token. The game ends when one player has collected six tokens. This player is the winner.

name: Stalingrad Besieged
description:
Three ways to play!!! You can play with cards, blocks, or counters -- the game comes with them all. The cards/blocks/counters represent the units of the German and Russian armies in 1942 around Stalingrad.

Each turn the players will move their units, optionally play an event card, and fight battles in an attempt to gain control of the two ferry points and and tank factory. Each turn you will replace eliminated units using replacement points, but for each unit you bring back one of your "dead pile" units is permanently eliminated.

Victory is determined by the player who controls the ferry points; if each player controls one, then control of the tank factory will determine the ultimate winner.

Playable by 1 to 2 players in under 1 hour.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Events, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Vietnam Battles: Hue and Operation Pegasus
description:
Vietnam Battles: Hue and Operation Pegasus

These two games, Hue and Operation Pegasus , were both were major battles of the 1968 Tet Offensive in The Republic of South Vietnam.

Hue simulates the fighting for the old Vietnamese capital at Hue. This was one of the longest and most intense battles of the 1968 Tet Offensive. Hue has two scenarios. The Standard scenario covers the first stage of the battle. The Extended scenario follows the fighting all the way through to the final Allied victory. Both scenarios are set up in the same way.

Operation Pegasus simulates the operations surrounding the U.S. Marine Corps firebase at Khe Sanh. The game has two scenarios. The Lang Vei scenario starts with the Communist assault which overran the Lang Vei Special Forces camp and includes the possibility of a fullscale Communist assault on Khe Sanh itself. The Relief scenario covers the airmobile attackby the U.S. First Cavalry Division (Airmobile) which relieved Khe Sanh. Each Pegasus Scenario has separate deployment instructions and victory conditions.

The Vietnam Battles game system is a grand tactical simulation of combat during the Indochina Wars. Each game in the system represents a major battle between Allied and Communist forces. The playing pieces represent the aütual units which participated in the battles. The maps represent the terrain over which those units fought.

Several key factors of Vietnam War operations are simulated, including the interaction of conventional and guerrilla forces, firepower versus mobility, and the utilization of helicopters and airpower. There are two players. One represents the Communists (Viet Cong and North Vietnamese Army); the other the Allies (United States, South Vietnam, and others).

The rules are divided into the Standard Rules, which are common to all games in the system and the Exclusive Rules, which provide deployment, reinforcement and . victory instructions for each specific battle. The standardization of rules makes it easier for the gamer to play games within the series. Certain rules are designated Optional. This means the players may utilize them at their discretion; optional rules are not necessary • for the play of the game. Optional mies add additional complexity.

Released with Strategy & Tactics magazine #196 (March/April 1999).

Game Scale:
Hue
Game Turn: 1 day
Hex: .31 miles / 500 meters
Units: Company to Battalion

Pegasus
Game Turn: 2 days
Hex: .62 miles / 1 kilometer
Units: Company to Battalion

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (280 1/2" counters)
One 16-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15 hours

Players will need to provide one 6-sided die for game play.

name: Cosmic Attack
description:
In this game by Roberto Fraga you are an alien from the planet Krakton. You've landed on planet earth, simply because you love the blue planet and its inhabitants. The object of this journey: a search for souvenirs.

By use of your legs, your breathing, your voice, your elbows and whatnot, you try to complete your mission. The challenges created by this game will seriously cause insane game nights.

Game art by Sofi, ages 8 and up, published: Essen 2006.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Science Fiction

description: Solitaire dice game in which you get to throw the dice exactly 30 times. If you are efficient with your early tosses, you can use your saved throws to improve your score.

name: ZwergeZocken
description: A trick-taking card game with 60 cards.

name: Expulsion: Jewish Life in Spain from the Golden Age to 1492
description:
With each roll of the dice, move your piece through spaces outlining the major Jewish events in medieval Spain.

Pull Explusion or Daily Life cards, as directed by the space you land on. These cards might cause you to be reincarnated (Gilgul space) as a different historical person (Nefesh/Soul cards) or put you in danger of excommunication (Herem space).

Along the way, those cards might also earn you tokens for: Torah (learning), Avodah (service), Gemilut Hasadim (showing kindness), and Emunah (faithfulness).

Once you have collected 18 tokens (the same number as the Hebrew word for life), go to the 7th Heaven (Aravot) and pick a judgement (Din) card. Sometimes the King of Demons has tricked you into a lower heaven. But often your deeds are judged as Holy...and you WIN!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Hollywood's Reel Schpeel
description:
Described by the Publisher/Designer:

Players read famous, funny ot otherwise notable movie lines, doing their best impersonations. Teammates then brainstorm to guess the movie title, actor/actress' name, character's name and the director. Each correct answer advances the team one space. After 60 seconds, the opposing team has an opportunity to "steal" any questions left unanswered. Movie buffs can be handicapped by withholding the provided hints/clues.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Pentacle
description:
A card game of wizardly combat.

Each player is a wizard, busily conjuring demons, familiars, golems and the like. Why? To defend against those same creatures sent by other wizards to kill you, of course!

name: Shrimpin'
description:
Shrimpin’ is a fast-paced card game for 2-6 players who are tired of their dreary day jobs and wish to head South and take up this glitzy, lucrative trade. Each player has scraped up just enough cash to purchase themselves a brand spankin’ new used shrimpin’ boat. Unfortunately, not much money is left, and if a profit is not turned quickly, then the whole shrimpin' idea might fold on itself.

As luck would have it, all players have congregated in the same small stretch of Louisiana coastline. Competition will be fierce and ruthless because there just aren’t enough shrimp to go around. The player who shrimps the most in this crucial first week in business will earn enough money to stay around. The rest have to pack up and return to their day jobs shrimpless and hopeless.

To Shrimp, players move their boat to choice shrimpin' holes to shrimp while also playing cards to augment their catching ability, such as improved nets or Shrimp Findin' Com-Pewters. In addition, players may use cards to foil their opponents' plans, such as capsizing waves or mechanical failures. The object of the game is to catch the most shrimp over a 3, 5, or 7 day period (choose game length).

name: Gigantic
description:
Titanic was the ultimate chick flick. Gigantic is the ultimate spoof game! Guys, this is your chance for revenge. Your significant other made you watch the movie over and over again. Now you can play parody versions of any of the movie’s characters over and over again. Do your best to escape the sinking Gigantic...While preventing the other players from also escaping. This is a VERY cut-throat game.

Schmooze, threaten or beg your way onto a lifeboat and be sure to lock all of the stairwell doors behind you. It wouldn't hurt to take a gun with you either...People on deck make easy targets. Perhaps you prefer the less violent method of passing yourself off as a crew member while ordering everyone to "back away from the life boats" with your bullhorn as you bob in the relative safety of your own lifeboat? Whatever means you choose for survival, there's laughs aplenty in this new strategy board game.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Nautical

name: Duplicate Ad-Lib Crossword Cubes
description:
Players roll their 13 letter cubes and then arrange them into words crossword style before the timer runs out. Once time is up, players score their words. They then close the lid to their box, gently shake it so that the words are mixed up but the letters remain the same, and then pass it to their opponent. Players then reset the timer and again arrange words from the letter cubes, essentially trying to do a better job of it than their opponent since they are using the same letters. Highest combined score from both rounds wins.

Cube List:
(note that letters are arranged differently on the red and black dice, but each die will have a letter set match)
W4,P4,Y4,M3,U3,O1
H3,N2,R2,T2,E1,O1
L2,R2,T2,I2,E1,O1
J6,D3,N2,R2,E1,A1
Q8,G4,F4,L2,I2,A1
W4,V4,D3,T2,E1,A1
B4,M3,U3,N2,S2,O1
X8,B4,Y4,S2,E1,A1
H3,T2,L2,S2,E1,A1
K5,C4,V4,U3,N2,O1
Z10,C4,F4,I2,E1,A1
D3,S2,R2,I2,E1,*
P4,G4,M3,I2,E1,*
publishers: E. S. Lowe Company Inc., Milton Bradley

name: Prince Valiant
description: Based on the comic strip by Harold Foster but released to help merchandise the movie of the same name from 1954. Players use a spinner to determine their movement around the board. Each player needs to travel through the 7 adventures of Prince Valiant in his quest for knighthood which is achieved by being the first to reach the castle.

name: Star Wars: Endor
description:
Complexity level 3 on Tsukada's 1-6 scale (1=easiest)

Only released in Japan, this is a Star Wars themed hex-based wargame based not on the entire Return of the Jedi movie, but just on Endor. This game has no relation to West End Games Star Wars: Battle for Endor game (other than being based on the same movie).
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Murder Mystery Party: Revenge of Konan Castle
description:
The "Murder Mystery Party" line of murder party games is the most extensive. They were originally published by University Games in California, but are now produced in England, though they still carry a note that the rights belong to University Games (who, when you call them, have no knowledge of the recent episodes).

These games play just like other main-stream murder party games like How to Host a Murder, Evening of Murder, Mysteries by Vincent, or Milton Bradley's Life of the Party. This episode:

Konan Castle was owned for centuries by the McDonald clan. When the McDonalds killed two Campbells, a feud ensued and eventually the Campbells took the castle in the late 19th century. The remaining McDonalds fled to the US and the castle went into disrepair. For two generations (the year is 1955), the McDonalds waited to return to retreive their treasure (hidden within the castle). So, a party of eight went to Scotland to search. But the castle owner (Ian Campbell) was murdered. Whodunnit?

name: Capture
description: This is a game of strategy for 2 to 4 players plot to penetrate the opponent defenses in order to reach their secret objectives. At the same time however,you're attempting to prevent the enemy from arriving in your "home" territory.

name: Toying With Destruction
description:
Toying With Destruction is a simplistic large-scale battle system for toys and other objects, and is designed to provide a light-hearted escape from the seriousness of other strategy and miniature games. Even if you have never played a strategy game before, you will discover that the system is easy to learn and fun to play. For indoor and outdoor use. So get a couple of friends together, grab your favorite toys, and let the battle begin!

NOTE: Toying With Destruction shares some thematic similarities with the earlier game Toy Wars, but it was developed independently and is a different game.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Platsch!
description: The hippos want to go swimming... but they need life preservers! Players compete to get rid of their life preservers as hippos dive off the pier.

name: Thataway
description:
A two player abstract strategy game played on a board which is developed by the players over the course of the game.

Each player starts with ten pawns on a six by six chequered board. Each turn consists of moving one of your pawns and placing a card. To begin with, pawns can only move one square forwards or backwards and cannot capture your opponent's pawns. However, once a pawn is moved, a movement card is placed onto the square it vacates. Movement cards have arrows showing possible moves - directions and lengths. The more possible directions (eight being the maximum) the card shows, the shorter the maximum move. Pawns which begin their move on one of these cards follow one of the arrows and are allowed to capture enemy pawns. When a pawn moves off a movement card, the next movement card may be placed in any vacant space on the board, in any orientation. Thus there is scope for clever placement to limit what your opponent can do. Gradually the board fills up with movement cards which show the possible moves from each square. Moves are essentially chess-like, but some are more limited, for example some movement cards allow movement in a straight line in only three directions, or diagonally in only two.

The game ends either when one player has captured all their opponent's pawns; when one player loses due to having no legal move; or when all 36 movement cards are placed, in which case the winner is the one with the most remaining cones.

name: Enemy on the Horizon: Axis & Allies Expansion
description:
Axis & Allies expansion with new units (commandos, destroyers, artillery) and changes to existing units.
Battleships-repairing and defending with damaged battleships.
Submarines-German U-boats.
Bombers-Paratroopers, Strategic bombing of AA guns, Air Drop Missions and Air Supply Missions.
Transports-Antiaircraft defense for transports and Transport Movement.
Fighters-Kamikaze maneuver sequence.
Industrial Complexes-new industrial complex production chart.
Aircraft Carriers-fighter/carrier combined movement.

Expands

Axis & Allies
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Vesuvius
description:
Vesuvius is a volcano in Italy. Two thousand years ago it erupted, burying the cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum beneath ash and mud.

In this light strategic game you build vineyards on the rich soils of Vesuvius. Dangerous work, but profitable! Each century you invest in vineyards that you think will survive the next eruption.

Vesuvius includes 34 black wooden hexagons, 35 wooden triangles in 5 colors (the vineyards), 1 black chopped-off cone (Vesuvius), 5 wooden investment markers, 1 turn marker, instructions. All in a black mesh bag.

name: Beginner's Bridge
description: The instructions are so arranged that the beginner progresses in easy steps, gradually learning to play Bridge. At the end, the novice will have learned the "Goren Point Count System" of playing, which is universally accepted wherever Bridge is played. This system was devised by Charles H. Goren, the world’s leading expert and authority on Bridge, whose aim was to make Bridge EASY and FUN for everyone. This is the way Beginners Bridge works: The book contains step by step directions on playing Bridge. After each step, you will be directed to the Bridge Tutor for some examples to illustrate how the information you have just learned is used. The Bridge Tutor is a device that eliminates the other three players needed to play Bridge! Thus, you can practice by yourself and yet actually simulate a four handed game. You progress, at your own pace, by simply following the easy directions in the book and playing the different hands in the Tutor.

name: Doublethink
description:
Doublethink is based on a puzzle, namely to place three copies each of eleven letters (those in "Doublethink," naturally) on a figure consisting of three concentric circles joined by eleven radial lines so that every letter is connected to every other one exactly once.

When played as a two-player game, each player gets fifteen letter chips (the remaining three being placed on the board) and places one at a time in an effort to form connections and make it impossible for the opponent's chips to be placed. A player scores a point for each connection he or she makes and also for each connection the opponent is prevented from making. The score can be read from an erasable board (the game also includes a pen) which tracks the connections made for each letter.

name: Icosagame
description:
Players place control markers on various edges of an icosahedron, rotating it with each play, aiming to control facets or planes of cleavage.

3 main variations/win conditions for ICO:

Beginner -- be the first to have your color on 3 sides of a triangle.
(Beginner+ -- be the first to have your color on 3 sides of two different triangles directly across from each other)

Intermediate -- be the first to complete a full route around the entire icosahedron.

Advanced -- be the first to complete an entire pentagon: sides and middle rungs. Note that when you complete the outside of a pentagon, you remove all opponents pieces from the middle rungs of that pentagon!
publishers: Acme Gamewerks, Ico, The Future Players, Inc.

name: Glyphix
description:
The Scholars call it Glyphix, a mental challenge written in the sands of ancient Egypt and chiseled into the walls of the pharaohs tombs.

Glyphix is a fast paced game, and embodies all of the characteristics of a classic game. The "Glyph" pieces feature actual hieroglyphics. All the "Glyphs" are covered except for one. The challenge is to match six of the thirteen sets of "Glyphs" without uncovering the Pharaoh's Curse. A futuristic visitor from outer space brings you greetings and a free match!

The familiar rules of this game are simple to learn, but include a surprising twist. Players must move one of the covered "Glyphs" before uncovering another, making matches surprisingly hard to find.

name: Helpline
description:
I have seen this game in 3 themes:
Over The Hill
Menopause Madness
Mid-Life Crisis.

Each game comes with:
50 Problem cards
200 Solution cards
1 Counselor die
1 One minute timer.

Game play:
One person is the Caller.

The Caller picks up a Problem card and reads it.

The Caller then rolls the die, which determines who the call is made to, i.e. a friend, psychic, shrink, etc.

The Caller then turns over the timer.

The other players (called Counselors) then have one minute to sort through the various solution cards. The solution cards each have one word on them. They take the cards and construct a reply in the theme rolled on the Counselor die. This is all done simultaneously by all of the Counselors.

The Caller acts as the time keeper and gives the Counselors a running record of the appox. time remaining.

When the time is up, each Counselor reads his reply. The Caller names the one he likes best and the Counselor get to keep the Problem card.

The Caller position then rotates to the left and that player is the Caller for the next round.

For a 3-4 player game you play until one player has 5 Problem cards.

For a 5-6 player game you play until 3 cards are won.
categories: Humor, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Mascarade
description:
You have a board of 10x10 squares and enough tiles to fill it completely. All 100 tiles have a different face on it, there are no duplicate tiles. You place the tiles on the board one by one but you have to match at least one item (face, mouth, nose, hair, eyes) with adjacent tiles (orthogonally).

There is a variant for older players where you give points for each matching item per adjacent tile. Maximum score per tile is thus 4x4=16 points.

name: Catnap
description:
From the designer's web page:

Cats, either you love 'em or you hate 'em. Whatever the case, you'll find something to like in this game. It's a lazy, crazy race around the house to end up right back where you started ... doing nothing! Napping, eating, scratching, and staring at things ... this game has it all. Oh yeah, did I mention the evil twins who are out to humiliate and torture you? The game includes the board , all the cards, rules and tokens you need to get started! As an added bonus, there are some game variations included to really get the fur flying!

name: Dodecaedron
description:
This Italian game simulates a "futuristic" sport in which heavily armored players struggle to move a gigantic Dodecahedron (hence the name of the game) and score points for their team. Each team has three kinds of players that cover different roles in a match. The movement of counters on the game field is performed by pushing them with the finger. They try to hit and push the Dodecaedron towards an opponent's goal and stop it in the goal area. The first to score 12 points is the winner.

The game since 2011 comes with athlete counters mounted on coloured wooden discs. Six complete teams are included in the game.

name: Chip 'n Dale: Rescue Rangers Game
description: The object of the game is to construct a particular machine from the part cards that are picked up as players move around the board. There are four different colors of machine parts and in addition to these colored pieces, there are also two other parts needed to complete the machine.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Belisha
description:
Belisha is a card game that reuses the mechanics of Rummy. Traffic signs in the United Kingdom make up the theme in Belisha. Instead of the standard suits and numbers in a 52-card deck, Belisha's cards can be grouped into numbers, colors, and types of traffic signs.

Per Rummy, the players are dealt a hand of cards and at the beginning of their turn, draw a card from the deck or the first card of the discard pile. Their aim is to get rid of the cards from their hand by playing them in sets or straight sequences. They can play their cards to extend sets or sequences laid out by their opponents. They must also discard one card in their turn. The current round stops when a player has played or discarded his last card. Players sum up the values of the remaining cards in their hands as their score for the round and begin the next by reshuffling the deck and dealing new hands.

The game ends when a player has accumulated a certain score (usually 250) or more. At that point, the player with the lowest accumulated score is the winner.
publishers: Gazebo Games UK Ltd., Pepys (Castell Brothers)

name: När & Fjärran: resespel
description:
När & Fjärran - resespel is a travel edition of the Swedish travel trivia game När & Fjärran ( http://www.boardgamegeek.com/game/9249 ), but it also has different game play.

To win, each player needs to visit each continent. To be able to travel between two continents, a player must answer at least one question about each of the continents correctly, and then roll the travel die and get a travel method that can get him from one continent to the other.

The game is packaged Ages 13 and up, but is probably rather difficult for a 13-year-old.

Contents:
- 100 question cards.
- A pad of protocol sheets.
- A six-sided die.
- A six-sided travel die.

The game is packaged in a metal box with a snap-close hinge, so it actually makes a good travel game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel, Trivia

name: Sakhalin 1945
description:
This game concerns one of the last battles of World War 2. The invasion of the Southern Sakhalin and the Kuriles by the Soviet Union. This was done in conjunction with the invasion of Japanese held Manchuria and Korea in the wake of the atom bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki. The Soviets surprisingly had a hard time in taking the Sakhalins and the Kuriles even though they outnumbered the defenders and had overwhelming advantage in firepower, the Japanese defenders fought fanatically and there were still pockets of Japanese resistance at the time of the armistice.

"Sakhalin 1945" consists of 86 pieces, a 29.5 x 42 cm map (printed in English) and 10 pages of rules (in Japanese). The map covers from the Japanese/Soviet border at the 50th Parallel through the strategic town of Koton. Turn length is twelve hours and units are a platoon, companies or battalions. Player numbers are one or two and playing time is two hours.

Came out in Six angles #3 and as part of the Six angles collection
publishers: Omega Games (I), Six Angles, Sunset Games

name: Classic Hockey
description:
From the publisher's website:

CLASSIC HOCKEY is a game that uses statistics to rate major professional and international teams over nearly a century of organized competition. Game play is based on team statistics, but an optional box score feature lets you create both team and individual player stats. Teams are rated on offensive and defensive strength, and comeback ability. Replay entire seasons or playoffs, or put together a field of all-time greats from over the years and determine the best ever.

name: Longbow
description: A simulation of the two major battles early in the Hundred Years War-Crecy and Poitiers. From Berg's introduction: "The era, and these two battles, saw a change from the supremacy of heavy, armored cavalry to that of an infantry led by the defensive fire power of the longbow coordinated with the offensive capabilities of "Men- at-arms", either mounted or dismounted." One 22x17 map in two parts, one 11x17 map, 200 cut and mount counters. 145 yds/hex, 300 men/combat unit.

name: Hachimitsu
description: A Player talks to nine girls living in an old-fashioned apartment called Hachimitsu-So, in a effort to collect "positive feeling" cards. By taking a girl out using those cards, you receive points. The more cards you collect, the more points you get. Whoever gets the most points achieves the right to live in Hachimitsu-So.

name: Tabletop Football
description:
This game has taken the old recess and study hall pass time of paper football and turned it into an "officially licensed product" of the NFL. And they did a great job with it.

The game comes with flat cardboard triangles for the footballs. What is cool is that each one has the name and logo of an actual NFL team. And yes, they made expansion packs so you could "collect them all". It also comes with a very cool item, a field goal that you put together and stand up for when you attempt an extra point.

The game is played by two opponents stationed at opposite ends of a tabletop surface. The person who goes first flicks or slides the football toward the other end of the table. If it is touched by the opponent a field goal attempt is allowed for the "flicker". Otherwise, a touchdown is made when part of the football rests over the edge of the table but doesn't fall off. Then an extra point can be attempted if a score is made. If a score is not made, the other person attempts to score, and so on until a winner is declared.

The game was first introduced in 1994. The inaugural events which introduced the game were sponsored jointly by the NFL and Ocean Spray.

Tournaments were established around the country at thousands of Universities, with a grand prize package at stake for a team of four to attend the Superbowl with all expenses paid.

name: Ript
description:
A deck of cards marked with special functions as well as standard card values. The game is played during a round of disc golf. Each player receives three cards at the beginning of the game and one for winning a hole. They may play their card to perform the action stated on it, such as taking a mulligan, subtracting one stroke from their score, trading a disc with another player, swapping 'lies' with another player, or forcing another play to throw with their off hand. An official variant involves collecting the best poker hand by the end of the game.

Home Page: https://knagames.com/ript.html

name: Classic Warfare
description:
From the inside cover:
"Rules for wargames with miniature figures from the days of the earliest Pharaohs of the new Kingdom through the end of the "Dark Ages" - 1500 B.C. to 700 A.D. and slightly later."

This is a 68 page docu-bind style book. Early Gary Gygax miniature rules with illustrations by Greg Bell and Mimi Roach. Edited by Timothy J. Kask.

name: Frozen Pond Hockey
description:
This is a stats-based hockey simulation game that features many minor league and historical seasons.

Players are rated for ability to score, pass, and play defense.

name: Generatorb
description:
Generatorb is a game of jumping and capturing where you attempt to get one of your own pieces in your opponent's generator square.

Generatorb is played on a basic 8×8 square board (a checkers or chess board works great) that is turned sideways so the squares become diamonds. The playing pieces, called Orbs, should be flat disks that can be stacked (red and black checkers are great). You'll need 24 Orbs for each player.

Rules: http://www.tjgames.com/generatorb.pdf

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: DareBase
description:
DareBase attempts to recreate the feeling of the classic schoolyard game of team-tag, in a 5-on-5 contest. It adds some capture-the-flag elements to give each team an incentive for having their players run deep toward the opposing end of the field. Dice rules force players to make some tense decisions while giving the players a glimpse of options available within future turns.

Several different scenarios are available to play the game in different ways.

Online Play


Super Duper Games
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Matt Worden Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: The Mighty Hood
description: A mini-sim from Panzerschreck Magazine #14 - using a modified Graf Spee system. Portrays the battle between the Bismarck/Prinz Eugen and the Hood/Prince of Wales. Essentially a miniatures game with cardboard miniatures. the scale is 1" = 1,000 yards and the turns are 1 hour (with 7 rounds). There are some extra ships and some additional scenarios.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Mampf
description:
It's feeding time at the farm and all the animals are hungry. If you have the right food, maybe you will lure the pony or cow. Whoever feeds the most animals, wins.

Each player holds four wooden food pieces (carrot, grain, sugar and lettuce), secretly picks one of them and them discloses it simultaneously. A player that was the only one to pick a particular kind of food, can take an animal from the stack of the corresponding color. When one stack is used up, the player with most animals is the winner.

Ages 4 and up.

name: Direct Conflict in Dimension Six
description:
"Master the aspects of a parallel dimension in order to overwhelm your opponent's interstellar empire. A two player game for ages twelve to adult." (box cover)

There are two game boards - one representing "normal" space and one representing "dimension 6". Both represent the same physical space but ships move differently in the 2 dimensions.

240 counters

name: On the Ball
description:
From the game box:

"On The Ball is spring training and league action all rolled into one. You play and learn the fundamentals, the strategies, the situations, the rules -- just the same as in a real baseball game. The better you are at the game of On The Ball, the more you will be on-the-ball in a real game."

Part trivia game, part roll and move (with a spinner), the game's purpose is to teach the rules and strategies of baseball.

name: Penniless and Insane
description:
Penniless and Insane is a simple auction game with a twist: the lowest bid takes the good stuff, but the object is to run out of money.

Every player is a frustrated artist nearing the end of a wasted life. With no inspiration and a lackluster body of work, your newfound ambition is to die penniless and insane. You believe that this will make your work more valuable, which only proves you're already insane.

You spend your last few dollars buying art from students, apprentices, friends, and even total strangers. This is the artwork you hope to pass off as your own after your looming death. However, since all the talented artists are still young and idealistic, they care little for your so-called "money". In fact, the less money you offer them, the better art you will get!

The game is scored over multiple rounds. Each round consists of 3 tricks. Every player starts each round with exactly $20 in chips. To start the round, deal 3 cards to each player... and start buying (cheap) art! There are "Penniless Bonuses" and "Insane Bonuses" awarded after each round. First to 300 points wins.

This first appeared in Game Trade Magazine #17, July 2001, Page 47.

name: You're It!
description:
This is a simple party game.

From the website:

There are 7 wood cubes with numbers from 1-7 in 4 different languages (French, German, English and Spanish). Each cube has a different gradient of red.

The player who is "IT" must start turning over the cards one-by-one. When a NOT-IT card is turned over, nothing happens.

When a YOU'RE IT card is turned over, it will have one of 4 commands: LOWEST IS IT, HIGHEST IS IT, REDDEST IS IT or WHITEST IS IT. At this point players race to reach the cube that is the opposite of the card.

Example: LOWEST IS IT, players will try to grab the highest number cube so they are not it. But wait, some of the cards say LOWEST IS NOT IT in this case players would try to grab the cube with the lowest number.

The player that ends up "IT" will start flipping the cards.

When a YOU'RE OUT card is turned over, the player who is "IT", is eliminated and the rest of the players race to see who will be "IT" next.

Be the last player standing and receive a "Winner Chip". Be the player with the most "Winner Chips" after 10 rounds and win the game.

Great for reflexes! Great for parties, Great for family fun.

name: Der Weg nach Drakonia Essen '05 Promo Cards
description: Four additional cards for "Der Weg nach Drakonia". First a give-away at Essen 2005, now (as long as supplies last) available by mail from Fanpro.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Space Dominoes
description:
Space Dominoes consists of a forty card deck, with each card being divided into three sections and each section containing 0-3 pips in one of three colors (threes are red, twos are blue, ones are yellow). Each player begins the game with a hand of 6-7 cards depending on the number of players, and one card is laid face up on the table as a starting card.

On a turn, a player lays one card from hand onto the end of a card on the table, covering one or two sections of that card with one or two matching sections on the played card. If the player covers one section, they draw one card, then end their turn; if they cover two sections, they can play again immediately, still drawing one card and ending their turn whenever they play something that covers only one section or can't find another play. (A player can optionally choose to draw cards at the start of their turn.) If a player can't make a legal play, they must draw cards from the deck until they can make a play.

The first player to play all their cards wins the hand. If no further plays are possible, the player with the lowest pip count wins the hand. In either case, the winner scores the pip count of cards in hand from the pip count of each opponent, then scores the sum of these values. To determine the overall winner, you can play to a particular point total or play a certain number of rounds.
publishers: Games & Names, U.S. Games Systems, Inc.

name: Csillagok Háborúja
description:
An old (1986) Hungarian game based on the Star Wars: New Hope film.

It is like other Escape from Death Star games but with different rules and board.

The Rebels have to escape from the Death Star by rescuing princess Leia and blowing up the tractor beam generator. Obi-Wan Kenobi has to fight Darth Vader.

The Imperials have to hinder the Rebels and have to blow up the Millenium Falcon.

The Rebel side: Chewbacca, Han Solo, R2D2, C-3PO, Luke, Leia, Obi-Wan and some rebel fighters with blasters.

The Imperial side: Darth Vader and numerous storm troopers

Disable the tractor beam, fight the storm troopers, prison block escape, stop the garbage compactor in time, fight Darth Vader...

Part of the Star Wars games family of games
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Osmoz
description:
You one of the first explorers to arrive on a remote planet and your job is to study it in detail. There are companies here competing against you for the most glory and power.

This is a free print and play game. There are four different planets available for download. The game rules were created in 2003.

Was available - now is not anymore


Home Page: http://www.neuroludic.com/osmoz/osmoz.html

name: Die Drachenjäger Sammelkartenspiel
description:
CCG based on the French/Chinese anime series Dragon Hunters.
Players pick a character and try to defeat monsters in the categories strength, cleverness and wisdom using their Goldons (money) to buy support.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy

name: Monopoly: Kent
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Kent, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Middlesbrough
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Middlesbrough, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Asterix to the Rescue
description:
Featuring the best-selling comic character Asterix, this is an interesting riff on choose your own path books. Rather than just work through the choices in the book, the player is using the book and attempting to transverse a map. Another difference from typical choose your own path games, the player can gain and use a number of cards, like magic potions and a coin bag. In addition, some of the paths available are determined by a die roll.

The game comes with a die featuring many of the Asterix characters. In addition, the game comes with a clever cipher and code breaking card. One more difference between typical choose your own path books, this one is a weighty 284 pages.

From the cover, "Use your skill to help Asterix outwit the Romans - before his magic potions run out!"
categories: Adventure, Book, Comic Book / Strip, Humor

name: Why Not?
description:
From the back cover: "Why Not? is the magnetized board game that's like a card game and word game rolled into one! Use the four different colored alphabets to make set of three and four of the same letter. Make "runs" in alphabetical order. Or spell words using all one color. The more letters you use each turn, the higher you score. It's a constant challenge!

OBJECT: Score high by using as many letters as possible each turn, and adding their total point values to your running score. To win, you must be the first one to use up all your letters or spell the words "Why Not?"

1992 Mensa Select

name: Future Wars
description: A 1:1 skirmish system covering anything from corporate troops, street gangs, zombies and alien bugs to predators.
categories: Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Brigade Games, HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company), Rattrap Productions LLC, Sinister Laboratories LLC

name: Sin Verguenza
description:
This is a A Question of Scruples based game but comes with 288 new moral dilemmas.
Players will have to make each other questions. For each question you will have to choose the person you think will give the answer (yes/no) you have in your hand. If the answer is a match, he can discard that card, but if not he will have to draw another question card.
Of course, all players get to vote if the answer is true or false.
The first player to get rid of all cards winds the game.

name: Cthulhu Horror
description: One of six great demon lords is slowly awakening from deep slumber, and if he does, there will be hell on Earth. It might be Cthulhu, or Shub-Niggurath, but most players won't know the identity of the hidden card until the endgame. This is important because each of the six tomes is best against a specific demon lord, middling against most of the others, and worthless against another specific one. Players are different teams of adventurers in the 1920s, finding tomes like the Necronomicon, fighting monsters like the Mi-Go, and solving world-spanning Events, mysteries of Lovecraftian weirdness. Events give victory points to whoever finally solves them, but the great demon will arise if there are 100 points worth of these Events in the unsolved stack--if he arises, there is the endgame of final apocalyptic battle. So players are constantly balancing co-operation with competition--under certain circumstances, a player can discover the great demon ahead of the endgame, and even decide to join the demon!

name: SuperCross- The Home Version
description: Brings the Supercross experience to life. With movable obstacles, lets you place the doubles, triples and table tops where you want them. With bike modifications and factory rides, you can improve your bike's performance. Be careful of the whoops and don't let your tire drop down inbetween or you'll crash. Family oriented game that is easy to play, which comes with a nicely designed track, cut out bikes and stands, cut out jumps, full throttle, Modification, and obstacle cards, and gear dice for movement. The downfall of the game is the poor design of the jumps.

name: 1943: Battalion Level Ground Combat For WWII
description:
Free battalion level miniature wargame rules for World War Two. Recreate infantry and local armor conflict.

Rules can be found in the War times Journal Web site: www.wtj.com

name: Scrabble Golf Edition
description:
From box bottom,
"Tee it up! It's a golf word scramble! Score Birdies and Eagles on the fairway and you'll double and triple your score!!! Increasing your golf score may not be good for your handicap, but it's a great strategy in the SCRABBLE Game: Golf Edition. Take the challenge of this specialty version of America's favorite word game one step further; compete for extra bonus points by playing golf-related words."

name: Campaña de los Andes
description:
In September 1816, San Martín relocated his Army of the Andes to Plumerillo, in the northern part of Mendoza Province, where he finished the details to start his crossing of the Andes. The army was divided in two main columns and four minor ones, keeping the decided paths in secret.

On January 18, 1817, a main column parted with the artillery to Chile through Uspallata, under command of General Las Heras, reaching Las Cuevas on February 1, 1817. The second main column led by San Martín, left on January 19 through Los Patos pass, and reached San Andrés de Tártaro on February 8, where he was later joined by Las Heras, concluding the first part of the crossing.

The crossing of the Andes took twenty-one days. It was an extremely difficult enterprise, with temperatures ranging from 30° Celsius during the day to -10° Celsius at night, altitudes averaging 3000 meters above sea level, and paths that were far from being roads appropriate for an army: they consisted of a 50 cm wide paths mainly used by locals for traveling on mules, with several passages which had to be crossed literally in single file. Besides all those hardships, San Martín was far from healthy and was carried on a stretcher during most of the trip. By the end of crossing, around 300 men — 5.5% of the total at the beginning — had lost their lives, mostly due to the harsh conditions of the trip.

In 1817, he crossed the Andes from Mendoza to Chile, and prevailed over the Spanish forces after the Battle of Chacabuco and Battle of Maipú (1818), liberating Chile together with Chilean Bernardo O'Higgins.

The game recreat the cross of the Andes by San Martin´s army. In this game the patriot player wins by controlling chile´s cities in less than 20 turns, and the royalist player wins preventing the patriot´s objetive. There are special rules about movement in high altitude and patriot´s surprise factor.

name: Buchstabenzwerge
description:
From the manufacturer:

Oh dear, Hob Hotchpotch has jumbled up the letters! The eager dwarves try to untangle the chaos. Will they find objects, animals or other motifs starting with the letter searched for? An educational game for 2-4 players all about the alphabet.

For ages 6 to 10.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy, Word Game

name: Domingo
description:
1 board, 4 sets of 7 rings in one color, 1 deck of playing cards with domino-symbols, score chart

The idea is to lay as high valued tiles as possible in the own rings.

A game from the Krone series!

name: Nourti Champi
description:
In this light card game, each player is given a mushroom, which he has to feed in order for it to grow. On the menu are fireflies, salad, trash, ...

Each mushroom has different characteristics and special powers which allow attacking other mushrooms in order to trigger indigestion...

name: Brandub
description:
From the Author; "Brandub is a Celtic board game, a re-creation based on pieces and playing boards found in runs and digs in Ireland and Wales. The rules had been lost for over ten centuries, but now have been restored by a combination of game theory and historical extrapolation.
The game itself is a fast, enjoyable tactical challenge that leaves you wanting to play again and again. Simple rules but engagingly complex play for all skill levels."

Addendum: Brandub is one of the oldest known 2-player games that falls into the genre of "unequal forces" games. While 1 player is given 8 pieces (called "Barons"), the other player is given 5 pieces (4 "princes" and 1 "king"). The different pieces have different abilities, perhaps the most notable being the fact that the king cannot be removed from play by any means. For fuller rules, see the "files" section.
mechanics: Area Movement, Enclosure, Point to Point Movement

name: Pippis ballongjakt
description:
From the children book writer, Astrid Lindgren, we meet Pippi Longstocking. Your job is to help Pippi to collect all the balloons that are flying around. The person who gets the most will win this game.

Contents:
1 Board game
4x10 balloons + 2 of each in reserve
1 colored die
rules

name: Attrition
description:
“Two player Card game simulating trench warfare in WWI. Objective: Reduce your opponent to 0 troops, or
capture all six territory markers.” The game is web published, but was previously printed in an issue of the SGS magazine Strategist.

The players begin the game with a battalion of 100 squads, three territory markers, and no cards. The players alternate completing a sequence of five phases: Logistics (draw one card), Artillery Barrage (eliminate a random number of enemy squads), Charge Orders (the player may choose to charge, or such orders may be received), Defender Fire Phase, and Trench Fighting Phase. Certain cards may be played to give bonuses in some phases.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, World War I
publishers: Strategy Gaming Society, Warp Spawn Games

name: Chronos
description:
“Chronos is a game of Time exploration for 3-5 players, inspired by Lloyd Krassner's Time Line.”

The game is built on a Time Map made up of square tiles. Each tile is named for an era (Prehistory, Renaissance, Near Future, etc.) and has three values marked on showing its position in the overall timeline, the number of victory points gained for control of the era, and how resistant the era is to control. Every player has three units, a Leader, Agent, and Explorer. Leaders and Agents are used to gain control of uncontrolled eras. The game ends when a player has 22 victory points. A shorter Easy Game scenario is also included.

name: Fröschchen, hüpf!
description: The little frogs are jumping around the pond. Both dice are used: First your frog is moved according to the dots on the die. It jumps toward the right or left. If it lands on a mound of earth, it can jump forwards toward the pond! Then, the stork is moved using the colored die, stalking in a clockwise direction around the ring of flowers. Watch out! If there is a frog in the same segment of the circle as the stork, the frog is frightened into jumping away from the pond! The winner is the player first able to snatch two flies from the pond.

name: Get Stuck
description:
Get Stuck is a cross between a card game and a board game. Lay out 48 cards in a 7x7 grid with a gap in the center. One player plays black and one plays red. Each player moves their own color card into the gap and turns it face down. Then the next player does the same. The first player to "get stuck" and not be able to move a card loses the round and takes a point penalty.

Get Stuck can be played with 2 players or with 4 using the partnership rules.

name: De Ronde van Frankrijk
description: Dutch cycling game. The box contains a 64x46cm. game board, 4 teams of 3 riders and a yellow & green jersey rider. Movement is based upon using tactical cards, there are also chance cards. Like in the real Tour-de-France, the game also features mountains. The general classification is calculated by points that can be won at the finish of a stage, on top of the mountains and at the intermediates.

name: Doctor Who Weetabix Action Game
description:
Game given away free with Weetabix Cereal.

A simple roll die and move game, with the addition of 'Action Zones' on the boards which may contain a different enemy every game that have different effects on a player who lands on them.

The objective is to get from a starting area to the Tardis first.

The game had a total of 4 different boards.

Race Through Space
With Skaro, Metebelis III & the Timelords.

Travel Through Time
With the Mandragoran Helix.

Discover the Lost Planet
With the Thals, dinosaurs and the Skarasen.

Escape from the Underworld
With Silurians and U.N.I.T.

The game also came with stand up character cards ranging from Wirrn to Krynoids. Most creatures are from the Tom Baker era of Doctor Who, with a few Jon Pertwee characters making an appearance. Such as an Exxilon & Aggedor.

These cards were placed in the 'Action Zones' and may help or hinder the players.

Forgetting the simple roll & move nature of the game, the art work by Gordon Archer was excellent. The game also had a number of monsters/characters that will not be found in the other Doctor Who games which normally come with the regular Daleks & Cybermen.

At least one of the game boards (Escape from the Underworld)was released as a seperate game by the BBC and could be found in Doctor Who Easter Show bags in Australia around 1978.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Alta
description: Alta is a connection game played on a diamond-shaped board. An unusual twist of the game is that players place diagonal lines, called "switches," in the squares, which can be slanted either forward or backward. A player can either put a new switch on the board or "toggle" the direction of one of his switches. The object of the game is to connect two "nodes" at opposite corners of the board.

name: Trivial Pursuit Singles: R & R
description: 600 questions about things you do while you're just kickin' back in a wedge-shaped storage container.

name: Hungry Wolves
description:
Which is the best herding dog in the valley of the hungry wolves? Shouting “Woof!” and “Baa” the players move round the meadow. It’s now or never to catch up with the next dog and be the first to collect three sheep and win this romping die game for 2-4 players.

Hungry Wolves (Würfelwölfe) is a hectic action game with dice. The players circle a flock of sheep with their herding dogs. All players throw their dice simultaneously and have to perform an action as fast as possible depending on the dice throw, e.g. saying "Woof!" or running around the table.
Also, the movement of the dog depends on the dice throw.

As soon as the action is performed, the dice throwing continues. When one dog reaches or overtakes another, the round ends and the faster dog gets a sheep from the flock as a reward.

The game is on the recommendation list of the SdJ-jury 2009.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Dice
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Yotta Know Mammals
description:
Part of a series of "Yotta Know..." games on different topics, Yotta Know Mammals is a game played on a six-by-six grid board on which players place cards depicting mammals to be identified. The first player to identify seven mammals wins the round. Rolling dice adds a randomizing element to gameplay, while a handicap system allows players of varying knowledge levels to play against each other.
The game uses a deck of 63 mammals, all of which are found in North America.
Expanded by:

Yotta Know Birds
Yotta Know Waterfowl

name: The Game of Four
description: A "go fish" style card game. Jewish passover educational game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Memory, Religious

name: I Spy Holiday Wishes
description: Spy and remember all the gifts on the wish list. Collect the most wish cards and make all of your holiday wishes come true...you win!

name: Black Stories: Köln Edition
description: How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party. This version of the black stories has mysteries related to the city of Cologne (Köln).
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Täringujalgpall
description: Soccer game that uses two different dice - one classical and one shaped like a soccer ball (metal ball inside that makes it possible to roll a number). It is a game of luck and statistics. Also there is a goalie figure and a score cards. Its about change. Try hitting it in to the corner from a half a court, be good with luck and dice. The closer you are the easier it gets to hit a goal.

name: Sports Marbles
description:
Product Description
Soccer & ten pin bowling with marbles. Comes with marble launcher (plastic tube with curved ramp), a soccer net with goalie and a soccer ball painted large marble, ten heavy duty plastic bowling pins and a large marble painted with finger holes, a two piece plastic ramp, and a bag of marbles all in a tin box.

name: Sneeuwwitje en de zeven dwergen
description:
Sneeuwwitje en de zeven dwergen is a simple roll-and-move game. Players are one of the seven dwarfs, trying to get to Snow White first. On your turn, roll the die (d6) and move as many spaces.

If you land on an apple: move either +2 or -2
If you land on an animal: move to the same animal furhter on on the board
If you land in a hole in the board: skip a turn
If you land on the witch: start over

First one to reach Snow White, wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rat Race
description:
Rat Race is a fast-paced card game about big business. Payers hire Clients and Employees, win Contracts, and use their Big Bucks to buy Perks for their office.

On each turn, you collect income from your Clients, plus your base income of one buck each turn. You may attempt to play one Contract each turn for additional income. Next, play as many cards from your hand as you can afford. You can hire more Clients who boost your future income, hire Employees who increase your Status and protect you from certain Events, and you can play Events to trash or steal your opponents' best stuff.

You also buy Perks for your office, which is what gives you the most game-winning Status points. Upgrade your metal desk to a Mahogony Desk. Enjoy the view from your 40th story window. Spruce up the place with a Private Washroom, Masseuse, or an Objet D'Art. If you complete a 3x3 office, you also get a 3-point bonus.

Once the draw deck is empty, each player adds up his or her Status Points. The player with the highest Status total wins.

Official website:
http://www.wunderland.com/WTS/Chort/ratrace/index.html

name: The Magic Bag
description: A turn is comprised of rolling the dice three times in an attempt to create the patterns listed in the nine rows you set up at the beginning of the game. If you complete a row, you get to draw a coin from the bag to see which treasure you’ve won! You only need match the number on the tiles, but if any of your dice match both the suit and the number, you’ll win bonus draws from the bag. If your roll does not match anything on the board, you have the option of discarding a treasure to take another turn. If you choose not to do this, the game ends and the score is tabulated.

name: Who, What & Where
description:
From the publisher:

THE CLASSIC GAME OF PEOPLE, THINGS & PLACES

This name-dropping party game challenges players to describe for their teammates a host of people, places and things it could be anything from Aladdin, Acupuncture, or Abbey Road to Zebras, Zurich, or even Zappa! Great fun for two teams and packed with content, this party in a box will get everyone guessing and laughing out loud.

Contents
-Who Cards, What Cards, Where Cards
-Game board
-Game pawns
-Sand timer

name: Dots
description: Dots is an abstract game of strategy. Score points by lining up the colors. Sounds simple enough, right? Scoring is done 1 for 1, this means one red dot lined up with 2 red dots scores 3 points for the player who layed the piece. There is a twist however; you must subtract the total # of mismatched dots from your score. The more colors you can line up, the more points you earn and the less points you subtract. Its a battle of scoring more positive points than negative points while competing against an opponent who's being extra careful not to set you up for any high scoring opportunities.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Świat Dinozaurów
description: In this game, the player operates and develops its flock of ancient reptiles, must ensure access to water holes. Dinosaurs should be deployed on the board so as to form a herd, the young dinosaurs hatch from eggs and adults occupy more land for your cluster. Unfortunately, the ancient earth was filled with threats, most are predatory Tyrannosaurus! Once the board is moving so terrifying reptile hunts for smaller vulnerable individuals, you have to keep meeting with him. Your herd may dissipate after the attack, Tyrannosaurus, and your effort to build the herd will go for naught. Win the game the player who takes the largest number of holes and bring together the largest herd.

name: Rechen-Piraten: Das Kartenspiel
description:
The wild number-pirates once again set off on treasure hunt: Capt. Mathematikus and his parrot Lora sail the Seven Seas. “Treasure island on starboard!“, Lora suddenly caws. Which number treasure will they find today? All players calculate at the same time. Each card displays four arithmetic problems. But only one goes with the operators on the dices. The first player to provide the correct solution receives the card as their reward. Winner is the first to collect five cards.

A pirate-worthy card game for 2 – 4 number pirates
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Pirates

name: Three Hoorays for the King
description:
Ninth entry in TCS series of pnp wargames on English Civil War.
It features the battles of Adwalton Moor, Stratton and Cropredy Bridge.
It uses a chit drawing system to activate the leader, then proceeds with a simple method for resolving movement and combat, with great importance given to morale.

Each game features a single map (1A4 for Stratton and Adwalton Moor; 2A4 for Cropredy Bridge), plus 216 counters, 5 pages of rules and 2 pages of charts and tables.

Part of the English Civil War Series:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgamefamily/4086/tcs-ecw-se...
categories: Civil War, Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Septime
description:
During the course of the game the players try making a combination of seven tiles. There are two ways of playing i.e. The Basic game play and the Central Game

In the Basic Game, the game ends when one of the players has filled all of his 7 boxes with 7 tiles of his kind.

In the Central Game, the goal is to gather 6 tiles in a straight line connected to a central tile.

(Translated from Dutch/French)

name: Galactic Warfare
description:
These rules are an attempt to give a simple but interesting and enjoyable game without all the complexities normally associated with a set of wargame rules. The game can be played on any flat surface with the minimum of equipment. The one essential being space ship models, these can be made from balsa wood and card or purchased in kit form complete with swivelling base from Skytrex Ltd. (from the rules introduction).

An A5 booklet with a set of rules for space ship combat using miniatures or card counters. Includes rules for campaigns.

name: Affenparty
description:
In the middle of the table, there is a battery-driven coconut which makes a sound when a player puts his/her hand on it.
The players hold cards and simultaneously place a face-down card in front of the player to the left. These are then picked up. A player who holds cards of only one kind hits the coconut as fast as possible. Everyone else then puts their hand on it, too. The hands form an order. Now treasure cards are flipped up (as many as there are players). The first player (whose hand hit the coconut first) has the first pick, then the next one, etc. Treasure cards contain actions that can be executed immediately or contain positive or negative points.
When the treasure cards are used up, the player with most points is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Electronic, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: WW2
description:
This game is Strategy WW2 Game.This game is a multiple player game. Each player becomes a leader in Japan, the United States, the German Soviet Union, and Britain, and makes good use of the combat and diplomacy.

Because the unit has the air force, the army, and naval forces, efficient operation is demanded.

It is not possible to win if the alliance is still important, and there is no strategy that conspires with allied forces to obtain the good chance to win in this game.

name: Schlag den Raab: Speed Puzzle
description:
Who will be the fastest?

Two puzzles with the same picture and the same size (81 pieces) and six actioncards will guarantee a nice and funny competition.

The actioncards are optional and give different options solving the puzzle.

1. start with the outer parts of the puzzle (Frame)
2. solve the puzzle upside down
3. start with the round piece in the middle and build around
4. finish with the round piece in the middle
5. be the first - however
6. start with the lower row and build upwards

name: Das große Tier-Rätsel
description:
In Das große Tier-Rätsel, designer Gunter Baars has taken the picture-hiding and revelation device from Wolfgang Kramer's 1994 release Klappe auf! and built a new game around it. In that earlier game, one player would reveal sections of an image bit by bit until another player would guess what the image showed; the earlier you guess the image, the more points you score.

For Das große Tier-Rätsel the core of that earlier game remains in place: Players try to guess the identities of animals hiding in the picture box. But in addition to that challenge, players need to guess various qualities about the animal in question: What does it eat? Is it faster or slower than a human? How many legs does it have? It is a mammal or reptile? Each animal card has two sets of questions relating to it, and players in the know will score additional points. The first player to circle the score track wins the game.

Re-implements Klappe auf!

name: Variété Paris
description:
Goal: Manage your 'emerging' artistic skills to describe/paint/pantomime/poetize terms within a given time - if successful collect chips (baguettes, cheese, bottle of red wine, glass of champagne); game ends after one player has build up a complete dinner.

1 Rolling a six-sided die with icons players move their tokens by turns onto the appropriate next located area.
2 The icon shows the type of requested performance; a second die predicts the number/term on the actual item-card player must illustrate
3 Within a minute term should be guessed by one of the players - both be rewarded depending on difficulty with several chips
Easy to understand that - if you are in a 'Variété' - sometimes terms can be a bit saucy, which is intended by designers self-evidently (see minimum age); because of the different values of the chips (swap meet advantages alcohol, especially champagne) a lot of baguettes will pass through your fingers until game ends

name: Space Gunman
description:
The player controls a Space Gunman exploring a derelict Space Station on a mission to destroy the Alien infestation there. Each turn the player moves through the station building the map with a deck of room tiles. In between movement a die is rolled to see where Robots and Aliens show up and wait to attack the player. The combat is fast and simple requiring only one d6 to determine success or injury. The game is divided into 3 missions, each with their own objective.

During this short 20 minute adventure the player is tasked with shutting down the security robots, locating the deceased operative who failed HIS attempt, destroying the Alien nest of eggs, and finally escaping!

More and more enemies appear the further the player progresses, but there is Battle Armor hidden in the Lair to even the odds - but is it worth the detour?

This is a light print and play game which requires very little paper and not much cutting. Players will need to provide their own token to mark their location and a six-sided die.

name: El Panal
description: This object of this game is to score the most points by completing the highest scoring spaces in the gameboard. To do this, the players use a set of multiple shaped pieces (composed by 1, 2, 3 or 4 hexagons, hence the "El panal" -the honeycomb- name) that fit into each other.

name: Soccer Tactics World: Xtra Teams
description:
The Xtra Teams are expansion packs for Soccer Tactics, which comes with Red and Blue teams. Two different Xtra Team expansions are available, one with Green and Yellow teams, another with Orange and Black teams.

Each expansion pack includes:
- 22 wood pawns (in two team colours)
- 2 team dice (in two team colours)
- one soccer ball

name: Four Seasons Chess
description: An interesting four-player version of chess from medieval Spain. Each player represents one of the seasons, and starts the game with a king, a rook, a knight, a bishop and four pawns in one corner of the board. The pawns are split, and move away from the corner in one of two directions. Each player is supposed to attack the player to his right, and on checkmating his opponent takes over the use of his pieces. From Alfonso X's Book of Games.

name: Hue Turn
description:
Can you see your pattern on the board? If not, add a peg or make a Hue Turn to get the pattern you need to score your card! Patterns show two, three or four peg positions with complex patterns worth more points than simple ones. See how good your pattern recognition is.

The cards each show a pattern of 2, 3, or 4 colored dots, and are divided into a 2-dot deck, a 3-dot deck, and a 4-dot deck.
Players start with 3 cards (one from each deck), a set of double-sided Pegs (Red/Silver Pegs, Silver/Black Pegs, and Black/Red Pegs), and Green "Hue Turn" Pegs.

On their turn, a player may either place one of their Pegs onto the board (with either color facing up), or discard a Green "Hue Turn" Peg to flip an existing Two-Colored Peg on the board. The current player then reveals any Pattern Cards that were created by the action they took this turn, keeping them in front of them for scoring at the end of the game. Then they refill their hand from any of the draw piles.

The game ends after any two decks are exhausted and all remaining players take one more turn. Score one point for each colored dot on the cards you collected, plus 2 points for each unused Hue Turn Peg. The highest total wins!

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Pattern Recognition, Spatial Visualization

name: Einfach tierisch!
description:
4 small kangaroos are visiting the zoo and want to learn about the other animals. The animal cards are placed face-up beside the gameboard, each player draw a card. Player roll the dice and move to any direction. Landing on tile player turn it and sees if it fits the animal he has to get it.

If the tiles are taken, player with the most animals acquired is the winner.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Trivia
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Bob's Full House
description:
Based on a very popular gameshow which was hosted by Bob Monkhouse. It ran from 1984 to 1990.

Box includes board, wipe off markers, 'Bingo' cards, golden card planner, Monkhouse mastercards, prize cards, general subject and special subjects question books, plus instruction leaflet.

As players answer quiz questions correctly, they gradually complete their Bingo card. The objective is to be the first to do just that. Your Bingo numbers are marked off with a chinagraph pencil and they can easily be erased so that the cards are ready for the next game.

Bob Monkhouse (1928 - 2003) is pictured on the cover.

name: DiceAFARI: Kickstarter Map Card
description: This is an additional map card available as an exclusive reward for those who pledged to support the "DiceAFARI" Kickstarter project.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Tanks
description:
Tanks is a tactical level wargame in WW2 Eastern Front for beginners.

Firefight is resolved by two-steps, determination of hit and Penetration.

Players control the armored force of either Germany or the Soviet union.
Victory conditions vary by scenarios.

There are 6 basic game scenarios. If you play the evolving game rules, you add infantry and anti-tank guns, unit concealment and dummy units. You can also make scenarios by your own.

[German Army】
Panzer III type J, Panzer IV type H, Panther type G, Tiger I, Tiger II, StuG III assault gun, Jagdpanzer IV, Jagdpanzer V (Jagpanther), Jagdpanzer VI (Jagdtiger), Ferdinand, Hetzer, Murder III
PAK 38, PAK 40, FLAK 37, PAK 43

[Soviet Army]
T34/76, T34/85, KV IC, JS II, SU 76, SU 100
76.2 mm

Components:
One rule book (16 pages)
2 maps (A3 size)
240 counters (13.5 mm)
1 game chart (cover back)
publishers: Epoch, Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社)

name: Flossen hoch!
description:
Flossen hoch! is a kid's game about fishing with the players being penguins who waddle around looking for food. Heeeeeeeere, fishie, fishie fishie!

Each player has a penguin and a set of short to long fish. Before the game begins, players place the fish into slots in the ocean's surface, with only the heads being visible.
