Players roll a die and play simultaneously. When a color is rolled, players have to "catch" fish of the matching color as quickly as possible. If you pick empty fishbones instead, bad luck! When a fish is rolled, each player grabs his own fish; when a shark appears, each player must save all fish of her own color. Whenever you successfully grab a fish, the length of the fish determines how far your penguin moves forward on the race track.

name: The Lonely Dead
description:
Implementing a deck of cards, some dice and a pocketful of loose change, take control of a Zombie Horde and work to overrun a Survivor Safehouse before you are exterminated!

The solo player divides a standard playing card deck into face cards and number cards, dealing relevant cards into piles representing the Survivors and their Safehouse, Items, and Zombies. The player, as the Zombies, then attacks the Survivors in an attempt to wear their numbers down until no Survivors remain.

It is a game of chance and skill, and very portable. Check out the files section for the full extended rules, a quick-reference printable version (which folds up to fit in your pack of cards), and an extraneous (but helpful) flowchart of gameplay (because flowcharts make the world a better place.)

Relatively recently added: Alternate card faces for all numbered cards representing both items and zombies, as well as zombified jacks, queens, kings, aces and jokers.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play, Zombies

name: Black and White
description:
Whispers traveled like thunder through both the choirs and legions, and even though the tones were different the message was exactly the same – it had been found. The end could now begin.

Set in an alternate but familiar world, Black and White pits two players against each other as they try to complete their agenda, namely to either prevent or begin the apocalypse.

In the game, players morally battle for the control of five key figures in the end time by either praising their virtues or exploiting their vices, while fighting to find and recover a holy artifact that holds the key to opening the first seal and bring the world to its end. This is achieved through the play of cards that affect either specific characters or less powerful cards that can target any character. At the end of each round of play, the first player rolls to take control of characters. This roll's success is determined through comparison to the morality score of each character. The player who takes control of each character moves it, trying to pick up and deliver the artifact to that player's own base.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Ratz Fatz auf die Baustelle
description:
A construction-site themed educational children's game in the RatzFatz series.

The game consists of 16 picture tiles, three wooden pieces (excavator, road compactor, concrete mixing transport truck), a color die and a booklet with several game ideas for kids of various ages. The picture tiles show different tools (pincers, hammer, shovel, drill, ladder), materials (cement, bricks, stone, sand), pieces of clothing (helmet, boiler suit, glove, protective vest, shoe, tool belt) and screws.
The basic game idea is that an adult reads or tells a story or a poem, and the children have to grab tiles when they hear the names of the items on those tiles. The player with most tiles is the winner, but it is also playable with just one kid.

Other ideas presented in the booklet include memory games, sorting activities (sort tiles into tools, clothing, construction materials), and telling what an object is used for.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Dice and Dominoes Racing
description:
A simple toy racing game for toddlers using dominoes and 6 sided dice.

Players race their toys around a domino track by rolling 2d6 and moving to their choice of matching domino with _one_ of the two dice.

Designed to teach the following Little Geek Skills Syllabus items.
- Rolling Dice
- Counting Pips
- Moving a token
- Matching Numbers
- Taking Turns
- Winning/Losing gracefully
- Tactical Choice
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Party Game, Racing
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Grenzeloos
description:
A family game where players travel around Europe and export their products to each country.

Players roll the die to move around the game board. They first have to capture the European flag from the middle of the board, or from a fellow player. Once one has the flag, one can proceed to open up the borders of each European country in order. When you open up a country, an export document is revealed, and the opening player can score points by handing in the goods pictured.

name: Bolonki
description:
The objective of the game is: all the tokens of one player have to reach the opposite side of the board, the first player to do this, wins.
Each player takes 6 tokens of the same color and places them face down on one of the four sides of the board.
In each turn, the player moves a token to any of the neighboring cells that are not occupied; you can also jump a token on any other, only if the following cell is empty.
As all tokens back are the same, the player will have to remember which ones are his tokens and which those of their adversaries.
When a token reaches the opposite side of the board, the player has to check if that token is of his color.
If is of his color, the token is put it off the board waiting for the other 5 tokens until the 6 ones reach their destination.
If is not of his color, the token has to return to the cell where it started the move.
When the 6 tokens of one of the players reaches the opposite side of the board the game ends.

name: Kot na Ranchu
description: Promo for Rancho. Kot (Cat) is a big tile. When all dogs are bought by players anyone can buy Cat for one rabbit. Dogs are chasing a Cat and go back to the herd. So all dogs are again ready to buy.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Farming
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Armalion: Der Orkensturm
description:
From the back side of the book (translated from german):

The Orkensturm is a source and scenario book for both the miniature game Armalion as well as for the RPG The Dark Eye (Das Schwarze Auge). It contains:
- A historical overview of the development of the Storm of the Orcs (Orkensturm).
- Rondras defense: A multi-part scenario for the dramatic four days of Greifenfurt . in which decides the battle for the Temple Rondra the fate of an entire city. While the defenders are becoming fewer, the orcs are not only fighting against knights, but also against the clock.
- A campaign that accompanies the whole Orkensturm: Several scenarios based on each other and support the course of the war from the initial assault on the Svelltland up to the final battle on the Silkwiesen. You'll also find numerous adventure ideas and approaches in order to minimize the time between each encounter as role-playing adventure.
- A complete list of army of orcs, humans, and their respective allies.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Schattenmonster
description:
Schattenmonster is a memory game. In the basic version, players take turns flipping open pairs of tiles - matching pairs can be kept, others are flipped back. Pairs consists of a monster picture on a colored background and its shadow on a grey background.
In the advanced rules, flipping open certain monsters without finding the matching tile immediately leads to special actions, such as everyone passing the collected pairs to the left, to the right, or re-shuffling the remaining tiles. The first two effects can be used tactically as well.
The player with most pairs is the winner.

name: Long Story Short
description:
From publisher:
Long Story Short is a hit party game that mixes social media with the time-tested fun of storytelling. Each round, the Storyteller shares an experience or story with the group using the fun story starters. The storyteller tells a story that is either true or false. Players then make the long story short by creating a headline, drawing a picture, writing a text, or crafting a tweet for the story told according to the dice roll. Then story-teller scores his favorite short stories.

Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Ein Schaf
description:
Ein Schaf (also titled ひつじがいっぴき, or Hitsuji ga Ippiki in Japanese) is a simple children’s card game.

The deck consists of cards with anywhere from one to seven sheep on them. Play proceeds with one player playing the “one”, the next player playing the “two”, and so on in order of rank. Players may at any time take a card from the deck and reset the count to one. Players must take a card if they do not have the correct card to play. The first player to get rid of his or her entire hand is the winner.

name: Pardoes de Sprookjesmeester
description:
An official Pardoes game

De villagers of Symbolica are in an uproar. All fairy tales are stolen from Pardoes' Star chamber, so now Pardoes has to travel across all six fairy tale lands to collect his fairy tales again. Of course the dark force who stole the fairy tales is after Pardoes as well. But Pardoes is a smart kid and confuses the dark force by duplicating himself while searching for the fairy tales. But only the real Pardoes can bring the fairy tales back to the Star chamber. Are you the real Pardoes?

The game is designed and illustrated by Henny Knoet

The game consists of one main board with the Star chamber and six small boards; the fairy tale lands. On each board you find four different kind of spaces:
- neutral spaces (nothing happens)
- question marks: if you answer the question right, you may roll the dice again
- Pardoes spaces: Solve a Pardoes task for example, move your pawn two spaces
- Fairy tale points: If you answer the question right, you'll get a fairy tale card

Goal of the game is to collect three different fairy tale cards from three different fairy tale lands and deliver them to the Star chamber
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rifugio: Helicopter
description:
This expansion adds another faster way of moving to the game and an extra way to earn victory points too.

Helicopters enable you to take an extra step towards your goal.

If someone else uses your helicopter you get extra points.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Monopoly: Bailiwick of Guernsey
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Bailiwick of Guernsey, an island in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Telltale
description:
Everyone likes a good story but what’s the best kind? A good old-fashioned murder-mystery, or a swords-and-sandals historical epic? A fantastical fairytale or a bit of domestic drama? Or maybe a mixture of the lot! In Telltale you get to decide because you are the storyteller.

Players bid for story cards, then put them together to create their very own mini-masterpieces. Points are awarded for combinations of cards, and for the best story of the round. The first player to reach 50 points is the winner – and is declared the master storyteller!

name: Katzenpolizei
description:
What a mess! All of the cats in the area went on an exciting mouse hunt together, but now they want to return home. Both the cat parents and kittens are having a difficult time finding each other amidst the chaos! Luckily the police cat is around to keep order and protect the cats that have already found each other.

In Katzenpolizei, the players collect the cats! If the die lands on the relevant symbol, then the players take a card and lay it down in front of them on the table. However, sometimes a cheeky mouse or the naughty neighbor's dog throws a wrench in the works and their cats run away. The players' cats are safe only when the whole family is reunited OR when they enjoy the protection provided by the police cat. The aim of the game is to match up as many cats as possible.

name: Europolis orase din romania
description: Europolis orase din romania is a Monopoly-like game where you can make real estate transactions in various cities: you can buy land, villas and hotels that brings rental income or you can become the owner of roads or utilities which also enable you to gain.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Funny Farmer
description:
Game description from the publisher:

It's harvest time, and all the farmers, young and old, are on their feet and in high spirits, ready to celebrate a good harvest.

Players in Funny Farmer want to help bring in the harvest, and Johnny Tractor is ready to go out into the field. But how successful you are with the harvest and how many vegetables you bring back depends on how well you control Johnny. You can't take too long, though, as a thunderstorm is coming, and those torrential rains will end the harvest.

name: Wild West Way
description:
John wants to place his cowboy to the gold mine and so does Carl & Abby. There is only one vacancy for the job. How to solve? Let's settle it the "Wild West Way".

Wild West Way (WWW) is a free print & play card game for up to five players. Each player is a new comer to the town & wants to build up his/her fame through different achievements. Before building up the fame, a player also needs to build up his/her various skills like shooting, brawling, gambling or horse riding. The more skillful a player is the higher chance a player can win over certain characters or buildings.

In each turn, players place their meeples to different buildings. A player may borrow money from the bank, take a wanted poster from the sheriff's office, donate to the church, buy items from the general store, or meet various town characters at the saloon. A player may also challenge other players with a gun duel, bar fight, horse racing or even a poker game.

When the game ends, the player with most fame points wins & becomes the new mayor of the town.

name: Cards: The Attackening!
description:
Cards: The Attackening! is a limited collectible card game (LCCG) for 2 - 5 players. Games take anywhere from 15 - 45 minutes, depending on how many people are playing. The game works on a system of sharing decks. I.e., instead of everyone bringing separate decks, there are three decks in each copy of the game from which every player draws. Specifically, Cards: The Attackening! consists of an Attackener deck (characters); Arsenal deck (Pets, Weapons, Armor, Evasions, and miscellaneous Items); and Twists of Fate (scenarios that affect gameplay - e.g., SciFi Attackeners gain a certain advantage while attacking.).

The game is played by every player drawing three Attackeners, three Arsenal cards, playing their first Attackener and then rolling to see who draws and plays the first Twist of Fate. The player with the highest roll chooses three Twists of Fate, and choosing the one that benefits them the most. That player then draws one Arsenal card, plays one, and attacks an opponent by rolling a die. Damage is determined by the amount rolled (1 is a miss, 2 is half damage, 3-5 is full, and 6 is double). If the opponent does not evade the attack, they take the damage and the move is passed to the next player, who follows the above steps to complete their turn.

When an Attackener's health is depleted, the person who beat that Attackener collects the card as a trophy. The person who was beaten chooses the next Twist of Fate, but does not play their next Attackener until it is their turn to play. This gives them a few rounds of immunity while play continues. The game is over when one player has collected three trophies from any player in the game.

name: Find the Word
description:
It's an excellent party game similar to Taboo!

You have to describe a word to your teammates without using some words written on your card in a specific time! If successful you gain the card and you start a new one if there is still time. The team with the most cards wins at the end of the game!

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Main Power Grid Resource
description: Main Power Grid Cards are a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 3, "Zero Hour," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Temporal Cold War. It is considered a Resource and costs a variable number of squadron points.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Appetizing Castle
description:
Аппетитный замок (Appetizing Castle) is a push-your-luck dice game, for 2-4 players who try to build the strongest castle for princess Larissa, using dice towers.

The hungry monster Kirpicheyadny ate Princess Larissa's Castle. Players help her to build a new home using dice towers, with as many as 5 dice of different sizes. Dice should be collected from largest to smallest. If building the tower failed, Kirpicheyadny begins to move, and he will want to eat the unfinished castle!

How to draw a monster from the construction? Bake cakes: even a monster makes the right choice, what to eat, when offered a cake and a brick.

name: Disney Riesen Bilder-Rallye
description:
Disney Riesen Bilder-Rallye is a cooperative spin-and-move children's game with a Disney theme.

The goal is to reach Cinderella's castle before the clock strikes midnight, and the game board is a "wimmelbild", i.e., a look-and-find picture along the lines of Where's Waldo. On your turn, you spin the spinner and act accordingly:


Numbers 1-8: Move your Disney pawn 1 to 8 spaces on the road forward.
Clock: Move the hand of the clock 1 or 2 hours forward.
Mickey-Mouse: Draw and reveal the first card from the deck, turn over the sand timer, and together try to find and mark with plastic rings the depicted objects on the game board. Stop and count after the timer has run through. All may move their pawns the number of correctly marked objects.


If all reach the castle before the clock strikes midnight, the game is won.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: U Mad Bro?
description:
Cthuhulu awakens, promptly dies from pollution, and his corpse washes up on the Jersey shore. You're a boardwalk bro looking to impress some babes, but these girls are demanding you grab some tentacles off that nasty dome and don't care about the stuffed banana you won at ring toss! Keep grabbing tentacles until you either give up or go crazy in this pub style push your luck card game.

There are three types of cards: tentacles, junk, and madness. Players want to get as many tentacle cards as possible to win the round, but anyone who draws a madness card goes crazy and is out. Dawn cards are kept face down, so players don't know how many of anyone else's cards are tentacles, and how many are junk. First to win three rounds, wins.

name: Deep Deep Dungeon
description:
Art by Luka Rejec - an amazing artist and gamer in Switzerland.
Inspiration comes from Drew Chamberlain (Dungeon Delve) and Nick Hayes (Utopia Engine).

name: Zazuu's Quest
description:
From the publisher:

Help Zazuu find his way home through the dangers of deep space! A Space Adventure Card Game for the whole family!

Zazuu’s Quest is a fun game of strategy, math, & luck where players take a ride through space with Zazuu & his friend, Toki, in a quest to find his home planet. Be the first to explore all 9 regions of the galaxy, evading gamma rays & alien encounters. Designed for 2-4 players, ages 4 and up. The game play is focused on accumulating numeric cards in sequence (1-9) and strategically using wild cards to keep other players from completing the nine card set. Engaging graphics & quality (USA made) cards offer a fun way to engage in logic & cognitive development for young learners.

name: Die drei !!!: Geheimnis der alten Villa
description: In the cooperative dice game Die drei !!!: Geheimnis der alten Villa, the players help Kim, Franzi and Marie to unravel the mystery of the old mansion, finding the precious diamonds hidden within before time runs out and Antoine the master thief makes off with the gems on his own.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Structural Damage Check Resource
description:
The Structural Damage Check Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in The Doomsday Machine Episode Organized Play Event. It is considered a Resource and costs 5 squadron points.

When using this Resource, place 5 Auxiliary Power Tokens on it to start the game. After every ship has moved, you may choose to place 1 token from this Resource beside a ship in your fleet (once per round). If you do so, you may:

1) Repair 1 damage to that ship's Hull. OR

2) Flip 1 critical damage that is assigned to that ship face down.

Remove the Resource from the game when all the tokens are expended.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Balancing Tree
description: The player that can stack and balance the tree and the birds quickest, without making it fall is the winner.

name: Rotation
description:
A challenging maze game that combines elements of a maze and connect four.

Each player gets 9 chips. Insert your chips in the maze wheel. Turn the wheel to strategically move your chips through the maze wheel. Maneuver the maze wheel to get your chips in the slots. Get three chips in a row to win the game.

name: Egyptian Solitaire
description:
Egyptian Solitaire is a solitaire puzzle game using Icehouse Pieces. Imagine a game of Peg Solitaire getting combined with a Rubik's Cube.

The Goal of the game is to remove as many pyramids as possible from the 3x4 board to achieve the lowest score.

The board is made up of 12 pyramid nests (a nest is a large pyramid atop a medium pyramid, atop a small pyramid) on a 3x4 grid.

Each turn, use the top pyramid to hop over an adjacent top pyramid and land on the following location. Immediately remove the top pyramid that was hopped. The twist is that pyramids are only allowed to land on a pyramid of the same size or on an empty space on the board.

When no more legal moves are possible, count the pips on all of the remaining pyramids on the board to get your final score.
Larges = 3 pts. Mediums = 2 pts. Smalls = 1 pt.
It is possible to end the game with 1 point. This is considered a perfect score.

Egyptian Solitaire is featured in the recently succesful Kickstarter campaign of Pyramid Arcade by Looney Labs.

name: Sums in Space
description: Sums in Space is a children's game. The game has a board with a start and a finish. The winner is the player first to reach the goal. To get there the player roll three dice, two with number on then, and one with - or +. The player then organise the dice to get a sum, and then move the sum on the board. On some spots on the board the sum must be even or odd.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Goudjacht
description:
In the year 1799 the ship The Lutine shipwrecked for the coast of Holland. It carried large amounts of gold and silver. Until now there's still a large amount of this treasures left at the bottom of the sea.

In this cardgame the sea bottom is simulated by 36 cards representing treasure or sand. Each type of treasure has a different value. To win the game you have to play your handcards better than other players to recover the treasure.

When all treasure is recovered the player with the most points wins the game.

Happy treasure hunting!

name: Hipsters and Hamsters
description:
From the publisher:

Hipsters and Hamsters is a light card game for individual or team play. To begin play, each player is dealt four cards. In a unique twist, players can win the game in one of two ways. Players win as a Hipster by having no cards in their hand at the end of their turn. Players win as a Hamster by having eight (or more) cards in their hand at the end of their turn.

There are four card types. Object cards serve as simple discards. No action is taken when Object cards are played. Action cards trigger the action shown on the card when played, helping players eliminate, or accumulate, cards. Calamity cards can be played at the start of an opponent’s turn, forcing the opponent to take the action on the Calamity card. Comeback cards can be played on Calamity cards, in which case it becomes the turn of the person playing the Comeback card. Depending on the Comeback card, that person either takes the action on the Calamity card, or ignores it, before starting their turn.

Despite its pick-up-and-play game mechanic, Hipsters and Hamsters is filled with dynamic and precisely-balanced strategy, as opposing sets of victory conditions cause players to flip between playing styles in reaction to draws and opponent actions, all while attempting to control turn order to alter the flow of play.

In the Basic game, players do not declare which character style (Hipster or Hamster) they are playing as and can switch between styles at any time, as many times as they wish, allowing them to adjust their strategy on-the-fly. In the Advanced variant and Team play, players declare their character style in advance and receive bonus points for winning the round as their declared character.

name: The Campaign for Vicksburg 1863 AD
description:
Vicksburg was the key. Holding it meant "holding the South together," with access to all the western men, food, horses, supplies... and Mexican ports. Holding it also meant the Mississippi River could not be freely used by the North, for transporting troops and supplies, nor by Midwestern farmers, for shipping exported goods. Can you, as the Federal forces, match U.S. Grant's finest campaign? Can you, commanding for the Confederacy, gather your scattered troops and create a force strong enough to punish Grant for his audacity?

This division-level hex-and-counter game includes Grant's Army of the Tennessee, facing off against the oft-at-odds Army of Mississippi of Pemberton and Army of Tennessee of Johnston.

The sweep and scope of the campaign are included, from Grant's Crossing at Bruinsburg to the finale (or not). Interesting side stories are included, like Grierson's Raid, the CSS Arkansas, and "that devil Forrest" and his part--or not-- in the grand campaign.

name: Iketara Ikuyo!
description:
User summary
行けたら行くよ! (Iketara Ikuyo!) in English would mean "I'll go if I can!". This game is the official board game of Japanese Manga "Majime Kei Kuzu no Nichijou (Everyday of serious type scum)".

"I'll skip school events more smartly than everyone else does!"

In this game, players try to live lazily, eluding tiresome school activities while not destroying your reputation with your classmates. Your reputation is gauged by school hierarchy. You go up ranks in the hierarchy if you accomplish something with your classmates, and go down if you blow off something.

Players have the same deck of cards, each of which is numbered 0 to 2 indicating how much energy they will commit to an activity. Each round, an event card is drawn. Players secretly determine how much energy they commit on that event, placing cards face-down. Then all cards are revealed simultaneously.

If the event is co-operative, players need to commit a certain number of total energy to accomplish. If successful, all involved players go up ranks. If the event is competitive, only players who have committed the highest energy are successful and go up ranks.

But you should not over-commit an event because the victory goes to the player with the most energy saved in their hand. Because of that, you may play a "Blow off" card secretly instead of committing energy. It saves you from wasting your cards, and you may draw two cards instead of regular one card at end of the round. But if two or more players play "Blow off", their ranks go down.

After the round, cards played are discarded, except for "Blow off" cards which return to players' hand. When you go up to a certain rank, you may have a friend who can use a special ability for you.

The game ends after several rounds, and you win the game if you save the most energy in your hand, but you can't claim the victory if you are at the lowest rank in the school hierarchy.

Publisher's summary
「オレは学校をサボる！誰よりも上手く！！」
学校で起こる様々なめんどくさい青春イベントをやり過ごし、
周りに嫌われぬまま、楽して生き抜くことを目指すゲーム。
人間関係わずらわしい！めんどくさい事やりたくない！
周りを欺き、裏では手を抜き、本能のまま生きる事を目指す！
学校行事に参加してスクールカーストを上げ、
ここぞという時にサボって体力を貯めこむ！
漫画『まじめ系クズの日常』公式ゲーム
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor

name: Feathers & Wax
description:
Description from the designer:

Daedalus and his son Icarus are imprisoned on the edge of the sea. To escape, Daedalus is searching the labyrinth for feathers and wax to build wings for him and his son so that they can fly to safety.

Once Daedalus has collected his material, he builds two sets of wings. Then, he and his son leap from the tower and attempt to fly to safety. If they get too close to the sun, the wax melts, and some feathers are lost. If they get too close to the sea, some feathers get wet and weighed down and must be shed to keep flying.

If both Daedalus and Icarus can reach the safety of the far off island, they are victorious.

Feathers & Wax is a solo print & play game using a double sided letter size game board, a standard deck of playing cards and two tokens. This game is an entry in the 2016 Solitaire Print 'n Play contest.

name: Raptor Run
description: Raptor Run 3D Game by Buffalo Games is a 3-dimensional game that builds right out of the box and then folds down neatly for storage when the game is over. Players race their raptors to the top of Dino Mountain rescuing baby dinosaur eggs along the way. But they have to be careful not to get knocked off by rolling boulders or they will be sent back down the mountain. The first player to collect an egg and carry it to the nest at the top of the mountain wins! Recommended for 2 to 4 players, ages 4+. Contents include 4 raptors, 10 raptor eggs, 1 boulder die, 5 raptor nests and a 10-inch tall 3-dimensional game board.

name: Star Warships
description: Star Warships is a semi-abstract strategy game where 2 to 4 players move their ships to absorb stars and supernovas, destroy other ships and grow their army. The map is modular and is created turn by turn by the players, same thing for the stars. In each turn the player can have three points to spend in this actions: Move, rotate the ship, bluid the galaxy routs (this is the map), put a star in the map (to obsorb it later, put shields of their ships and bluid new ships. The objetctive of the game is to collect 9 stars, have 2 more ships than the other players or destroy three ships. The first player to achieve any of this objetives is the winer.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Werewolf House
description:
THE GAME

At the start of the game a moderator hands out a role card to each player, assigning them to either a small team of informed werewolves, who know each others identities, or uninformed villagers, who do not know any player identities. The game then alternates in phases of “night”, in which werewolves agree to covertly kill a villager, and “day", in which villagers debate the identities of the werewolves and vote to kill a suspect. Play continues until all of the werewolves have been killed, or until the werewolves outnumber the villagers.

THE CARDS

There are NO DUPLICATES in the Werewolf House deck of 37 different character cards. Each card features a unique, full color character illustration, so even after dozens of game rounds players will still be discovering new art.

CORE CARDS - The base version of the game can be played by 7-12 people, using 6-10 basic villager cards and 1-2 werewolf cards - all included in the Werewolf House deck.

ADVANCED CARDS - It’s fun to mix it up. Dozens of characters with unique abilities have been carefully curated to add complexity to the gameplay, without burdening the moderator with messy role management tasks.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Pfannen-Pannen
description:
There's a lot of hustle and bustle in the restaurant kitchen since hungry guests are waiting for their orders and each of them seems to want something different: spaghetti, fish, pancakes, and more! Who can keep track of who wants what and sizzle the most dishes quickly?

In Pfannen-Pannen, the player chefs need to flip the food tiles in the pans until the desired dish for each guest is in a pan and ready to serve...

name: Ninja All-Stars: Musashi
description:
Musashi is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

For years, Musashi has wandered Kagejima, studying, debating, and fighting with masters from every school he could find. After some years, he found that he no longer sought to master the sword; he sought, instead, to master himself. Since the tool no longer mattered, he abandoned his weapon for a pair of mighty oars. Now he travels on, searching for himself, and refining the art of the wooden blades.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Wooden Blade-Wielding, World Traveler Ronin
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Sports, Video Game Theme

name: Snow Day
description:
The weather outside is frightful! After a day of outside play in the snow, its time to race home. You and your friends split up and head to your respective homes, trying to get there first. Snowballs thrown by your opponents and the blistering cold will slow you down, and if you're not careful, you might freeze before you arrive.

Snow Day has players creating Paths with cards, hoping to create a route from their origin point to their Home. Each turn, a player places a new Path card from a draw pile or manipulates an existing Path, then rolls a Movement Die to determine their movement, and finally accounts for their loss in body temperature. The game acts as a race against both your friends and the weather itself, as players lose temperature on each turn. If their temperature reaches zero, they're frozen solid and eliminated from the competition.

Players can disrupt one another's paths as a defensive move, at the potential cost of their own path development. Special Path cards also allow for a player to chuck an imaginary Snowball at an opponent, speeding up their friend's freezing process. The first player to arrive to their home before freezing is the winner.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Coin Store
description:
The object of the game is to move by a throw of the dice and get all four of your men to the "Coin Store" first for the highest extra bonus on coin values (collected via "Coin Cards" accumulated on the way there). Your men may only move into play with a roll of a one on one of the dice. If more than one man is in play, the roll may be split with each man moving the number of spaces on one die. If doubles are thrown the player gets another roll. A man can only enter the "Coin Store" with an exact number. If more than one man is in play, the roll can be split to allow a man to enter with the exact number.

The player with the highest total of values (plus the bonus), as indicated on the "Coin Cards" held by each player at the end of the game is the winner. All players must finish because lesser bonuses are awarded for both second and third place and the player who finishes first may not necessarily finish with the highest total.

name: Deus Vult: Burn & Loot
description:
From the back of the rulebook:

Deus Vult: Burn & Loot is a new game from Fireforge Games. This book allows you to relive, on a tabletop, the battles of the medieval era using model soldiers.

This game focuses on small engagements fought between the eleventh and fourteenth centuries in both eastern and western Europe. With Burn & Loot you can simulate any kind of battle, from small clashes between border patrols or within cities, to large battles and attacks on strongholds. Several battle scenarios are included in this book so you can face a new challenge every time you play.

In this book you will also find army lists that allow you to quickly and easily assemble a force for battle; more army lists will be published on our official website, and you can download them for free.

We hope that you will enjoy playing this game as much as we enjoyed developing it. But now, it is time to prepare for war!

name: Dirty Toilet Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Dirty Toilet Game is a 2-4 player bathroom humor card game where you need to collect 5 clean toilets and discard your poops. Yet, watch out! Your opponents will try to stop you with poops, problem cards, and more importantly, dirty toilets.

BASIC GAME ACTIONS: Players can perform three basic actions during the course of their turn. They can solve a problem; discard a poop; and, or create a problem. A player’s turn ends when s/he draws two cards from the deck. There are no limit on the number of actions, but players can not use duplicate cards.

STARTING: The game is played in turns, clockwise with each player receiving eight cards. The remaining cards are placed in the center as the draw pile. Each player places their clean toilets in front of them from left to right. The person with the least amount of clean toilets or no clean toilet plays first. If there is more than one person with the lowest amount or no clean toilets, players can start with various options noted in the rule book, available on www.dirtytoiletgame.com.

END OF THE GAME: The game ends with a winner when the following is met: The player has collected five clean toilet points and discarded all poops, without having a problem to solve.

Let's play dirty!

www.dirtytoiletgame.com

name: Ritualia
description:
Ritualia is a fun, light strategy game, where each player starts as a Hermit, leader of a Cult of Nature and competes the other players to become the Prophet of the Realm. The Map of the Realm is always different and compiled by players from 48 tiles, before the game begins. Each Cult has an unique advantage throughout the game, moreover, additional artifacts will grant other powerful advantages. A player's turn is as short as possible, to keep everyone interested: each player throws the dice, chooses one action and performs the effects of that action. The main goal is to gather resources: converting villages or finding powerful artifacts. Luck plays its role in this contest, a dice is used at the beginning of each turn, and each player can sometimes draw cards from three different decks: Artifact Cards, Ruin Cards or Debate Cards. Sacrifice tokens can be obtained during the game and used as extra dice points. The game ends when a player has enough resources to perform the Ritual of Ascending at the King's Castle and becomes the Prophet, winning the game.

—description from the designer

"Welcome to the epic world of religious doctrines, where everyday events may help shape the world to come.
You start this Game of Truths as a Lost Soul, longing for spiritual fulfillment. As soon as the doctrine is revealed to you, set forth to spreading it among the villagers. Some of them may prove too resilient to new ideas, so you may have to use powerful artifacts to help you on your holy quest. As your popularity rises, your tasks will become easier, but be warned that your competitors may challenge you at any time.
Who will emerge as the True Prophet of the Realm?"

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Cochabamba
description:
Time runs out and only few boats remains to escape. Each player manages a gang of animals trying to escape from the zoo by crossing the river. Players has to do their best to put them safely on the different boats. But be careful, if a boat is overweight it might get sink.

The game last 3 rounds.
Each round has two phases:

1. Boarding the boats: Starting with the first player and going in turn order, players have to place their animals on the different boats.

2. Resolution: Resolving each boat takes place.
Check the boat capacity: If the sum weight of the animals aboard is equal or less than the boat resistance the boat will set sail. If so, players place their animals in their player area, otherwise the boat sinks and animals go to the discard pile.

Be careful the animals you place on each boat, since depending on the kinds of animal that meet aboard might cause different situations, so some animals might be eaten by other animals or taken out of the boat.

After finishing the third round the game ends. Players total the weight of the animals in their player area. (those which got to escape on the boats). The player with the most points will be the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: Marrak Hesh 17
description:
Marrak Hesh 17 is a mini-game composed by a board, 26 goods tokens, 26 tranportation tokens, 2 2-players boards, 3 3-players boards, 3 corporation tokens and 10 "deep space" cards.
At his turn a player places one transport token on a free space on the board representing an "orbital souk" and takes the corrisponding good. The taken good must be placed on the player board ortogonally adjacent to his others goods. The game ends when all players can't take goods from the board.
Every player scores points for the biggest gruop of goods of the same type and the biggest group of goods of the same colour. Some goods give bonus points and in the advanced variant also the "deep space" cards add points for different conditions.

name: Viking Games
description:
Game #3 of the "Pick Your Battle" series of card games from Toresh Games

Players take turns drawing a card from a deck of 120 cards of Vikings throwing Axes, Vikings with Shields, an Armory and a Wench. After drawing a card, the player may throw the Axe(s) at another player or use the wench against another player; place an armory or shields in front of them to help or protect them; or discard the card if it cannot be played. Once a player has been “hit” by 10 Axes, they are out. The last player standing is the winner.

Game instructions include 2-player and Strategic Play variants.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Travel

name: Supervillain: This Galaxy Is Mine! – Lootable Planets Expansion
description:
Not all Villains are as smart as I am. Frankly speaking, all these other Villains are much inferior to me, the great and one of a kind! But this is in our Galaxy. Recently another Galaxy has approached ours; it looks like the local Villains were pumpkin-headed enough to waste each other. Only Minions remain. The poor things wither without supervision on their desolate planets...

The scouts (those who managed to survive) report though that space self-defense forces are still active on some planets, while miniatures shaggy alien beasts were spotted on other planets, while somewhere else... these issues have to be dealt with. I have to send an Asteroid there.

Or two Asteroids. Or, even better, three. Somebody has to scavenge the scarce values left on these mysterious planets. Otherwise other Villains are going to loot everything...

Postscriptum. A special note for Asteroid firing pointers: “Shoot gently! The Asteroid must neatly penetrate the force field around the planet leaving all the valuables intact for further scavenging. Understood?”

During the game, Lootable Planets expansion provides an alternative. You may launch an Asteroid either into another Villain or into Lootable Planets. Then, in the beginning of your next turn, the Asteroid hits the target and... you find out what has happened.

Some cards of the Lootable Planets expansion are very useful. Hitting such a card is like hitting the jackpot! For example, May the Loss Be with You! card allows you to seize a random card from other Villain’s hand immediately, Backdoor Asteroid — to deliver a sudden blow to other Villain’s planet, while Star Shower — to launch two Asteroids at once.

Other cards of the Lootable Planets expansion are not that efficient. Sometimes the Minions point the Asteroid not very precisely and it smashes a half of the planet. The remaining half brings smaller loot.

Finally, there are two nasty cards — Ambush of Alien Hamsters and Assault on Black Hole. The Minions have launched the Asteroid... in a wrong direction. Assault on Black Hole simply ‘eats’ your Asteroid, which is logical — what else would you expect from a Black Hole?! But the Hamsters are worst of all. These tiny evil beasts retarget your Asteroid into you!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
publishers: Moroz Dev Studio, Rightgames RBG SIA

name: Grand Football Mexico 86
description: A Pinball, which theme is the World Cup 86 - Mexico, who took place in Mexico. This board game, was created by greek toy company "Lyra" in 1985. The winner is the player who scored the most goals. Every player has six chances/balls to score. If the ball, fell into holes, there are two possibilities: Missed shot or try again Great fun, for two players!

name: Cheer Up!
description:
Cheer Up! is a party game where players use adjective, noun, and verb cards to answer questions in the best way possible.

Each turn, the judge will flip over a question card, and the other players draw cards from the required deck(s). Using these cards, they answer the question in the funniest, best, or worst way possible, and the judge picks the combination they like the best.

Rule cards change up the game by adding absurd instructions for players to follow when reading out their card combinations.

name: 5 Gold Rings
description:
Based on the ITV show, 5 Gold Rings is the game where knowing the answer is not enough - you've got to put a ring on it.

Answer questions by placing gold rings onto large images displayed in the games arena. Each level is worth more money, and the rings get smaller each time. The team that performs the best takes control of the final, where there can be only one winner.

name: insect inc.
description:
In insect inc., a game that combines puzzles, cards, and picture searches, you are a researcher for a company of the same name that's developing colorful insects as art. A new kind of insect has fled to the forest thanks to a minor mistake by one of your colleagues, and because it is a new undiscovered species, it needs to be recovered quickly.

You must be careful when collecting insects for if you surprise them, they will mimic nature through camouflage. Can you safely recover the insects that fled?

•••

あなたは色彩豊かな鑑賞用の昆虫を開発している
「insect inc.」 の研究員です。

同僚の些細なミスで
新種の昆虫が森林に逃げ出してしまいました。

まだ未発表の新種のため、
迅速に回収する必要があります。

しかし、昆虫を採取する時は充分に注意しましょう。
昆虫を驚かせてしまうと
自然の中に擬態してしまうからです。

あなたは無事に、逃げ出した
昆虫達を回収することができるでしょうか。
—description from the publisher

name: The Awful Orphanage: Orphan Pack – Lance
description: This small box expansion for The Awful Orphanage contains a highly detailed plastic miniature and 2 Orphan Cards for Lance.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: The Awful Orphanage: Orphan Pack – Brunel
description: This small box expansion for The Awful Orphanage contains 1 highly detailed miniature and 2 Orphan Cards for the character Brumel.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Carpool Karaoke Game
description:
Got moves like Jagger? Can you sing like Ariana? Find out in the Carpool Karaoke Game! Using your favorite music app or streaming service, select a song and then duel other players in song, dance moves, or celebrity trivia for points. You may even be challenged to post your performance on social media! Do you have what it takes to ride shotgun with James?

—description from the publisher

name: Racing Kings
description:
Racing Kings is a two-player abstract-strategy game which utilizes a chess board and all the chess pieces, except for the pawns. Moves are also the same as in chess, however, unlike chess, the goal of the game is to move a king all the way across the board.

Pieces are set-up as follows: White: King h2; Queen h1; Rook g1, g2; Knight e1, e2; Bishop f1, f2. Black: King a2; Queen a1; Rook b1, b2; Knight d1, d2; Bishop c1, c2.

Checks are not allowed. White moves first. Should Black reach the other side of the board one turn after White does, the game is drawn.

Racing Kings was popular in postal play, especially among members of NOST (the kNights Of the Square Table).

A shorter variant, called Dodo Chess, with the following set-up, has not gained the following Racing Kings has: White: King a1; Rook a2; Knight c1, c2; Bishop b1, b2. Black: King h1; Rook h2; Knight f1, f2; Bishop g1, g2.

—user summary

name: The Everyone Shares One Butt Game
description:
An unpredictable, competitive path-building party game where you and three other disembodied players extend your stomach to connect to the Almighty Butt. First to connect to the butt wins.

Various stomach cards and items contain effects that can sabotage other player's plans such as discarding cards, stunning players to skip turns, invading other players' bodies, and rotating or flipping the direction of the butt.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That, Trading, Voting

name: Dead + Gone
description:
A two player competitive horror game, one person takes on the role of a monster aiming to kill, while the other takes on a spirit aiming to destroy minds. Both aim to rid the house of any and all occupants. Both vie to destroy the most residents.

A house is populated with a pool of various, randomly-drawn residents, with each resident having their own mental and physical health trackers. An event card is drawn that impacts the night (anything from damage being doubled, to new characters arriving at the house). The players then play a card from own hand that affects the mental and/or physical health of the resident they chose to attack that night. Should there be at least one resident still alive in the house at the end of both attacks, the next night begins.

At the end of each consecutive third night the next act begins, allowing players to use more vicious attacks, and on the third act, each player draws a horror card, granting them a unique action or event. The game continues until all residents in the house are dead - and the player with the most victims wins - unless specific events or characters get drawn that could lead to the demise of one, or both players.
mechanics: Tug of War, Variable Player Powers

name: AlderQuest: Arctic Allies Expansion
description:
This expansions adds powerful new heroes and minions that can align themselves with any guild.


2 Tarot sized Hero cards
8 Arctic Minions
4 Arctic Runes
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Человечки
description:
In this box, you'll find 500 little men drawn by a famous Russian artist Tatiana Zadorozhniaya and 5 fast reaction games for different ages. Can you find the right man before everyone else does? The fastest one will get a pie!

6 exciting game modes for you to try out
A whole lot of fun for kids ages 4 and up
500 unique cute little men

—description from the publisher

В этой коробке полтысячи нарисованных человечков и пять весёлых игр на скорость и внимательность для разных возрастов. Сможете ли вы отыскать нужного человечка раньше всех? Самые быстрые получат в награду пирожок!

Развивает внимание и скорость реакции.
Подходит для детей от 4 лет.
500 уникальных рисунков человечков.

—description from the publisher (Russian)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching, Tile Placement

name: Dune Racers
description:
Assign 3 cubes, one for the player on the right, one for the player on the left, and one to keep. After that, use cubes that you got to move your pod.

Each pod has a unique special ability that players can use if they have 1 cube of each color.

Player to cross the finish line first wins.

Modular track size and game length.
mechanics: Modular Board, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Caster
description:
Caster is a trick-taking game. The game consists of 3 rounds and each round consist of 15 tricks. The value of the card indicates the speed of casting a spell, so that the player who played the card with the lowest value takes the trick (There is an exception. Refer to TRUMPS.).
Finally, the player who got the highest Magic Points (MPs) is the winner!!

—description from the rulebook

name: Premier Arrivé: 14-18 La Der des Ders
description:
Retrace the history of the Great War with this "Der des Ders" (The war to end all wars) battle game.
This battle game on a board where the first to arrive at the end of the game will be the winner.
But watch out for the mud in the trenches!

This strategy and adventure game develops children's imagination and thinking.

Discover the history of WWI with 1000 bornes-type system.
categories: Card Game, Racing, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Blacks & Whites: 50th Anniversary Edition
description:
America’s realest real estate game is back! It’s Blacks & Whites: 50th Anniversary Edition.

Fifty years ago, Prof. Robert Sommer and Judy Tart created a socially-conscious version of Monopoly, highlighting the racial inequity of the housing market and capitalism in America. Inspired by the original, the 50th Anniversary Edition features a new foreward by Prof. Sommer, modern original artwork, entertaining gameplay, and renewed lessons in the economics of prejudice.

The objective is simple: control the board by owning the most property – and hopefully learn something about empathy and cooperation along the way. Play as a Black player: you may feel disenfranchised, but you also get access to Bonus Cards that White players can only dream about! Or play as White, and this game should be as easy as getting a loan or being seen as human by the police!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Tenable
description:
Based on ITV's "Top 10" quiz Tenable, this board game brings you a fun and challenging adaptation of the TV show featuring questions and gameplay that will make you fill like you're taking part in the studio.

A team of players attempt to earn money by correctly guessing items in a list of ten.

The chosen team captain selects a teammate to answer the question for each round, and then play the final question themselves. In each round, one chosen player tries to give as many correct answers as they can for a category with ten items. Each answer earns money, and a player may stop and bank what they have at five correct answers. Banked money goes into the final jackpot for the bonus round.

To help, a team gets one life per round (in case they give a wrong answer), as well as one “Overrule”, where the team captain can reject a given answer and substitute another one. These can be used once per round, with the Overrule only allowed prior to five correct answers. The final help is three “Nominate” tokens, which are used among all players. With them, the player may chose another player to give an answer if they can’t think of one. Players get eliminated if they give a second wrong answer and are sent to the Vortex.

When all players have played a question, the final round begins. Any player who banked money and was not eliminated participates. If no player remained in the game, 500 is put into the bank and the captain plays solo. The team is given a choice of two lists to play, and they begin giving answers one at a time, in turn. A wrong answer eliminates a player. If the tenth answer is given, any remaining players split the money. If everyone is eliminated prior to getting all ten answers, the player who banked the most money in the previous rounds wins.

name: Boo Hollow: Pumpkin Showdown
description:
A fun, fast-paced card game featuring the spooky-cute characters from Funko’s Boo Hollow!

Play Pumpkin cards to throw Pumpkins at the other players, but watch out—they can play cards right back! Roll the special die to grab more Pumpkins, or dodge out of the way at the last second! Whoever gets hit with more Pumpkins takes a Hit card. Get hit three times and your out! Who will be the last one standing?
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Klattschen: White Edition
description: The official Expansion includes 60 new Cards with 45 new orders.

name: Schnattergei
description:
In Schnattergei, you need to call out the right words at the right time — and know when to hit the deck!

To start, deal each player a deck of 25 face-down cards. Cards show one of seven items on them — banana, strawberry, elephant, cocoa, carrot, bell pepper, or schnattergei (this being a chatty parrot) — with each item being in one of four colors: yellow, red, blue, or brown.

On a turn, flip the top card of your deck onto the discard pile and quickly say the object (banana, strawberry, elephant, cocoa) matching the color of the card revealed (yellow, red, blue, brown). You never say "carrot" or "pepper", and when you flip a schnattergei, you must "parrot" the previous player by saying what they said, not what matches the color of the parrot. If you make a mistake, take two cards from your deck and place them under the discard pile.

When someone reveals an item that matches the item on the top of the discard pile, everyone must race to slap the pile. Whoever does so first claims all the cards in the discard pile and puts them under their draw deck, face down.
The game ends when a player runs out of cards and does not manage to win the discard pile in the same round. Whoever has the most cards at the end of the game wins.

name: Doodle Face
description:
Doodleface is a drawing game.....Potluck Style.

Instead of bringing your favorite food, bring you own interpertation of your friends facial features.

Every player gets a doodle pad and writing tool. Shuffle the appropriate cards and "Try your best" to draw your friends well. In future rounds themes get added for even more fun.

After all the faces are drawn, players vote on the best drawing. Who ever was the one being drawn, wins.

name: Pizza Dominoes
description:
Includes: 56 triangular dominoes, full instructions!
Match the toppings!

To win the game, you must be the first one,to get rid of your domino pieces, with matching the same toppings side.

Are you out with same toppings and can't put? Then pull a new one!
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Crime Scene: Lazio 1356
description:
Lazio is the fifth game in the Crime Scene family. It follows the same puzzle solving format as its predecessors. This game is set in a medieval monastery, where recent events have frightened away most of the monks. The story is written by the awarded author Arttu Tuominen.
In the puzzles you get to investigate a broken down cart with strange wheels, a night sky with shooting starts, a pot where man has been boiled, and many other things.
The high age recommendation comes from a few graphic details in the story. These can be skipped by parents playing with their children (12+), as long as they are aware such exist in the game.

Challenge Level 3/5

name: Ruin It
description:
How to Win? Your mission is to RUIN any given topic with our hilarious adult game. Pull a topic card and ruin the topic in 4 words or less! Convince the judge why you should win the round. The player with the most points WINS.

Comes with 255 topic cards, 8 whiteboards, and 10 markers.
categories: Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Detecteam Kids: Once upon an Island
description:
Who doesn’t love a fun journey? You’re off to adventure on a tropical island! Sunshine, surf and… 3 new cases? Detectives, team up! Meet the residents and tourists on an amazing beach and help the animals figure out what happened!

Once upon an Island is a co-operative adventure for young detectives. Your goal is to piece the full picture, just like a jigsaw puzzle, and re-create the events. Find out what actually happened in this stand-alone game from the Detecteam Kids range!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction
publishers: Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Mirakulus, Red Cat Games

name: Velonimo: Tour de France
description:
Limited edition of Velonimo, sold in summer 2023. It's an officially licensed "Tour de France" special edition of Velonimo.

Compared to the original version, in this version:

there are fewer cards (only 5 Racers cards per team, and only 3 Maxoo cards).
the scoring system has been simplified (when you play your last card, you score as many points as the number of cards remaining in your opponents' hands).
there are 4 distinctive jerseys (the yellow one is obviously the leader's, but the other three are green, white and red polka-dots). To obtain the last 3, you need to win an attack containing the associated racer. And that gives you extra points.
new illustrations.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Ladder Climbing, Trick-taking

name: Jambo Nation
description:
A dice-rolling game with football theming. African wildlife and culture is important in the theme as well.

Players roll a die to move around the board. A player then draws a card from the conference space they landed on and rolls the five red dice. If the total is equal to our larger than the card’s “team score” the game, that card and the cards respective number of “bowl points”.

The first player to 10,000 bowl points wins.

name: Liddell: Alice and the Secret Tea Party
description:
Fun tea parties are all the rage in Wonderland! However, the Queen of Hearts is vain and jealous. She hates for any tea party to steal the spotlight from the tea parties she hosts at her castle. If the Queen finds out that you're throwing such a tea party, she shouts that familiar line: “Off with their heads!” To stay out of trouble, Alice and her friends must make sure their tea parties draw less attention than those hosted by the Queen of Hearts while still attracting guests. Who will avoid the Queen's attention while throwing the most exciting tea party?

In Liddell: Alice and the Secret Tea Party, players place cards either in the common play area or in their own area. Players compete for the highest total value of cards. However, the total value of the cards in your area must not exceed the total value of the cards in the common area.(Any cards exceeding the total value of the common area will be worth 0 points). Avoid going bust, use each character's special ability, and try to collect all 5 types of character cards!

—translated description from the publisher

name: Place
description: Place, a Swedish geographical trivia game, tests players' visual recognition of famous places worldwide, their ability to place them on the world map, and their ability to answer questions about each place within a simple roll & move and memory game framework. If you answer questions incorrectly, you have to memorize the answers because the same question can become relevant again. The first player to travel around the world and fill up his game board wins.
publishers: Mindtwister AB, Peliko Oy, Spelmakarna Sverige AB, Vennerød Forlag AS

name: Crop Circles
description: Crop Circles is a family card game of manipulation and bluffing. Players attempt to either collect a set of alien crop circles or attempt to manipulate the board to align them to win.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Kleine Monster
description:
Kleine Monster (Little Monsters) is game for kids (5 years old +) where everyone will have to hunt monsters. Memory and speed will help you win!

Everybody has 9 hidden monsters discs. A special die is rolled, and then everybody tries to find a monster of the same color as the die. The first one who succeeds must take the big wooden green monster pawn and is rewarded by 1 monster disc. At the beginning you'll need luck, but as the game goes on memory (where are those little monsters hidden?) will help you.

Rules are available in English, German, French, and Dutch in each box.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Memory, Real-time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: same same: Wer tickt wie du?
description:
same same - Wer tickt wie du? is a party game about shared opinions / preferences.

A personal question and 4 possible answers are read out. Each player secretly choses an answer. After each player has choosen, the answers are revealed.

There is a score marker for each possible combination of two players. Whenever both players picked the same answer, their (combined) marker advances. The first pair of players whose marker reaches the goal wins the game.

name: Triple Four
description:
From the publisher:
It's FUN- times 3 -when you play this exciting family card game! Match three of your playing cards to a "Triplet" card. And don't forget...Jokers are WILD! Be the first to collect four groups of matching cards and you win the game! With a little strategy and the luck of the draw, you could score a TRIPLE FOUR! It's three times the fun for the whole family.

CONTENTS:
2 DECKS PLAYING CARDS
1 DECK "TRIPLET" CARDS
4 CUSTOM CARD TRAYS
GAME INSTRUCTIONS

name: Treetop Trouble
description:
There's trouble in the treehouse! The inhabitants are everywhere but in their own apartments – and now each of the animals wants to return to its own home as soon as possible. Only the one who carefully works out where each of his animals is staying and skillfully swaps their places will be able to bring his six party friends home.

In Treetop Trouble, a specific type of animal lives on each floor of the treehouse and in the elevator. (It's not cozy, but it's home.) To set up the game, each player takes his set of six animal tiles – which are color-coded on the back – shuffles them, then lays out one animal on each floor and in the elevator. The player may peek at the animal in the elevator.

On a turn, a player rolls the die, then moves the elevator up or down or to any floor desired based on the roll. Each player in turn may then swap his animal on the elevator with his animal on that floor. A player can look at the face of one of his tiles only when placing it in the elevator, so you might want to swap willy-nilly until you nail down who's who.

Be the first player to get six animals home and you win.

name: Meow! The Cult of Cat
description:
You’ve finally made it to the Cult of Cat’s initiation ceremony.
Now all you need to do is complete the initiation ritual without breaking any of the secret rules.
How hard can it be?

To win, simply play a card from your hand while following all rules held by other players.
At the start of the game, you don’t know many of the rules are in the game, so you’ll break one each turn.
As more rules are revealed, it’s up to you to remember and follow them all...

Each card will have an animal with a rule specifying an action to be taken. Actions can be verbal or physical, and each rule is unique.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Memory, Party Game

name: Frankie's Food Truck Fiasco Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

Order up! Foodies unite! Get a taste of these shape-tastic recipes for fun! Business at Frankie’s famous food truck is brisk! Kids take turns using the Frankie Squeezer to fill scrumptious orders. The first to deliver a 5-course meal is the winner!

Psst…They’re Learning!
Practices identifying geometric shapes
Develops fine motor skills
Improves strategic thinking skills
Encourages social skills and turn-taking

Board game designed to teach young children about shapes. Players spin to determine what shape of piece they can collect and then use the squeezer to add them to their player board. Once a player fills their board with the required shapes they win.

name: Winnetou
description:
Go west! Every player starts with his horse in St. Louis and has to pass "dark and bloody grounds" until he reaches Winnetou's pueblo. Lots of adventures are to be faced on the way.

By drawing action cards you encounter famous Cowboys and Indians. You can be captured and freed. You can meet bandits and kill grizzly bears. For all those adventures you get trophies.

The first player to reach the pueblo and having a calumet card ends the game. But the winner is the one with the most trophies.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Ghostly Galleon
description:
Ghostly Galleon is a simple childrens roll-and-move (spin-and-move?) game with an added element of dexterity.

The game consists of a plastic pirate ship on a tilted rotating base, a spinner, four shipmates (the player pieces), and a heavyweight Ghost Pirate. The ship contains a quantity of beads which shift around like an unstable cargo, and there are various pivoted fittings (mast, plank etc). There is also a loose rolling barrel on the deck which trips various traps as it rolls around.

Essentially a roll and move game, the shipmates start the game in a 'raft' and move onto the first of the 17 numbered spaces on the ship. Some spaces are more precarious than others, especially the mast and pivoted traps. Half of the numbers printed on the spinner have a 'ghost' symbol which enables the player to also move the Ghost Pirate onto any of the marked larger spaces, thus causing the entire ship to rotate and pitching any unlucky players back into the sea, where they have to start over (unless they've got past space 9, whereas they can return to space 9 instead).

The winner is the first person to get to space 17 (the treasure) by spinning the exact number to get there.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Nautical, Pirates

name: Unser Baumhaus
description:
The kids in Unser Baumhaus want to build a treehouse in the garden, and plenty of nails and wood boards are available in the tool shed. To build the floor of a treehouse, you must first install four wood dice, then combine three building tiles in the proper order. Time is short, though, as dark clouds are covering the sky, signaling an oncoming storm.

If players manage to finish at least one level of the treehouse and put a roof in place, they win the game together.

name: Pathfinder Arena
description:
Pathfinder Arena is a competitive board game set in the Pathfinder RPG's "Age of Lost Omens" setting. Monsters and heroes clash in four stages of challenges in a labyrinth. In each stage, the number and power of the monsters increase, while heroes level up and gather resources to gain new skills, magic spells, equipment, and the deities' favor.

Pathfinder Arena will feature high-detail miniatures of the most iconic monsters of Pathfinder, along with its greatest heroes. The monsters summoned in the labyrinth never leave their spot, but the labyrinth shape is dynamic, and players can change it by moving the board's tiles. Monsters can then be used to attack other players, in the end leaving only one winner.

Pathfinder Arena Pledge Manager and Late Pledge are live on Gamefound till august 10: https://gamefound.com/projects/giochi-uniti/pathfinder-arena
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Deck Construction, Hidden Victory Points, Map Deformation, Slide/Push, Variable Player Powers

name: Soulmates
description:
How well do you really know your friends – can you find your soulmate?

To find out, you collect Friend-Chips with every other player. You do this by correctly assessing your fellow players based on creative scenarios. The two players with the most Friend-Chips at the end of the game become Soulmates.

In each round, use one of 125 short scenarios with four possible answers.

First you decide for yourself, then you guess your fellow players’ decision.

If you and your partner match, you will each receive a Friend-Chip.

-description from publisher's website

name: Sternsucher
description: In the middle of the infinite expanse that is our universe, the navigation systems of the turbo rockets stopped working! Who can still find their way home? Sparkling constellations point the way, and the new mission is: Star Search! Only eagle eyes and a little luck with the dice lets the cleverest astronaut win the race.

name: Drache Donnerzahn: Quartett
description:
Dragon Rapid Fire and his friends are playing quartet today! Who wants to join in? With a little concentration and the right amount of luck, you can collect four of the same cards to form a quartet. The reward is a fire crystal. Who can collect the most fire crystals?
A dragon-strong card game classic.

name: Cruel Seas: US Navy Fleet
description:
By 1941 there were 29 total PT’s total in the US Navy, by December ’43 there were 29 squadrons. Indeed, by the end of the war the small ships, PT’s LCI etc. numbered 7,000 craft of 80 types. Many Early PT boats had up to 4 torpedoes and 2 twin .50 Cal guns in powered mounting, a heavy load for the day. As with most American hardware, this was only the start! Soon a 20mm was added at the stern as standard, useful for surface or air action. Then, enterprising crews frustrated by strafing the tough Japanese barges to negligible effect mounted a USAAF 37mm automatic gun (acquired from an Air Cobra) and found it most effective!

Indeed, America had not been blind to the possibilities of the coming war and took great pains to watch and learn from her allies and foes so that when war came, America was ready to put into place a building program that dwarfed all the other navies combined and led to the naval dominance that she still enjoys today.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: The Great Potlatch
description:
Four of the oldest families of the great Kwakwaka'wakw tribe have gathered for the biggest Potlatch ever assembled. For eight days and nights, there will be carving, rituals, and most important: gifting. The family giving the most gifts at the end of each day is granted the Speaking Stick, letting that family decide the course of the next day's festivities.

In The Great Potlatch, players control the actions of one of these four families for eight rounds to earn the respect of their fellow tribesmen. At the end of the festival, the family who accomplishes the most will lead the tribe until the next Great Potlatch.

Game Components:
6 Wooden Role Markers (2 each: Shaman, Elder, Carver)
1 Wooden Speaking Stick Marker
48 Potlatch Cards
20 Totem Pole Cards
4 Ancestor Cards
24 Wooden Potlatch Markers (6 in each player color)
1 Day/Night Card and Wooden Marker
16 Wooden Bad Reputation Markers

Available from Small Box Games November 2008.
The Great Potlatch
3-4 Players
Ages 10 and up
45 Minutes

The game was later revised as Potlatch.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: The Goonies
description:
Brace yourself for a treacherous journey - you're going with those gutsy Goonie Kids in search of One-Eyed Willie's hidden pirate treasure! Along the perilous path to the Pirate Ship Cavern, you'll find a devious trap at every turn: a dark, ghostly, secret chamber where an eerie encounter awaits you. Behind you, and closing in fast, is the murderous Fratelli Gang!

In this game, every encounter is a test of courage. To escape safely with your treasure, you'll need a bit of planning, some cagey maneuvers - and sometimes, just plain luck!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Pirates

name: 10 Sec. Quiz
description: You have a tube with 3 letter-dice in it and a little ball that runs slowly along the tube. You draw a card with a question on it (i.e.: What is made out of wood?) Then you turn the tube and try to make a word with the letters before the ball reaches the end.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Bunny Zick-Zack
description:
This Doris and Frank game is closely related to their earlier published Eselsrennen (1982). Differences are - only a one sided board which supports a three bunny (pawn) race. The mechanics are pretty much the same:

Players are given a card secretly, each showing the bunny's finishing order, a different result for each card. The board shows a patchwork of steps across a field from start to finish, each space with a colored arrow matching the bunnies. When you move a bunny onto a space marked with a green arrow pointing left, you then move the green bunny one space that way. If that space then has a blue arrow pointing right, you next move the blue bunny on one space that way. This goes on until you cannot move the final bunny because it is blocked or it lands on a space of its own color. Eventually, the bunnies cross the finish line, and the player with the best matching result on their card wins.

Funny and quick puzzle-racing game and one of the (if not the) first games published by Doris and Frank.

name: Tournament Golf
description:
"It's Just Like Golf...Without the Walking"

The double-sided board is an overhead view of all 18 holes of the "Green Valley Country Club" (6760 yards, par 71), with greens, traps, rough, woods, and hazards. The board is also ruled off in squares, with each square 20 yards per side on the scale of the holes.
