But before getting their hands dirty, they have to determine who will be the guild leader and, in order to do that, organized a competition where the winner will be the one who collects the most Fame and Fortune!

The competitors will have to work at night, jumping from rooftop to rooftop, rummaging through different houses in search of valuable treasures, and always returning to the lair to show off their winnings. But it won’t be an easy task, since each one of them will have to avoid being caught by the policemen that patrol the streets, besides also avoiding being exposed by the other thieves, or even robbed by one of them!
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Baby Chicks
description: Be the first to "hatch" 5 eggs. Players sit on eggs and hatch them by matching colored baby chicks with the color of the hen that was rolled on the die.

name: Mümmelmann & Söhne
description:
This is a child's game from Jean du Poel and Historien Spielgalerie. Each player is trying to deliver Easter eggs to nests, using three rabbits shared by all. The large board shows rabbit tracks, and nests that will hold specific styles of Easter eggs.Using dice, players move any or all three of the rabbits, trying to reach nests that that need the specific eggs that the player can deliver.

The game offers two scoring options. The simple scoring option, for younger children, awards the victory to the player who delivers the most eggs. The more advanced scoring subtracts points for eggs not delivered and is played over several rounds.

name: Card Baseball: The Exciting Baseball Card Board Game
description:
From the box description:

"The excitement of baseball comes alive in CARD BASEBALL. You're the manager. Choose your team of nine batters. Decide who is the home team and batter up! Your favorite player steps to the plate, and with a combination of a role of the die, the choosing of a HIT, PLUS, or OUT card, and reading the STATS on the back of your player's baseball card, you're in for a fun nine innings of baseball strategy - just as if you were managing your own big league team.

With CARD BASEBALL, you can play division, inter-division, all-star, play-off, old timers, or world series games. The possibilities are as big as your card collection.

With CARD BASEBALL, you can use any baseball card collection that includes STATS of your favorite players.

So, get your peanuts and popcorn, open your stadium board, choose your team, and "PLAY BALL!""

Game Contents:
- One baseball stadium board
- 2 white die
- 1 red die
- Score pads
- 40 HIT cards
- 40 PLUS cards
- 40 OUT cards
- 2 Batter Cards
- 1 Token to track OUTS
- Complete set of rules

NOT included:
- Your favorite set of baseball cards

name: Familjens frågespel
description: Experience the laughter and excitement in the family's favorite issues. Here the issues 385 fun topics about anything and everything, from animals in Africa and subscribed magazines to mobile phones and planets. The questions fit to the whole family and also special issues for the youngest. Answer the questions in your favorite subject and try to win as much money as possible on your skills. When the timer starts ticking, you have 15 seconds for you to respond. While stressing players you through placing the chance card that means they probably know the answer and want to "steal" your question. The player with the most money at the game's final will be the family champion.

name: Blink Solitaire
description:
A cross between what's recognized as the Windows Solitaire game (aka Klondike), dominoes, and Blink.

This is a single-player game where players lay down cards where the shorter width ends of cards touch the longer length sides of cards (Blink standard deck) and all touch only where there is at least one of number, color, or suite match. Going off the edge of a table to match cards legally is a lost game, as is not being able to place a card next to other existing cards that match on at least one attribute for all edges that touch.

This game may take 40 minutes with a single deck.

name: Journal Singapore
description:
From the game's website:
"Journal Singapore is the first board game to feature the history of Singapore over a period of three eras(1900 - 1965). Take on the role of pioneers and leave a legacy of prestige and influence; or find yourself consigned to the dustbin of history. Struggle to survive and thrive in the face of foreign domination, drastic resource shortages and vicious infighting; work with other players to see the dawn of an independent nation (or trample them into the dirt).

Journal Singapore is an easy to learn strategic boardgame that is suitable for two kinds of play; play a single era for a fast game or play competitively throughout the three eras.

Players choose their favourite character and pit their wits (and character traits) against other players while trying to survive the obstacles and effects of real historical events."

The game contains:

•1 Foldable game board (11.75" x 8.25")
•1 "Merlion" Counter
•6 Pioneer Cards
•27 Sector Cards
•36 Event Cards
•60 Plan Cards
•100 Currency Notes (Resource)
•6 Coloured Play Pieces
•60 Influence Counters
For 3 - 5 players, age 10 and above. Approximate playing time: 45mins - 120mins

name: Calculae
description:
Introduction
Calculae is a card game involving basic arithmetic. Players use cards to form math expressions that evaluate to a desired result. It is an educational and fun game for people who want to improve and exercise their arithmetic skills.

Number of players
1 - 4

Setup
Deal 5 Poker cards to each player. Place the rest of the Poker cards face-down in a Poker draw pile, the Operator cards face-up in the middle of the table, and the Result cards face-down in a Result draw pile.

Multi-player Game Play (2-4 players)
During the start of each round, put the top card from the Result draw pile on the table face-up in a Result discard pile. Each player then selects 2 or more Poker cards in his hand such that using these cards and at least 1 Operator card, he is able to form a math expression that evaluates to the number on the face-up Result card. Jokers can represent any number from 1 to 13.

All players put their selected Poker cards in front of them face-down. If a player thinks he is unable to form any correct math expression with his current hand, he has to place all his 5 Poker cards face-down. Once all players have done this, each player reveals his selected Poker cards and take turns to form the expressions with the Operator cards. If the player forms the expression correctly, then he places his Poker cards face-down in front of him in his Score pile.

For the player who is unable to form any expression and has placed his 5 Poker cards on the table, he will reveal his cards and other players have a chance to form an expression. Any of the other players may shout “Calculae!” and then start to form an expression. If the expression is formed correctly, he gets to keep the Poker cards used in his Score pile.

If a player makes an attempt to form an expression, either using his Poker cards or other player’s Poker cards, and is unable to do so or forms an incorrect expression, he will have to discard 3 cards from his Score pile to the Poker discard pile face-up.

Once all players have verified their expressions formed, they draw Poker hands to fill their hand to 5 and the next round starts where a new Result card is revealed. The new Result card is placed on top of the current Result card.

Continue playing until either the Poker draw pile or the Result draw pile runs out. The winner is the player with the highest Score.

Solitaire Game Play (1 player)
All the rules are the same, except that the player has to discard all his cards at the end of a round, whether he has formed an expression or not. Then he draws 5 new Poker cards for the next round. The aim is to score the highest Score.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Number, Print & Play

name: Calendero
description: There are 48 cards, representing 12 months with 4 weeks each. These are randomly laid out (face-down) in a 12x4 "calendar" grid. The players take turns to flip open a card and place it in the correct position for the card on the calendar. They also pick up the card that was in that position before, look at it and place it (face-down) in the position they first picked up a card from. A player who places the fourth card in any month gets to keep all four cards from that month. The player with most months is the winner.

name: Euro-Pack III: Late War '44-'45
description:
Eight late war scenarios (1944 and 1945) for ASL, designed by ASL News designers.

Contains the following scenarios:

EP 3: Breakthrough Towards Tarnopol
EP 5: Search & Destroy
EP11: Port-Filliolet Crossroads
EP26: Turncoats
EP33: Paper Tigers
EP44: Cornered Tigers
EP61: Elusive Armor
EP69: L'Amour, L'Amour, L'Amour
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Supers
description:
Supers is a super hero board game for 2 to 6 players, aged 11 and up.

Every player creates his or her own super hero: after determining the hero's origin each player takes their starting super power determined by that origin (examples: "Technology" heroes always start with the super power "Armor", and "Atomic" heroes always have "Super Strength") and get aditional super powers to fill up their starting quota of powers.

The goal of the game is to become the one super hero who is famous and powerful enough to scare all villains into hiding. To reach that goal, the heroes deal with a variety of crises like burning buildings, derailing trains and cats on tress. More often than not one of the 25 super villains featured in the game appears somewhere in the city to wreak havoc, and will destroy the city if left alone.

The heroes have got to decide which crises to deal with first, and whether to team up to fight the villains or not, as some villains may be too much to handle for a single hero, and the villains may form teams of their own.

Once the heroes beat a villain or solve an event, they'll earn experience and fame. The fame is needed to win the game, while the experience may be traded for even more super powers, slowly building the hero to be more formidable.

While the game has some cooperative options, in the end only one hero will be the winner!

name: Ice Dao
description:
Ice Dao is a 2 player Icehouse game.Player alternate taking turns,on each turn a player must move one piece as far as it will go in one of eight orthogonal or diagonal directions.A piece´s movement is subject to the following restrictions:
1.A piece must stop at the edge of the board.
2.A piece may not land on or pass through a square that has a piece of the same size or smaller.
3.A player may move only the top piece in a stack.
A player wins when they get 4 pieces in a straight line(orthogonal or diagonal).

The rules are available online
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Circa 1863: Rules for the American Civil War
description:
A tabletop 'tactical combat' wargame based around the middle period of the American Civil War. The game is designed for 15mm miniatures, but includes an adaption for 5mm miniatures.
Third edition included a yellow quick reference sheet.
categories: American Civil War, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Escalier Royal
description:
From the editor:

Relive the intrigue and art de vivre of the court of the Sun King
You arrive as a young aristocrat at the court of the Sun King with the aim of obtaining responsibilities and incomes in order to boostyour family's fortunes. To acheive this, you must earn the King's favour by entertaining him with all kinds of activities - not an easy task because because you have many rivals. So you will need to demonstrate tact and cunning, know how to raise the stakes for your advantage and scheme to get close to the King.
A page of history to be discovered through this tactical game of bid and bluff.

Content
1 game board
1 coloured dice
6 "courtier" pieces
1 "king" piece
110 game cards
50 likeability points
100 "crown"
6 chests
1 instruction leaflet

name: Crummy
description: There are two main aims. One is to collect quartets - that is, four cards of the same rank, such as Aces, Kings, etc - and discard them from play. The other is to play out all your cards as soon as possible. There is a bonus for making the first quartet, and an alternative score for not making any at all.

name: Old Janx Spirit
description:
Old Janx Spirit is a Decktet rummy game for 2 players.
Each player is dealt a hand of ten cards,the remaining cards become the draw pile.
On each turn draw one card and discard one card.
When all ten cards are part of melds the round ends and you score one point.

Link to wiki article: http://wiki.decktet.com/game:old-janx-spirit

name: Evasion
description:
Evasion is played on a 8x8 square board.Each player starts with 16 stones 8 on each of the two back rows.
Each stone may move one or two cells forward or sideways.
Sideways moves are only allowed when there are no forward moves.
If the stone faces another stone(either color)directly forward,then it may also move diagonally forward any number of empty cells.
A player who fills the opposite two rows wins.

Variant 2: You may pass a partial move.

Variant 3: Forward, diagonally forward and sideways jumps are allowed over enemy pieces one time, but only if the move starts on one of the first two ranks.

Variant 4: Like variant 3, but you may pass a partial move.

name: Teddy's Wild Ride
description:
A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of middle school students.

The game is designed to be played on a large table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules. The Spanish forces consist of 46 figures and the American forces consist of 134 figures. Terrain features and obstacles include hills, trench lines, barbed wire, and a blockhouse.

Historical background, from the rules:

"In 1898 the US battleship Maine exploded while docked in Cuba. Blame immediately fell on Spain, which was trying to put down a revolt on the island. A short time later, the Spanish American War had begun."

"The most famous land battle in this short conflict occurred at San Juan Hill. Teddy Roosevelt and his Rough Riders were among those that gained fame by storming the Spanish trenches on the hills surrounding the city of Santiago. The African American cavalry troopers known as the 'Buffalo Soldiers' also fought bravely in this battle."

name: Picturesque Word Games
description:
(Text by the publisher) Bildschöne Wortspiele is a compact collection of 8 card games that deal with images and associated words. The set contains 100 cards (90 photos, 6 jokers, 4 blancs), 4 cards with suggestions for words, 1 booklet with rules and examples.
The principal mechanism is very simple: You form compounds by combining the words that you associate with two or more photos. A photo doesn’t represent only one word. For instance, for the photo that shows an eagle you can also say "bird", or "beak", or "head", or "feather", or "claw", or "animal" and so on. Thus, in combination with other cards in the set, you can form numerous words such as "bird bath", "bird table", "frigate bird", "game bird", "pack animal", "stuffed animal", "animal farm", "animal world" and so on.
The games can be played on all language levels. The selection of the photos ensures that you can form a large number of compounds within the range of basic vocabulary. Also, you can extend the linguistic range deliberately in terms of code, style and special languages.
In educational contexts the games cannot only be used for vocabulary training. It is also possible to train more subtle competences such as abstract thinking (eagle > bird > animal), the perception of paralleles and differences (bird: bird of prey vs. singing bird), style and narrating (you put down one card after another and let narrate / narrate yourself).
You can play most of the games either in competition or in coordination. Some of the games you can even play on your own. Depending on which game is played, the emphasis is on speed, concentration, memory, or wit. All the games are a challenge to imagination.
The games are suited for cross-generational, highly communicative playing within the family. They have also been designed for educational and therapeutical purposes. (End of text by the publisher)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Recognition

name: Chassé-croisé
description:
Material:
20 pawns (4 blue, 4 yellow, 4 white, 4 red) 1board , 21 cards.

Goal :
Each player tries to create the exact pattern of five pawns showed by his secret card drawn from the stock. This is done when the colors of pawns upon the board fit those of the card either horizontally, vertically or diagonally. The card is then won by the player, who draws another card from the stock.

Pawns can be moved one step in every direction, or jump above others pawns in chinese checkers style.
The winner is the player who has won the most cards when the stock is empty.

This game has been published in the same box that "Le 5 à cinq"

name: Olsen banden spillet: De 14 kup
description:
Olsen Banden: De 14 Kup (The Olsen Gang: The 14 Heists) is based on a series of comedy movies about a gang of robbers who always try to score the big coup and flee to Mallorca, Spain, but in the end they (almost) always fail.

These films were from Denmark, and were a big success in Germany in the 70's and 80's as well.

This game allows you to recreate any of their 14 heists, while following the plot from the movies, allowing you to capture the atmosphere and humor from these films.

Players will move around the gameboard while visiting famous locations from the movie series, in an attempt to gather the tools to commit the heists, commit them, and ultimately escape to Mallorca with the loot.

But, beware! The other players are able to move the villains "Bøffen" (The Beef) and "Kommissæren" (The Detective) around the map, in order to stop the other player's advancement in the game.
categories: Adventure, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sverige-Chansen
description: An entertaining and different knowledge about Sweden game for the whole family. The players must decide whether a more or less unbelievable assertion is true or not and also how safe it is in their response. Are you very confident and has the right to take it up faster, but also look up so you can not move backwards. First Case After traveling all over Sweden have won.

name: Wali
description:
This is a traditional 2-player game from West Africa, played on a 5x6 rectangular board. Each player has 12 game pieces in her own color, which start off the board; traditionally one player uses small sticks, the other uses pebbles.
Players initially take turns to place ('drop') one of their pieces on the board. Each must be dropped on an empty space on the board. One source states that this must not be adjacent (orthogonally) to a friendly piece, but the original descriptions by Monot [1950], translated by Murray [1951] only state that - during this stage - no player may form a row of three of her own pieces. If a player cannot make a legal drop, she must pass. This continues until all pieces are placed on the board, or until no more pieces can be placed.
After that, in each turn and starting with the player who began the game, each player moves one of their own pieces to an empty adjacent (orthogonal) space on the board. If, by so doing, she is able to make an orthogonal row of exactly three of her own pieces, she may capture one enemy piece (of her choice, presumably). The player who captures all of her opponent's pieces wins the game, and scores two points if this is achieved without any of her own being captured, or one point if she has lost at least one of her own pieces. A series of matches is played, and the series is won by the first player to score 10 points.

name: BrainBox: Football
description:
From the publisher:
What can you spot in ten seconds? Turn the timer over and try and memorize as many pictures and words as you can. After ten seconds, pass the card to another player who asks a quick-fire question. Seems easy - cards include the following clubs - Arsenal, Aston Villa, Barnsley, Birmingham City, Blackburn Rovers, Blackpool, Bolton Wanderers, Bradford City, Brentford, Brighton & Hove Albion, Bristol City, Bristol Rovers, Burnley, Cardiff City, Carlisle United, Charlton Athletic, Chelsea, Chesterfield, Colchester United, Coventry City, Crystal Palace, Derby County, Doncaster Rovers, Everton, Fulham, Gillingham, Grimsby Town, Huddersfield Town, Hull City, Ipswich Town, Leeds United, Leicester City, Leyton Orient, Liverpool, Luton Town, Manchester City, Manchester United, Middlesbrough, Millwall, Newcastle United, Northampton Town, Norwich City, Nottingham Forest, Notts County, Oldham Athletic, Peterborough, Plymouth Argyle, Portsmouth, Port Vale, Preston North End, Queens Park Rangers, Reading, Scunthorpe, Sheffield United, Sheffield Wednesday, Southampton, Southend United, Stoke City, Sunderland, Swansea City, Swindon Town, Tottenham Hotspur, Tranmere Rovers, Walsall, Watford, West Bromwich Albion, West Ham United, Wigan Athletic, Wolverhampton Wanderers, Wycombe Wanderers, Yeovil

BrainBox Football Kids GamesPlayers will have 10 seconds to study a card before being asked a question from the back, chosen by the roll of the die. If the question is answered correctly the card is kept, if not it is returned to the box. The player with the most cards after 10 minutes wins the game!BrainBox Football Kids Games is a brilliant memory recall game that lasts just 10 minutes with rounds of ten seconds. Club history, famous players, fun facts and more! Features 71 football clubs from the Premiership, Championship and Leagues 1 and 2.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Esians
description:
Bad days have come... New perils arise where the Evil was uprooted, and the world of Esians is becoming dark and savage once again. Only fortitude and courage can turn the tide to bring back the good times of old.
Do you dare to explore the unknown regions? Will you brave the ever-present dangers - and survive?

Esians is a small and portable card game of fantasy adventures, designed primarily as a solitaire, but it can accomodate up to three players in either cooperative or competitive mode. On their journey through the lands of Esians players seek out adventures, encouter friends and foes (the latter being more the case) and reap rewards or recieve punishment.

name: XtraHeart
description:
From the website:
"A game of Super Heroes with Chess like strategies.
You can play many combinations of Heroes and Powers, and in each game you can combine different heroes with different Side Kicks".

XtraHeart is a two player card game. Each player controls three home base zones where they secretly place their Headquarters and two Auxiliary bases. Players attempt to occupy their opponent's Headquarters or both of their Auxiliary bases to win the game.
The cards consist of Heroes, Side Kicks and Powers cards. Players build combinations of these cards and move out in to one of the three central outer space zones in order to battle their opponent's card combinations.

name: The Green and The Tan
description:
Miniatures rules for plastic Army Men wargaming. Simple, d6-based rule set that simulates WW2 to modern era combat.

From the publisher:
Plays in 30 minutes or less
Useable with any cheap figures or carboard "stand-ups"
No army lists, counters or book keeping required
Weapons include flame throwers, machine guns, mortars and bazooka
Rules for infantry, tanks, helicopters, minefields, and mission objectives
Unit activation based on squad strength / casualties

name: Monopoly: New Orleans Saints Super Bowl XLIV Champions Collector's Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Saints are marching back to New Orleans with their first Super Bowl Championship!

The MONOPOLY brand proudly presents the New Orleans Saints Super Bowl XLIV Champions Collector’s Edition. Buy, sell and trade Drew Brees, Reggie Bush, Darren Sharper, Marques Colston and Robert Meachem in an effort to own the NFL’s best. Relive the road to glory from their 13-game winning streak to Garrett Hartley’s game winning overtime field goal against the Vikings.

Congratulations to all Saints fans and to the city of New Orleans on your first Super Bowl victory in franchise history!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Succesor of Roma
description:
The game covers the decline of Roman empire in 5th century.
It uses cards and chit and includes technology development, economy, as well as military actions.

1 map
180 counters
64 cards
5 playaid sheets



Issue game of old Game Journal 56.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System

name: Coyote!
description:
Description from publisher:

We are shepherds and farmers keeping sheep. We put as many sheep and lambs to pasture as we safely can... but from time to time the Coyotes come round.

They are tricky, but not always as clever as we are. We have barn space and the help of our trusty Sheep Dog and Amazing Llama to protect our flock. As Night approaches we will have to be especially alert and ready to work as a team.

Object of the Game: Fill in 35 pasture spaces with as many sheep as we safely can before the Night Fall card is exposed to end the game.

name: Conquest of Arthenia
description:
A efficiency engine/resource management collectible card game that is so similar to Magic: the Gathering that rather then providing a description of the game on it's own merits the pubslisher just lists how it's different from other CCGs (i.e. Magic):

How is Conquest Different From Other CCGs?

1. Faster pace. With 2 resources acquired per term (most every other CCG is 1) plus the ability to barter 1 resource and acquire a third resource each term, every term is exciting and brings new twists into the fray. Never suffer through another, "Draw a land. My turn is over" term again.

2. Multi-region system. With 4 location regions per commander and a central battlefield region, you have far more options and therefore strategy is kicker. Like in a game of chess, in Conquest you need to think about positioning for your units. In most card games, it's simply your army vs. your opponent's army, 2 regions, and whether to attack or defend is a very simple matter of arithmetic.

3. Various strategies to pursue. Because locations and upgrades, commanders' sources of income, are vulnerable to attack and destruction, commanders have more options for how to seek a victory--a straight out offensive on the enemy domain to flat-out win or a more subtle wearing down of the opponent's income. Also, with 2 types of income (gold and mana), you can try to isolate one of these sources to cripple the opponent's army.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: The Four Courts
description: The Four Courts stumbled out of the gate (see the review "5 players enter the 4 Courts") and has been entirely rewritten. Progress and links to the new rules can be found in the thread "The Four Courts rebuilt" in the News section below.

name: Parkany 1683
description:
Published in first issue of Dragon Hobby magazine.

The expansion provides new map with four scenarios and two new commander tokens (Thokoly and Mehmed whose statistics are changed as compared to Wiedeń 1683).

There are only minor changes in the rules mostly covering charges. The changes make the game more dynamic than original Wiedeń 1683.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Wittstock
description:
Wittstock: Baner's wasted chance is the fifth game in the 30 years war series of print and play wargames by TCS Games. It is a small game for with a 22" x 17" playing map, 216 counters and six pages of rules.
It uses a leader activation chit system for determining which units each player may move and have combat with in each phase, while for the rest the system is very simple and introductory, being a derivation of one of the better system of the Seventies (SPI's quadrigame system used for several quadrigames, like 30 years war): no ZOCs, presence of artillery units (fixed but they can be captured by the opponent), cavalry charges, dragoons, morale (added in this system, not present in the original), death of leaders, etc.
Victory is based only on breaking the morale of the opponent army, through disruption and elimination of his units.
Very good for adding more players to the wargamers community, as it is fast, cheap and easy to set up and play.
categories: Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Moleko
description:
See molecules take shape before your eyes!

Each player builds the model of the molecule represented on the molecule card which he has drawn. The playing pieces are moved around the board from the starting square by die roll, in the direction of the player's choice. In each case, the action on the space is taken, allowing players to obtain atoms or bonds, discard components, or draw individual or collective event cards.

Has anybody made one of the target molecules? The first player to finish has the right to compare his molecule with the ones listed on the objective card. If none of the target molecules has been constructed, he is in a position to create mischief for the other players.

(Paraphrased from the back of the box.)
mechanics: Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Capt'n Sharky: Ab auf die Palme
description:
Capt'n Sharky and his friends have discovered a new island. Right in the center of it, Sharky sees a large palm with many of coconuts. The friends decide to pick them off, but watch out - upwards is not the only way!

An exciting contest is about to start - who will reach the top first and pick the biggest coconut.

Players draw cards, showing which two characters they support. These Cards are kept hidden.
Each Player has a set of cards, allowing him to move various characters up and down the tree. The goal is to collect the most valuable coconuts with the own characters without being identified by the others, what would enable them to play negative cards on the right target. The player who's characters have collected the most valuable coconuts at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Camel Adventures
description:
Adventure game where players will travel worldwide, from Africa to America, from Asia to Australia. The game is divided in two main phases: during the first phase players will decide where to go, the right season, try to search a good sponsor supporting their expedition and buy the right items to survive.
During the second phase they'll leave for the expedition and try to do their best to avoid accidents and hazards also thanks to their equipment.
The winning player is the one completing the adventure first.

name: Samurai Wars: juego de simulación estratégica en el Japón medieval
description:
(From the Introduction)

Samurai Wars is a game sited in medieval Japan. Each player represents a "Grand Lord", confronted with the other players for the control of lands and resources (mines, hamlets, castles...) in a combination of stretegy, planification, risk, diplomacy and (mostly) war.

In a game turn, each player must collect his resources in order to pay his army and, or recruit new units. after he can attack at his rivals, or ally with others, or be betrayed for his former allies. In this confussed scenario also are present the peasants, sometimes violent, sometimes powerless..., and the Ninjas, special units who can kill a "Grand Lord", removing it for the game.

The game units are completd with infantry, bowmen (each represents ten men), and the powerfull samurais.

At the end of the game (20 turns), the winner is the player with most resources controlled. If there is a tie, the game is played one more turn.

name: Hey! That's My Tile!
description:
Hey! That's My Tile! is a dice-driven tile colleting game played with Nestortiels (1 Set of Nestortiles A-type and 1 pawn per player)
Players try to collect as many tiles as possible by moveing their pawn on a grid of 8x8 tiles.
Each player boulds his own die with 6 tiles. They roll thier dice and move to tiles of the colour or number the die shows. Players than replace one side of their die with the tile they moved on.
At the end of the game, it´s not only important to have a lot of tiles, but also to have tiles with different numbers and colours.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Think: Wort-Schatz
description: Image-based word association game. Consists of a variable board with 60 symbols and a deck of cards that show either a symbol or a letter. Players combine symbols from the board with symbols/letters from the cards to form either a compound noun or an adjective-noun combination. Play is simultaneous; the first player who manages to come up with a word/phrase that is based on a combination of the current card and a symbol on a space next to one of their six pawns moves that pawn to that space. The first player who manages to get their pawns to the finishing area wins.

name: Diception
description:
From the publisher's website:

"Welcome to the crazy, fast-paced, fun-for-the-whole-family world of Diception! A board game that takes less than two minutes to learn and a lifetime to master! It requires no special skills or abilities, but be cautioned, you never quite know who is bluffing and who is playing it straight!

Diception is similar to liar’s dice but adds a few twists of its own making it the perfect fun-for-the-whole-family board game! The included instruction booklet contains multiple different ways to play ensuring you will never get bored!

The strategy from person to person and hand to hand changes each time a new bid is made! Guess wrong and you lose a die, guess right and your opponent must surrender one of their precious cubes!

But wait, there is a a twist! Roll the Second Chance Cube, it could change your fortunes or maybe even the fortunes of the entire table!

To win and be crowned the Diceptor, be the last person still holding dice!

Diception is fast to play! An entire game can be played in as little as ten minutes making it the perfect play anytime anywhere board game! But it is so much fun to play you just might wind up playing for hours!

Each Diception board game comes with 20 dice, a Second Chance Cube, four high quality genuine leather tumblers, instruction booklet that reveals multiple different ways to play, and a convenient and durable carrying case, complete with carrying strap!"
publishers: Four Clowns Game & Toy Co, LLC

name: Graveyard Dash: Z-Day
description:
Graveyard Dash: Z-Day is the 100th game in the Bad Baby Productions Minigames Series and is a reimplementation to to the first game in the series, Graveyard Dash. In this game, up to three players are attempting to escape from a horde of zombies. There are rules for solitaire play as well. Players win by exiting their character pawn from the board to safety.

Reimplements

Graveyard Dash

name: Pirate Boom Treasure
description:
Captain Boom, the Pirate Chief, was fed up of watching his men argue amongst themselves every time it came to divvying up the treasure. After some deep thinking, he finally came up with a way to divide the treasure that used the things pirates love the most: dice and cards!

Now it's your turn to divide the treasure!

Become the richest of the Pirate Apprentices by collecting the largest part of the booty!
1. Roll the dice.
2. Play your cards to make them correspond to the results on the dice.
3. Help yourself to treasure based on the cards you used.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math, Pirates
publishers: BOOM Editions, Les jouets BOOM, Inc.

name: Zed by Dawn
description:
The world as you knew it has collapsed, flesh eating horrors from your worst nightmares walk the earth, and you're low on ammo..

Welcome to Zed by Dawn.

Object:
Zed by Dawn is a print-and-play solo survival horror dice and card game in the world of Zed Run!!! Before the Citystates, before the Gameshow, there were survivors that tirelessly fought the undead hordes; ZbD pits you against a world gone mad.

Zbd's Combat system requires the player to meet or exceed a number of successes that match the encounters target number, using a custom set of six-sided dice.

Each roll whether it be all six dice or just one die will use the survivors precious resources, Fatigue is use to perform melee attacks, ammo is used to perform ranged attacks and if your survivor is ever out of these resources, they cannot use the matching weapon.

Weapons will lower the needed number of successes to defeat encounters.

Items will be used to replenish your survivors resource pools.

Events encountered will hinder your advancement.

Survive to draw the last card in the ZbD deck and made it through the night. But what will tomorrow bring.

You must manage your resources, acquire supplies, and defeat an endless army of the walking dead; your only goal is to survive.

What you need to play
72 ZbD Cards
6 Survivor Cards
3 Resource Tracking dice (d20)
6 Combat dice (d6)
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Zombies

name: Hunt and Seek France
description:
The game contains 4 double sided boards, with a detailed image of location from France printed on each side. There is also a set of cards displaying objects that can be found on every board. The objects are hidden within the images so that they mingle with the background, making them hard to spot.

At the beginning of the game, a single board is selected. On each turn, a card is turned face up and players try to spot the object as fast as possible. The first one to do so wins the card. The winner is the player who accumulated the most cards.

name: Carré 13
description:
Carré 13 is a card game with a board. Cards (Carré's) exist in 4 kinds: 2 colours and 2 shapes, and have numbers from 1-13. The goal of the game is to be the first to empty your pile of 13 carré's. You can do this by placing them on to a free space, your opponent's pile, or in a row, matching the previous card. When you turn over a carré 13, your luck is tested. You could run into a lucky 13 or an unlucky 13.
This is a board game for those who love card games.

name: Nox Maze
description:
NOX MAZE is a horror game of wits and cards and dice for 2-6 mature players (4 is optimal). Players create the NOX MAZE by using two decks of cards: Doors & Rooms. Open doors allow players to pass between Rooms. Within rooms, players interact,
search, hide and fight. Once all twelve rooms are placed, any door that does not lead to another room is a way out. The first player to escape the maze, wins!

You will roll 2 to 5 six-sided dice to perform the following actions: OPEN, MOVE, SEARCH, HIDE, HELP or ATTACK. Throughout the game, you will search for HAND cards and try to avoid SKULL cards. HAND cards (Useful, Useless and Charmed items) help you defeat the maze, influence others, intimidate them, or just plain force them to do your will. SKULL cards (Bad Scares, Devious Traps, Wicked Hexes and Dark Entities) await those who roll below 9. Skulls can kill you or drive you insane.

In this game, you are YOU. Imagine yourself awakened in a dark room without knowing why or how you came to be there. Act as you might under those circumstances. Strike out on your own or explore as a group; it’s up to you. FAIR WARNING: few make it out of the maze alone. You must cooperate as you compete--tricky!

Delta version of the game can be downloaded at the game's website: http://www.noxmaze.com/
categories: Card Game, Horror, Mature / Adult, Maze, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Flip Football
description:
Fast paced action game. The board represents the football pitch and it has lots of holes into one of which the football will settle. Object of the game is to 'kick' the ball, by means of the 'boot' then smartly tap the coloured ring on the 'boot' with the forefinger of the right hand. The ball will then rise and drop on to the playing field. A little practice will make you quite expert at this. A completely different game but the idea of catapulting the ball on to the board is reminiscent of games like Flying Hats. After a pre-agreed time, the winner is the one who has scored the most goals.

Playing instructions are inside top of box

The box image illustrates the game rather well

name: Mein Taschengeld!
description: How do I get more pocket money and what I do best with it? This eternal question of children's attempts gets answer with this game, with all sorts of activities players may spend their pocket money. Players learn to count money and also convert one currency to another - there are Deutch Marks and Euros in this game. The mechanism is simple - roll - move - follow instructions of the target field.

name: Alpen DKT
description:
DKT, das kaufämnnische Talent, is an Austrian pendant for the well-known Monopoly. This version is very similar to »DKT dynamic«, but it has some party-elements.
As in DKT dynamic the goal is to pay back the starting money. The prices of the alpine regions change with the seasons. On two fields, all the players have to perform a task (depending on the season). The last one has to pay …

Hier wird in den alpinen Tourismus investiert. Die Spieler erstehen Grundstücke in den Alpen und versuchen sie durch den Ausbau mit Hütten und Hotels lukrativ zu machen, ihr Geld zu mehren und schuldenfrei zu werden. Sommer- und Wintertourismus erfordern unterschiedliche Aktivitäten und Touristenattraktionen.

name: Froschkonzert für die Prinzessin
description:
The frogs sing a lullaby to the princess. Some frogs, however, want to catch flies rather than singing and that's what you have to smuggle themselves into the choir and catch the other players in this smuggling. Each player place a card face down on the bed and says a spell or he doubts that all the frogs sing out really, who has cheated or who doubted wrongly loses a frog.
Player who has the biggest frog choir at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy

name: Lectron Junior
description: Children will have great fun with the lectron junior developing their powers of observation, visual discrimination and shape recognition. as they play, children will also learn to follow rules and develop their social skills. In addition to explaining how the game works, parents and educators can also make exelent playmates and enhance the game's educational value. The purpose of the game is to recognize various shapes and numbers and connect them to each other using the magnetic stick. when the shapes and numbers are matched correct, a light will flash on on the magnetic stick.

name: Knopf Mau Mau
description: The buttons are having a party, they always pair up in twos, either with the same colour or the same shape. One white button is strung onto the bracelet, all other buttons go into the bag. All players in turn draw buttons from the bag until they have five, one button is placed in the middle of the table. In your turn you may discard a button when it has the same shape or the same color as the button in the middle. The old button is taken out of the game. If you have no button to discard, you draw a button from the bag and may try to feel for the shape beforehand. White Lucky Buttons can be placed anytime. If you are the first to discard all your buttons you win and get the bracelet to wear, if you win the next round, you win the game.

name: Brainrun
description:
A trivia game with a tactical component and direct confrontation (using cards to buy other questions/cards, stealing cards from other players).

The game consists of 300 question cards in five categories: geography & history, humanities & arts, science & technology, economy & politics, entertainment & sports.

To win the game, a player has to collect one card from each of the five categories. Each of the cards contain two or three questions. To win a card, a player has to answer all the questions (except for the "guesstimation" one) on a card.

The cards are shuffled and two cards are placed, face up, on the table. The front side shows the card's category and what types of questions it contains. Questions come in different levels of difficulty, and there are yes/no questions and "guesstimation" questions where a number has to be guessed. The active player chooses one of the two cards. If they can answer all the questions on it, they win the card, if not, the card is removed from the game. Then the pool is filled up so that there are two cards again, and it's the next player's turn.

A player can have more than one card from the same category. These extra cards can be used to avoid having to answer one particular question, or three from the same category can be exchanged for one from a different category.

For questions marked as difficult, the active player can ask the questioner for a possible answer (which the questioner has to make up), turning it into a yes/no question. Not doing so, however, has an advantage as well: If a player can answer a difficult question without help, they earn an additional turn.

Special rule for the "guesstimation" questions (only when three or more are playing): Instead of trying for a new card from the pool, the active player can decide to "attack" a player of his/her choice. The next player not involved in the attack reads the guesstimation question from the top card of the card stack. The attacked player has to state a number, then the attacker states his/her estimation. The player whose guess is closest to the correct answer may steal a card of his/her choice from the other player; that card now counts as one of their own.

The game ends as soon as one player has won one card from each of the five categories.

name: ART DECO
description:
An Inheritance game for two to seven players

Your Great Aunt Hattie has passed away and named you in her will. All she left behind was a (sizeable) bank account and her collection of ART DECO prints from the 1920’s. Aunt Hattie was a bit eccentric - and created a game for her inheritors. If you want your share of the (sizeable) family bank, you’ll have to play! Inheritors start with a stake from the bank, and continually draw money from the pool to bid on Art Prints until all have been won. Each print is assigned points. The Inheritor who gains the most points takes home the entire collection - and the balance of the bank!

Each round, players roll dice [the bid]. Highest roll pays the difference between his die roll and the low die roll and gets the print [card]. If high roll is tied, everybody gets double the roll in chips and the card goes in the discard pile. Winning a Wild Card allows you to choose any card from the discard pile.

Cards range in points from 2 - 12. The 2 - 5 point cards may be 'DOUBLED DOWN', but the 6 - 12 point cards may not. During scoring, each DOUBLED DOWN card doubles the entire score of a color group. All chips accumulated score as well. Highest total wins.

ART DECO is primarily a party game, but is popular at Conventions and any activity with groups. Suitable for young and old.

COMPONENTS:

A 75 card deck of ART DECO prints.


For the two player game, only use the Color Cards that have between 2 and 5 points. Color cards are arranged into five color groups, or sets. There are an extra fifteen Wild Cards in the deck have no points on them - for the two player game, only use five.

Rules are on an additional 12 cards.
you'll need to provide your dice and poker chips.


AVAILABILITY:

ART DECO is only available from The Game Crafters website.

name: Kai Xin Guo
description:
After dealing out all cards to each player equally, Players will play one card each round, starting with the first player, and rotating to the right. Cards are played by alternating face-up and face-down: the first card each round is played face down, the next card is played face up, and the third card is played face down, and so on, until each player has played one card. Starting again with the first player, everyone will take one card of their choice, choosing either a face-up card, or pressing their luck by choosing a face-down card.

The cards represent different fruits, with varying number values. Players are trying to get the highest values into their stack. There are also three special cards:
Super-fruit: this card will double the value of a single fruit card,
Caterpillar: the hungry caterpillar will reduce the value of one or more cards by half,
Pistachio: the delicious nut will lure a caterpillar away, canceling out one caterpillar card.

After all cards are exhausted, scoring begins. Highest score wins.

name: King's Critters
description:
For many years, the King’s Royal Zoo has housed an odd collection of exotic Critters from across the kingdom. Only now, the Zoo is empty. A Dragon has been sleeping for centuries beneath a nearby mountain and has recently awoken. Intrigued by the King’s menagerie, the Dragon has stolen all the Critters from the Zoo and taken them back to its lair!

You and your fellow adventurers have answered the King’s call for help and volunteered to enter the Dragon’s lair to rescue the Critters, with the promise of great rewards for your efforts. The more Critters you bring back, the greater the reward.

Carrying a Magical Cart for your journey, how many Critters can you rescue? Sneak around the sleeping Dragon, and be careful not to wake it as you attempt to capture the King’s Critters!

Game Data:

Complexity: 2.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 3 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each player plays a Hero attempting to rescue Critters from the clutches of the Dragon.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Barcelona
description:
A quick 2-card gambling game.

The game is played with a standard deck of cards (without Jokers), divided into two deck -- one red and one black.

Each turn starts with a one coin ante, then each player is dealt one card from each deck, so that each player has one red and one black card.

Simultaneously each player reveals one card -- either red or black. Then the player with the lowest card showing decides either to drop out or to force a showdown. Since it goes from lowest to highest, not every player will have the opportunity to drop out before the showdown occurs.

When the showdown occurs, everyone shows both of their cards. The player with the highest black card wins. Everyone else (except for those who dropped out) then pay the winning player a number of coins equal to the value of the red card (aces are worth 1 coin, and face cards are worth 10 coins). The winner also gets the antes. If there is no showdown, the surviving player gets the antes.

This game is part of the Cheapass Games Poker Suite that was released on the Cheapass website.

name: De Grote Efteling Kennisquiz
description:
This trivia game was released for the 60th aniversary of the Dutch theme park Efteling in 2012. The game contains 255 questions (most of them are multiple choice) in 5 different categories:

- Fairy tales
- Park's history
- Rides and attractions
- Shows and muic
- Interesting facts and figures

The game comes in tin box with a small game board (to determine the question categories) and score cards/tokens to keep track of the score. The one wih the most positive scores when one player has a full score card, wins the game.

name: Die drei ??? Kids: Fußball-Alarm
description:
Objective: gain as many cards (max. 5) as possible forming/collecting a set of same images
- acting by turns -
form two piles - draw and drop (trash); the very last card of the trash (7 in the beginning) remains visible, all other cards are hidden; each player is dealt 5 (maximum amount) cards.
active player throws the die:
card? Draw a card;
question mark? Look through the trash and draw a card;
thunderbolt? If you don't own the 'yellow card' - draw a card from another player and flip a round marker (totally 7);
if you possess the yellow card: draw a card as usual;
the player who lost a card gets the 'yellow card';
at the end of a draw all players must reduce/fill their no. of cards up to 5 .
Game ends if all round marker are flipped or if one player owns a set of 5 identical cards.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Wild Patterns
description:
Wild Patterns - A game of fast perception

Wild Patterns is a family board game offering a mixture of fast perception, problem solving, and tactics.

The aim is to find patterns shown on your cards from the different colored wooden tiles constantly moving around the game board. The trickier the pattern, the more points they give. Constant changes within patterns cause sudden and surprisingly tricky situations.

You better be fast, because patterns can be scored at any time, even during other players' turn.

Keep focused, wild patterns are on the move!

Game duration is less than half an hour. The Game can be played by 2-6 players from ages 8 and up. Rules are simple and quick to comprehend.
Wild Patterns can be played as a short & easy or a long & tricky version.

---

Villit Kuviot - nopean hahmottamisen peli

Villit Kuviot on nopeaa hahmottamista, ongelmanratkaisua ja taktiikkaa yhdistävä hauska koko perheen lautapeli. Yhden pelin kesto on noin puoli tuntia ja peli sopii sekä lapsille, että aikuisille. Pelin säännöt ovat helpot ja pelin oppii välittömästi.

Pelissä yritetään laudalla olevia värillisiä puukuutioita liikuttelemalla muodostaa kädessä oleviin kortteihin merkittyjä kuvioita. Pelin voittaa pelaaja, joka saa valmiiksi eniten korttien mukaisia kuvioita.

Pelissä pelilaattojen muutokset aiheuttavat hauskoja ja yllättäviä tilanteita. Pisteitä voi jopa tehdä vastustajien pelivuorojen aikana. Nopea visuaalinen hahmottaminen on tärkeää. Peli sopii kaikenlaisille pelaajille iästä riippumatta.

Pelaaja voi valita oman pelitaktiikkansa. Rakentamalla pieniä helppoja kuvioita saa vähemmän pisteitä, mutta enemmän kuvioita valmiiksi. Rakentamalla vaikeampia isoja kuvioita, pelaaja saa enemmän pisteitä, mutta ottaa riskin, että kuviota ei saakaan valmiiksi.

Nuoremmat lapset voivat pelata peliä ilman vaikeimpia kuvioita, kun taas haastetta kaipaavat voivat jättää pelistä helpot kuviot pois. Kun kokemus kertyy voi mukaan ottaa vaikeimmat erikoiskuviokortit, jotka antavat lisähaastetta.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Das Pfadfinderspiel: Wir wollten mal auf Großfahrt gehen
description:
From the publisher's website:
"The Scouts play - We wanted to go to Great ride".
A game for two to four players of game Author Jens Karkosz calls strategy and luck equally, offers fun, wit and the original illustrations by Michael Brux. Karkosz processed years of experience as a child and group manager in this game. So its clear-ambiguous allusions hit precisely the special atmosphere that can only offer a large warehouse.
Cubs, scouts and rovers are thrilled - Head infected by gambling fever. Thus, "The Scouts play" holds real potential for cult game and permanent companion in camp. But also a must for those who can not wait for the next camp and seeking to shorten the days of the year to do it again big ride.

I try to describe the game:

The aim of the game is to win six scout badge. The badge I get through certain cards or by completing tasks. These tasks are also on the cards.
First, by the nature of the character cards of the players is determined. Then, each player receives two cards preparation, 2 storage cards and 2 equipment cards. These 6 cards are my cards in hand. The entire card will be divided into three types (preparation, storage and equipment) set ready as separate pile.
By pulling the card out of these stacks, the game evolves and I can by completing tasks or by the pull of certain cards to collect the required badge.
Whoever collects the first six badges, wins the game.

name: Cloak of Protection
description:
Whether any animal on our beautiful planet has a future is determined by how it can respond to the environmental cards dealt out by the cold & sweeping hand of fate.

For thousands of years in isolated Aotearoa New Zealand our largest browsers and predators were birds. The around 1280AD, everything changed. New predators arrived, and they swept the birds before them..

To save the birds of Aotearoa New Zealand you need to create a feather cloak in one bird realm: forest, settlement, sea, or extinct. Trade, draw, & play, to build a 15-card triangle-shape cloak.

But whenever you pick up a predator card, your birds are in danger! If both bird & predator card have matching (same illus, same position) icons on the grid down the RHS - then that bird gets eaten (discarded). There are cards you can play that keep the predators at bay (god-cards, wild-card Pandora), and ways to draw more cards (music-note on card = pick-up). They are powerful, but occur in limited numbers. You cannot save everything - so can you still make a feather cloak?
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Mythology, Negotiation

name: BattleTech: Record Sheets – Prototypes
description:
Publisher Blurb:

You've grasped the tactics involved with the additional units and weapons from Tactical Operations to defeat your opponents. Now you own Technical Readout: Prototypes and want to deploy some of those 'Mechs, vehicles, and battle armor on your gaming table. Grab your dice and start rolling, because these sheets are for you! Record Sheets: Prototypes contains 30 pre-printed 'Mech record sheets that will have players firing autocannons, missiles and PPCs at each other in no time. More than 60 additional record sheets-from vehicles to battle armor, ProtoMechs to aerospace fighters and DropShips-bring the excitement of combined-arms game play to any table top. Two ready to-play scenarios focus on the highlights of this volume, while an extensive Rules Addendum section, including Design Quirks, provides a sneak peek of all the advanced rules options provided in Strategic Operations.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Ruckus Deadly 60
description:
A speed game of card matching.

Opponents race to get rid of the cards in their hands by matching identical types of deadly animals. Once a match is made it is laid face up in front of you. Opponents will 'steal' the tricks in front of you if they have a matching card. The first person to lose all their cards shouts "Deadly Ruckus!", and gets a 5 point bonus for going out first. All players then gain 1 point for each card in front of them, and minus 1 for each card in their hand.

The process of stealing tricks from other players if you have a single matching card gives the game something of a fatal flaw in that slower players gain more cards in front of them.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Versteck dich, kleine Schnecke!
description: Notwithstanding the title of this game – Versteck dich, kleine Schnecke! – the snail will not hide itself, but will instead need help from at least one of the players. Playable either indoors and out, this game of hide and seek has one player turning over a color chip, then hiding the game's snail in a location matching this color. The other players then work together to hunt down the snail, or chase it down individually to find it, salt it, and take a bite in triumph before anyone else can get their hands on it.

name: Jake and the Neverland Pirates: Auf Schatzjagd
description:
As in the television show of the same name, in Jake and the Neverland Pirates: Auf Schatzjagd players want to collect doubloons – ten doubloons, to be precise – and to find those coins they need to assemble the Neverland crew of Jake, Izzy and Cubby.

To set up the game, place the 24 doubloon tokens – six each of Jake, Izzy, Cubby and Captain Hook, with six different backgrounds total – face down on the table and mix them up, then place the six adventure cards (which match the backgrounds on the doubloons) on the table.

On a turn, a player turns over a doubloon. If it shows Captain Hook, her turn ends and she places the Hook token face-up on the table; if not, she can draw again or stop her turn. She can continue her turn as long as she doesn't reveal a Hook token or until she reveals a token that has a Neverland character or a background that matches a token already revealed that turn. In the latter case, you place the tokens on the adventure cards of the same color; in the former case, you leave Hook face-up and shuffle all the tokens in hand with those still on the table.

Each adventure card will say either two or three doubloons on it, and when that card has two or three tokens on it, the players score those coins, placing them in their treasure chest and returning any other tokens to the mix, then remove that adventure card from the game. If a token with this background is later revealed, the players score it immediately.

Whenever the players think they have at least ten tokens in their chest, they can stop the game to count their loot. If correct, they win! The game also ends if the players draw the sixth Captain Hook token – but if they've already collected at least ten doubloons, they still win!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Pirates
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Eindhoven
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Eindhoven, in the Netherlands.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Identity Games International B.V., Winning Moves Germany

name: Bull
description: Much like Liar's Dice and other bluffing games, Bull uses 4 sets of cards numbered 1 to 11 as well as 4 Wild Cards and 2 "Bull" cards. Players play cards face down and make an annoucement concerning what those cards are. If someone challenges, then if the player was telling the truth, the challenger takes the cards. If not, the annoucing player keeps the cards. Scoring is based on the value of the cards players take and the lowest score wins.

name: American Trivia Family Edition
description:
American Trivia Family Edition features mostly knowledge-based content rather than trivial tidbits. Family Edition cards have two sides - one with easier questions (Junior side) and the other with more difficult questions (Expert side), allowing families of all ages to play together.

The goal is to answer the most questions correctly to advance along the map of the United States and return back to the Start.

name: Salvage Team
description:
Salvage Team is a tile-based board game about looting starship wreckages. The players control a group of salvagers who loot valuables off wrecks before massive recyclers reduce them to metal bricks.

The players build a group of salvagers and define their team leader. As long as the group travels together they can use their leader's abilities and properties. Alone, however, they can cover more ground, but are more vulnerable to threats and other salvagers.

At the end of each round, each player's Recyclers remove one tile from the game board. The goal of Salvage Team is to get as much loot off the wreck before the last tiles are eaten. The game can be played in a single match or a longer campaign.

name: The Kuromaku: Domination of Japan
description:
"Kuro-maku" (literal translation is "black curtain") means "wirepuller" in Japanese. This game was designed under the influence of Illuminati.

The game of conflict for domination of Japan in modern age. Companies and organizations in the game is fictitious, however they have a name reminiscent of a real organization.

Each player take one character card. Each card represents a person that have ambitions to domination of Japan. They have basic abilities, special ability and victory condition. So, each player performs a wirepuller behind black curtain of Japanese society.

Organization cards is another type of card in play. These cards are represent a corporation, political party, government agencies or other group. In the game play, players control many organization and appoint to one of five section of their syndicate. Money section is use for income, other four sections is use for attack to other organization.

In each turn, players first receive income and then take two actions from attack, recover, re-organize, exchange or pass.

The game is end who achieve personal victory condition or time limit. In later case, winner determined by most powerful attack ability in each syndicate.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building

name: Penguin Land
description: A fast paced game where you have to be really quick if you want to be the last penguin standing. In this fast paced game of penguin tug-o-war, each player spins his snowball as fast as possible until all of your opponent's penguins slide out of the tray.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game, Racing

name: Disney Family Trivia
description:
Straightforward trivia game by the High Street department store of Marks & Spencer.

Contains 150 questions that relate to Walt Disney characters. Most correct answers after a pre-agreed time, wins.

Note:
Isn't it amazing that a film made before WWII will still be known by any eight year olds who play this game (Snow White for example - even Steamboat Willie gets a question!)?

name: Monopoly: Bradford
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Bradford, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Vigo
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Vigo, in Spain.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Silence on tourne
description:
You will play the role of a performer, a producer, a director or a film technician.

You move on a circular game board with a ± die, and must answer questions correctly to advance and earn points. These points are determined by your status report (as a performer, director, etc.) and ± the difficulty of the question (each card has a difficulty easy, medium or hard).

If a player can not answer, his opponents can take the question, Iif the player answers incorrectly he recieves 20 penalty points.

The first player to reach 250 points wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Riot
description:
Britain is broken.
Things are not well in the Big Society.
But this time the mob has the edge... Mobile phones.

Riot is a free print and play solitaire card game based on the 2011 UK riots.

Your phone bleeps with a text.. what's up. Draw a card, maybe the riot police are on their way or its kicked of at the retail park.

Pick a Location card to raid, roll the dice see how your boys & girls do. Might get arrested and lose dice or you might get new trainers,TV's, phones. You only have 6 turns to loot locations, grab as much as you can and move on before things get too hot.
Choose where you crews going next to maximise your haul but lose all your dice and its game over.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: New Zealand Menagerie
description:
Menagerie highlights the diverse range of New Zealand's wildlife and some of the threats to the survival of these animals. You are in control of a nature reserve, with three habitat types (High Country, Forest and Coastal) which will be filled with breeding populations of suitable animals. Each turn a player draws a card and must either play animals into their habitats or discard a card. The game ends once a player has been able to play all the cards from their hands.

With the introduction of Threat cards the games difficulty can be scaled for the level of the players (young or adult). Players are able to cast threats (e.g. fire, pollution, feral animals) that will knock out susceptible animals in play from the game. Players also have the ability to purchase protections from these threats before they come out.

name: Celebrity Throw Down!
description:
From the publisheräs website:
Celebrity Throw Down! is the game where trendy stars, pop culture icons and historical legends face off in the ultimate game of elimination. All players select what they think are the best celebrities for an ordinary or outlandish, “ripped from the tabloid headlines” situation. If your celebrity is the one to survive the multiple elimination rounds and is the last one standing, you win! For example, one player draws a situation card that reads “Who is the best celebrity to … play Truth or Dare?” Each player chooses and submits a Celebrity Card from their hand of four cards. Maybe Jennifer Aniston, Kanye West, Honey Boo Boo and Marilyn Monroe are competing in this round. Players now take turns eliminating the celebrity least suited for the situation until just one remains, and a winner is crowned. With almost 300 celebrities and 162 situations, the possibilities are endlessly entertaining!

name: Order and Chaos
description: Order and Chaos is played on a 6x6 square grid. On a turn a player writes either an X or an O in any empty space. The object of the first player (Order) is to complete a line of five Xs or five Os in any direction. The object of the other player (Chaos) is to prevent this.

name: What?!? Oh...
description:
In What?!? Oh... Couples Banter, players turn quibbles into jokes, bickering into banter, and all around ridiculousness into a winning distraction. It's a game of easy improv where the sport of talking meets the challenge of listening.

Each card has either a simple phrase, a fill-in-the-blank phrase, or an action. As players play their cards back and forth, a conversation is created on the fly. Listen carefully for Questions and Demands or you will lose the round!

It's a game for anyone that likes to talk.

name: 16-Bit RPG: The Board Game
description:
Long ago, in a decade not so far away, there existed video games so legendary their legacies carry on to this very day.

16-Bit RPG: The Board Game is exactly that: a board game that pays homage to a time period in video game history gone by. A period that holds a very special place in the hearts of many!

Collect loot, gear your character, use skills, fight monsters and progress through the world until you’re ready to take on one of the mighty Final Bosses!

- Classic RPG styled pixel art
- Easy to learn loot collecting board game
- Skills and Events offer variance in each game

Gameplay

During Your Turn you roll the dice and move the spaces to see what happend; like finding loot, entering on a market or fighting a monster! You use your cards to deal with the adventures by equiping wargear or using items like potions.
You play until one player gets to defeat the final boss.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Occam's Razor: The Diagnostician's Dilemma
description:
Occam's Razor is a card game designed to teach health sciences students and clinicians about medical diagnoses.

The instructions suggest four play variants, including basic set collection, competitive set matching, deduction, and solitaire play.

1. Be the first to deduce the hidden disease card.

2. Gin Rummy: collect the highest scoring hand of matching symptoms.

3. Solitaire: Match symptoms in order to clear all of your face-down piles.

4. Spoons: no medical knowledge needed.

name: BattleStack
description:
The Dutch game association Ducosim publishes the game magazine Spel!. With this magazine they will publish several 'Spel!enkaarten' (gamecards). These are games which fit on a A5 card. #0009 is BattleStack and was published for the SpellenSpektakel convention.

The game is a diceless variant of Katoiz. Just as in that game, the board consists of a 6x6 board build up with tiles. These tiles have 3 characteristics: form (square, triangle or circle), color (blue, red, green, yellow or white) and size (big or small). Next to that, each player puts a home tile next to one of the corners in his own color. To move the tiles around you can move a tile horizontally of vertically if 1 characteristic with the adjacent tile corresponds. To move diagonally, 2 characteristics have to correspond. Different to Katoiz, instead of rolling dice to determine which tile you can move on your turn, here you move tiles in a fixed order by color.

The aim of the game is to collect a stack of four tiles on your home tile.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Building, Set Collection
publishers: Darmstadt spielt, Ducosim, Österreichisches Spiele Museum e.V.

name: BA-KAR-EE
description:
Rare card game that uses standard playing cards with the addition of 8 Royal Aces and eight Jokers. As there are two packs, this makes a total of 120 cards per game.

The game is a curious mix of Rummy and Whist. Each player gets 18 cards dealt to them. There now begins a phase of drawing and discarding until a player lays down a run or set of 5 cards (5 Nines or a run of five, for example). Bonuses and penalties are then scored and every player must reduce their hand to 13 cards.

Then the auction begins and one player (or team if playing partnerships) will win the auction and then need to make that many tricks as bid. Card play is exactly the same as standard games like Whist. Royal Aces secured in this phase (or Release) score sizeable bonus points.

It can be seen that strategy is needed at every phase. If you use a high scoring 5 cards in the first stage (known as Release), the cards used will not be available to you for the auction and card-play in the 2nd phase.

The object is to be the first player (or partnership) to score 1,000 points.

name: Walt Disney Rescue Rangers
description:
A rettenthetetlen Csipet Csapat barátaik segítségére indul. Segíts nekik megkeresni és visszahozni őket a Rendőrség épületébe. De vigyázz! Az ellenség is résen van...

Az eredeti használati utasítás nincs meg. A játékot a repülődarabok összegyűjtésével kezdjük. Ha megvan mind a négy, akkor már repülve közlekedhetünk a házak között. Meg kell találni a hiányzó karaktereket és vissza kell vinni őket a Rendőrség épületébe.


Braveheart Rescue Rangers are on way to help their friends. Help find and bring them back to the police station. But beware! The enemy is on guard ...

The original manual is missing. First you have to collect all parts of a plane. After collected all you can flight through houses. You have to find and keep the missing characters until you can bring them back to the police station.

This game is Language Level 1.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ATS: Fateful Stand
description:
It is the Battle of the Bulge and once again some of the finest soldiers ever birthed by a great nation ... are standing firm ... against the violent force of an entire Panzer Division. There is no turning back on the road to Bastogne, the linchpin to Hitler's last offensive ... and the scene of Fateful Stand ... replete with new counter art, a full collection of combat counters in Winter gear and camo schemes. Baby, it's cold outside! But we aim to warm the hearts of tactical-level gamers north and south of the equator.

COMPONENT-WISE: ATS Fateful Stand is an ATS Expansion. Requires ownership of any ATS Complete game or the ATS Rules, Play Aids, status markers to play.

This is a ziplock ATS Historical Module that includes everything you need to play just bring your ATS Rulebook/Play Aids/10-sided dice. The counters are the original ATS --3/4", 5/8"-- widths, and you receive all the counters and markers you need to play. The map is 'winterized' for evocative gaming, historical leaders straight from 'Band of Brothers' ... winter whitewashed tanks ... it is ALL there for your to enjoy.

name: Scout
description:
A solo game in which you attempt to find the Gumdrop card and carry it to the end of one of the four 15-card decks. You need to carry a needle to get past a spider and cannot carry a needle or the gumdrop over rough terrain.

The designer and artist are marked as "Wolfgang and Sons".

name: Enadrya
description:
Enadrya TCG is a Trading Card Game, the first game published by Silvercow Games.

You must fight with humans, bythros or akhris, to gain the supremacy of the Enadrya world, and his precious mineral dril. Each player has a deck of soldiers of one of the races and fights the other races using a limited amount of energy. The goal of the game is to destroy the enemy base.

This games combines Trading Card Games with Grid Movement. Also the energy generation per turn and the defense is determined by a special card in the deck called Base.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Kanzume Goddess: Thor, God of Thunder
description:
Promo god for Kanzume Goddess.

Thor is a Norse god, with the War Drum and Smash abilities that enable you to pay energy to gain benefits during an attack or the discard phase.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Hoshilympics
description:
Hoshilympics is a card game which challenges you to a clothes drying competition. You must select clothes to attempt to dry by looking at the daily weather forecast. Drying laundry on nice days scores points. But, if you try to dry laundry on rainy days, you will receive a negative score.
